description:
Position Objective
Secure and connect corporate network infrastructure with a focus on Zero Trust principles.
Ensuring seamless network operations, robust security, and efficient coordination. Design and lead engineering projects to ensure seamless network connection from on-premise application to cloud service.

Major Areas of Accountability
1. Network Operations Management Designing network configurations, managing and configuring network hardware such as routers, switches, and firewalls, and performing network maintenance.

5. Network address management and planning : Maintain corporate accurate network address records and resolve network connection issues.

Responsibilities include performance tuning, backup and recovery, database design, implementation, and monitoring. Work closely with developers to optimize queries and provide technical support. Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment are essential.

title: System Administrator

location: 2575 Sand Hill Rd, Menlo Park, CA 94025
description:
SLAC Job Postings

Position overview:
Stanford Synchrotron Radiation Lightsource (SSRL) is a national scientific user facility and a Directorate of the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory that is operated by Stanford University. SSRL operates ~30 beamline stations that enable research in areas such as materials, chemistry, catalysis, biology, medical, and environmental sciences.
SSRL is seeking a highly motivated Systems Administrator to be part of a dynamic scientific research environment. This is a truly hands-on position. You will be responsible for day-to-day system administration of the SSRL beam line Windows and Linux computers systems. This includes supporting systems hardware and software related to beam line operations and scientific data acquisition. You will provide information technology (IT) support and collaborate closely with our staff scientist, engineers, programmers and visiting scientific users to ensure computer system reliability, and a superior experience for our experimental users.
Your specific responsibilities include:
Install, manage, maintain operating systems, utilities, and applications software on beamline computer systems, including but not limited to Linux distributions and Windows systems.
Resolve system issues with significant impact on the integrity of user data and the data acquisition systems with urgency, at times this includes work outside of normal working hours.
Manage hardware and software modifications, troubleshooting, maintenance, backups, upgrades of operating systems, and workstations environments, including all computer peripherals.
Triage computing issues with the ability to differentiate between networking, hardware, and applications levels accordingly.
Collaborate with staff to define system software/hardware specifications.
Monitor and analyze resource usage for system performance optimization.
Configure and maintain system cyber security strategies, following SLAC and SSRL policies and procedures.
Collaborate with beam line staff to fully comprehend computing workflow as it relates to beam line controls and data acquisition.
Manage product life cycle management for computing systems.
Document systems infrastructure for users, beam line support staff and SSRL IT group administrators.
Maintain knowledge of new hardware, operating systems, software, best practices, current industry trends, and how it may apply to the existing infrastructure.
Attend training to keep skills current.
Use automation and scripting tools to manage existing and future systems.
Function as a technical liaison for scientific division beamline computer system administration.
Other duties may also be assigned.
To be successful in this position you will bring:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer information systems, computer engineering, or related field and 5 years of relevant experience in system administration.
Experience with complex multi-system platforms and vendors.
Understanding of networks, network equipment, network segmentation, and TCP/UDP protocols.
Ability to take initiative independently while maintaining broad communications with team members.
Advanced knowledge of security trends, best practices, and security protocols.
Knowledge and understanding of remote access tools and applications
Shell/command line capabilities via Windows and Linux distributions.
Experience with LDAP and Active Directory
Ability to identify and manage priorities.
Demonstrate strong conceptual, logical, and critical thinking skills.
SLAC employee competencies:
Effective Decisions: Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.
Self-Development: Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing.
Dependability: Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes.
Initiative: Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward.

In Person Interviews
the expert on Windows Server administration, along with the responsibility to ensure the availability of the products for the application teams and end users. Will also be responsible for evaluating, preparing, and recommending technical solutions, as well as troubleshooting complex problems with a wide variety of applications. The Technical Architect Specialist position requires significant expert experience and skills in the products being supported. The Technical Architect Specialist will usually also have significant experience in the operating environment(s) (e.g., HP/UX, Windows, Linux, etc.) on which the product is implemented. The Technical Architect Specialist is responsible for collaborating with System Specialists, Programmers and vendors to ensure and enhance the use of the product and effect migration to new versions of a product.

Role Description:
Responsible for functioning as the Technical SME on an enterprise-wide system.
Responsible for implementations of products/services that involve significant Commonwealth and federal oversight.
Provides direct technical expertise to Executive applications involving national security.
Delivers support and design for industry specific applications that require integration with statewide systems or applications.
Interacts with executive level business users or technical experts.

Identifies improvements to project standards to achieve high quality services/products.

description:
Overview:
Trissential is a trusted partner for end-to-end quality services and management consulting. As a part of our parent company Expleo, we have a footprint in 30+ countries. Our Mission is to have a positive impact on every person who interacts with Trissential. Clients love us because we are service focused. Employees love us because they are valued and cared for.

Trissential is seeking a Consultant, ADMS System Administrator to join our client team in a hybrid role, with onsite presence required on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday in either Minneapolis, MN or Lubbock, TX. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of experience, along with hands-on expertise in ADMS, Windows 10/11, Active Directory, and Patch Management. They will be responsible for system maintenance, configuration, and optimization, while supporting applications by making necessary changes and fixing errors. This role requires a proactive, collaborative individual with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work well with others. The ideal candidate should be adept at translating business requirements into technical solutions and building strong relationships with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. This role is open only to candidates authorized to work and reside in the US.
Responsibilities:
Install, modify, document, and maintain system configurations based on performance and stability requirements
Analyze system performance to optimize configurations and enhance operational stability
Develop scripts to automate routine maintenance and support tasks
Investigate, identify, and resolve issues related to complex systems, including production incidents and alerts
Provide technical support for systems testing, validation, and production incidents
Support applications, make changes, and fix errors promptly
Offer guidance to users on available technologies, translating their needs into practical, scalable solutions
Clearly communicate operational status, outcomes, and recommendations both in meetings and in written reports
Engage with vendor partners and internal teams to ensure smooth system operations and foster long-term collaborations
Qualifications:
Hands-on experience with system administration, including ADMS, Windows 10/11, Active Directory, and Patch Management
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience
Proven experience with system administration, system monitoring, and operational maintenance
Experience with scripting and automation for routine system tasks
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to manage complex systems
Eagerness to learn and collaborate effectively with others
Essential skills:
ADMS, Windows 10/11, Active Directory, and Patch Management
System configuration and optimization
Scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash)
Incident and problem management
Communication and collaboration with users, technical teams, and vendors
Active listening and the ability to understand and anticipate stakeholder needs
Technical documentation and reporting
Desired skills:
Experience working in a hybrid team environment
Familiarity with cloud-based systems (AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience working with vendor management and service level agreements
Experience:
3-5 years of experience in a Systems Administrator or similar role
Hands-on experience in system operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and supporting applications, making changes, and fixing errors
Benefits:
Trissential offers a competitive compensation package for full time roles. The pay range for this role is $100,000 to $110,000 annually depending on candidate's qualifications and experience. This role is eligible for benefits and includes options for medical, dental, vision, and tele-health benefits; Health Savings Account with company contribution; 3 weeks PTO, and 401k retirement savings.

When you join New York Life, you’re joining a company that values career development, collaboration, innovation, and inclusiveness. Description:
The Actuarial Model Infrastructure team within Actuarial Services seeks a competent Finance Tech Administrator to assist with supporting actuarial users and processes within our vendor’s (FIS Global) cloud-based system environment (PMCS - Prophet Managed Cloud Service). This role will administer, support, and engage all NYL business units to provide a stable environment and assist with process improvement/automation efforts. Appropriate Training will be provided.

Responsibilities:
The System Administrator will support the management of actuarial uses, roles, software, and infrastructure used to run our financial models in support of financial reporting and company management. The administrator will provide Level-2 support to the actuarial community and work with Level-2-4 IT support for software, applications, and hardware used for Financial Modeling. The administrator will be a key individual assisting with the testing and implementation of Production ready financial models across the Actuarial units within the Insurance, Investment, Corporate and Strategic Divisions of the company.
Troubleshoot, Monitor and resolve issues within PMCS environment
End user support / troubleshooting / tickets
Access permissions - maintain Access Control List (ACL).
Model Workspace Deployments across Prophet Enterprise application domains
Proactively monitor storage use and execute archive/data retention processes
Liaise with NYL Enterprise technology and Software vendor (FIS)
Document systems, processes, and assets
Some minor development (10%) with custom tools/scripts written in PowerShell, C#, VB.net, SQL Server (query and stored procedures)
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (AWS-Amazon Web Services)
Support users and administrating PMCS applications (PE-Prophet Enterprise, AM-Assumptions Manager, PCC-Prophet Control Center : a Vendor Automation Platform, FIS Scheduler) experience

Qualifications:
Qualify applicants should have the following:
Ability to prioritize and organize multiple efforts
Attention to details
Able to document detail processes and software functionalities
Understand and utilize various flow charts and diagrams, such as UML, BPMN
Ability to assist in configurations needed for testing and lifecycle management.
Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies
Knowledge of solutions using large scale infrastructure and permissions.
Some coding knowledge – Visual Studio working with APIs and cross platform solutions

Preferred skills/experience:
An understanding of actuarial modeling platform and any cloud based system.
FIS - Prophet ecosystem, including Prophet Professional, Enterprise and APIs 2021Q2+.
0-2 years’ experience working in administration of FIS software suite or any other actuarial software suites.
Customer service focus / Troubleshooting skills
Attention to detail
Takes initiative and able to work independently with minimal guidance.
Bachelor’s degree preferred (technology related)

description:
Sonder is on a mission to revolutionize hospitality and make a world of better stays open to all. No two Sonders are the same – each property has a bespoke design and contains a mix of rooms, suites, and apartments. Though each Sonder is unique, our mobile app allows guests to effortlessly navigate their stay. From check-in to checkout, everything they need is just a tap away. To be better is a never-ending pursuit and revolutions don’t happen overnight. But, together, we can forever change the way people stay, for the better.
We are looking for someone who breathes hospitality operations and is energized by the opportunity to maximize, motivate, and inspire a team to deliver an amazing Sonder guest experience. Our Sonder locations are distributed across a city in different shapes, sizes, ages, and styles, and we pride ourselves on offering a hotel-like service. That’s what you’ll own.
Life At Sonder
We aspire to build a workplace where employees can thrive. Our culture shapes how we make decisions, how we conduct meetings, how we communicate, and how we treat each other. It’s the coordinated way in which we work that gives us a shot at achieving the epic tale we hope to be part of. Our Leadership Principles are a foundational part of our culture and they play a vital role in guiding the values and actions of our team members. Each of these principles is at the heart of what we do. Check out
this article
to find out more about our Culture and Principles.
.
As the Opera Administrator, you will manage relationships with both an internal team and our external partners for providing technical solutions that meet the evolving business needs of the organization. You will collaborate with business stakeholders across different Sonder locations to scope and implement new technical initiatives and simplify processes and educate employees on the effective use of the technologies and processes necessary for the business to operate and scale. This role is highly focused on implementing efficient processes within Oracle Opera Cloud.
The Opportunity:
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to identify integration requirements, address issues, and ensure successful implementation; address any functional gaps and guarantee a smooth transition to the new system
After “go-live,” provide technical and functional support, ensuring our business thrives with this advanced solution
Monitor and optimize the performance of integration processes to ensure efficient data exchange and minimal latency
Conduct routine maintenance and debugging on operating system and related integrations.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance integration processes and capabilities, reducing manual processes and providing QA for system updates
Set up, conduct and provide results for testing scenarios in line with project requirements
Who We Look For:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related, or an accredited technical certificate program
Minimum three (3) years OPERA property management experience required, OPERA Cloud experience preferred
Highly organized individual with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Possess a results-oriented, can-do attitude with the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Able to clearly communicate with leadership and management at all levels of the organization.
Acts as a leader and establishes themselves as a trusted product expert.

description:
Job Summary
Develops, implements and maintains configuration changes to proprietary sales Incentive Compensation Management (ICM) system based on business requirements and system functionality. Works closely with management and team members to gather, analyze and document requirements. Identifies system solutions to meet those requirements. Plans and executes configuration tasks within established deadlines. Documents and validates configuration changes.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Works closely with team members and line-of-business partners to gather, analyze and document business requirements for implementing proposed sales incentive plans in the sales ICM system.
Develops and implements configuration solutions based on business requirements and sales ICM system functionality.
Performs setup and testing of new modules and business processes. Builds tables, templates data stores, queries, and reports. Loads data into relational databases. Tests calculations and migrates logic.
Migrates components to applicable environments and coordinates implementation of changes with key stakeholders.
Develops and documents system specifications for projects based on requirements.
Monitors sales ICM system performance and provides recommendations for improvement. Performs audits to ensure data integrity.
Designs and generates reports.
Participates in sales ICM system project planning and administration, including issue tracking, project roll-out, communications and training.
Develops test plans to ensure reliable project implementation. Communicates with management regularly regarding project status.
Participates on project teams for large strategic projects including system upgrades and implementations of new modules.
Assists in the planning and execution of proposals and statements of work.
Manages and coordinates vendor change control process including requirements documentation and moves to production.
Provides support during releases and system upgrades.
Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.
Performs other related duties as required.
The information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
Synovus is an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace


Minimum Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum Experience:
Three years of experience developing and maintaining software application changes including practical experience with SQL and JavaScript.
Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Comprehensive understanding of sales ICM system functionality
Skill analyzing and documenting business requirements and corresponding solution specifications
Ability to complete calculations and reporting
Proficiency using Microsoft software products including advanced Excel skills (i.e., creating complex formulas, macros, and formatting)
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to work with minimal direction.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Experience configuring and maintaining changes to Varicent/IBM ICM application

Why Work at Lenovo
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo’s continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).


This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.
Description and Requirements

***The position will require onsite work in Chicago, Illinois. Candidates must be local to the area or must be willing to relocate.***

Job Description – HPC System Admin
Lenovo is the Number 1 Supercomputing provider in the world measured by Top 500 entries, and we keep going. Our Global HPC Professional services team is dedicated to fostering an environment that encourages entrepreneurism and ownership - a workplace where your talents can be challenged, and your efforts recognized and rewarded.
Lenovo is looking for a HPC System Admin to join its Global HPC Professional Services team.
The position will require onsite work in Chicago, Illinois. Candidates must be local to the area or must be willing to relocate.
This position represents a rewarding opportunity to use your experience and skills in a dynamic, complex organization and to deliver across our major customer sites.
As a member of the Lenovo HPC Professional Services team, your responsibilities will cover:
Hardware Installation and maintenance, including troubleshooting, diagnosis and replacing hardware components
Interaction with the customer, keeping them updated on the progress of all issues or support tickets
Assist and work hand in hand with the Lenovo Level 3 (L3) team to perform a deeper analysis of any issues.
Implement, deliver, and administer HPC Servers and Cluster environments.
Setup and steer frequent customer meetings
Liaise with Lenovo partners and manage their activities onsite
Perform solution optimization, migration, upgrade, and recommend strategies
Work collaboratively and complementary with the Hardware Sales team, Technical Sales (presales) team, and Business Partners.

Organization
You will be part of a global HPC System Admin team supporting customers in the North American region but on occasion worldwide. You will participate in weekly collaborative calls and meetings.
The position offers you the opportunity to build a solid customer relationship, so it is important that you possess customer interaction skills and the ability to make technical decisions, to collaborate during projects with several organization verticals, partners, and customers to develop training and knowledge base documentation.

Skills Required:
Knowledge on System Management related skills, e.g. IPMI/SNMP
3+ years experience with Linux support (i.e. Suse, RHEL & CentOS).
Very good hands-on technical skills and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
HPC server system troubleshooting and support
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Good knowledge of Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint
Very good hands-on technical skills and problem-solving skills

What We Will Offer You:
A multitude of professional and personal opportunities.
An open and stimulating environment within one of the most forward-thinking IT companies.
Flat structures and fast decision-making processes.
A modern and flexible way of working to combine personal and professional life.
An international team with a high focus on Diversity.

The base salary range budgeted for this position in CA, CO, Jersey City - NJ, NV, Ithaca - NY, NYC, WA, is $80k - $110k. Individuals may also be considered for bonus and/or commission. Lenovo’s various benefits can be found here: https://www.lenovobenefits.com/enrolling-in-benefits/why-join-lenovo/
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

description:
About Us:
CyncHealth is a statewide Health Information Exchange (HIE) with a purpose to achieve health care transformation through community betterment and collaboration while protecting the security and privacy of medical information. Join our team to play a key role in leading a health data utility, advancing interoperability, and improving healthcare.
Position Summary:
The Senior System Administrator will be responsible for maintaining and overseeing the information technology systems and networks within the organization, specific to operations. This position will be responsible for ensuring the stable operation and suggested improvements of CyncHealth’s IT infrastructure, providing technical support to staff.
Position Responsibilities
Manage and optimize organization's information technology systems, networks, and cloud environments, to ensure security and performance. Depending on assignments, this may include:
Manage user authentication and access control, including OKTA administration and Microsoft Intra for identity management.
Manage and enforce Group Policies and Intune policies for workstation compliance across Windows and macOS, ensuring devices are patched, secure, and compliant.
Administer and maintain UNIX/Linux and Windows environments, ensuring security, updates, and optimization.
In collaboration with engineering staff, lead efforts to install, configure, and maintain hardware, software, network components, and firewalls.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex system, network, firewall, and server issues, collaborating with IT professionals as needed.
Evaluate system and network performance, implementing enhancements to improve efficiency and security.
Provide technical support and education to staff, assisting with inquiries related to hardware, software, and networking.
Collaborate with vendors and service providers to resolve infrastructure-related issues.
Handle license compliance for various software products, ensuring adherence to licensing agreements across the organization.
Coordinate with vendors on infrastructure and SaaS applications to ensure effective integration, performance, and support.
Create and maintain accurate documentation for IT processes and configurations while staying updated on technology trends to recommend system enhancements.
Document system configurations, network topologies, cloud environments, and troubleshooting procedures.
Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends, recommending system and infrastructure improvements.
Experience/Requirements:
Minimum (8) years’ work experience in IT industry experience.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business or a related field required.
Advanced knowledge in a majority of the following required:
Networking and firewall management
Cloud administration, including AWS and Azure storage solutions
UNIX/Linux and Windows server administration
VPN configurations
Monitoring and Alerting systems
Certificate Authority management
Port and IP allocation
Windows Administration
OKTA
Microsoft products including Office 365 and Intune.
Healthcare technology experience is highly preferred, particularly with interface engines such as Rhapsody, Cloverleaf, etc.
Demonstrated success working within an ITIL ITSM framework.
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, with proven experience in customer engagement.
Extensive organizational skills and methodology in task management.
Ability to manage competing priorities and meet strict service level agreements in a fast-paced, complex, and dynamic environment.
Strong presence and professional image, with the ability to work independently and within a team while maintaining strong working relationships.
Willingness to learn and take on new tasks to support organizational goals, while maintaining a high degree of confidentiality.
Physical Requirements:
Ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time.
Ability to stand or sit for extended periods of time.
Hours are generally Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM-5:00 PM. As operational deliverable deadlines emerge there will likely be extended working hours.
Ability to serve on a rotating on-call schedule.
Light work requiring exertion up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects.
Ability to work from La Vista, NE office with reliable and predictable attendance.


Benefits:
Medical, Dental, & Vision
20 days paid time off annually + 9 paid holidays annually.
Long & short-term disability (fully paid by CyncHealth)
Life Insurance (fully paid by CyncHealth)
401(k) with 4% matching & immediate vesting
Parental Leave
Pet Insurance
Other voluntary benefits

Must be authorized to work in the United States.

The Content Production System Administrator is responsible for serving as the system administrator for all systems used in content development and maintenance, such as the learning management systems, content management systems, and content authoring systems. The Content Production System Administrator must be detail-oriented, comfortable working with a variety of tools, and enjoy collaborating and working within a highly productive and agile environment. This position is part of the Media and Production team and will work cross-functionally with a large group of PreK-12 STEM subject matter experts and curriculum developers. Occasional travel required.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the management of systems used in content development and maintenance (e.g., learning management systems and content authoring tools).

Manage versioning and maintenance of digital resources, links, and assets within a variety of online systems.

Assist with testing and implementing new technologies.

Other duties as assigned.

Seeks and embraces diversity of thought, culture, and experience.

Approaches work with curiosity and experimentation.

Capability to work collaboratively in a remote-first team environment.

description:
Responsibilities:
PeopleTec is pursuing the Missile Defense Agency Information Management and Software Services (AIMSS) competitive effort, formerly known as the Missile Defense Data Center (MDDC) Program. Our mission is to design and implement a Missile Defense System with multiple layers of protection. As proud employee owners, we’re committed to delivering excellence and innovation in everything we do. Please submit your resume if you are interested in this opportunity and live in the Huntsville or Colorado Springs area—or are considering joining PeopleTec. We’re excited to work together!

Job Title: System Administrator I, II, III

Job Description: Experience installing new or rebuilding existing servers both physical and virtual, and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, and storage through Agile methodologies. Perform day-to-day maintenance, patching and ensuring STIG compliance by monitoring, testing performance, troubleshooting OS, resolving hardware and software problems, scheduling upgrades, and collaborating with other engineers on network / system optimization. Demonstrates understanding of how software behaves in order to deploy, configure, and troubleshoot systems. Researches new technologies and leverages optimization techniques to ensure that systems operate efficiently. Experience with transitioning on-premise applications and software to the government hybrid-cloud solution and maintaining DoD approved cloud service providers to provide information technology services and capabilities to include high performance computing, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Data as a Service (DaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS) Cloud Service Offerings (CSOs). IA certification IAW DoD Instruction 8570.01M required.

Estimated Time To Hire: October 2024
Qualifications:
If you are an incumbent employee currently working on the MDDC contract and are interested in continuing in your position under the new contract as part of the PeopleTec AIMSS team, you can submit your information through our dedicated platform or explore positions on the PeopleTec Careers Page. During the transition, PeopleTec prioritizes registered incumbents and aligns those employees to the new contract positions, allowing us to make competitive and timely offers early. We collaborate with non-registered incumbents and classify remaining positions as open or vacant accordingly. All information provided is kept strictly confidential.
Overview:
People First. Technology Always.

PeopleTec, Inc. is an employee-owned small business founded in Huntsville, AL that provides exceptional customer support by employing and retaining a highly skilled workforce.

Culture: The name "PeopleTec" was deliberately chosen to remind us of our core value system - our people. Our company's foundation was built on placing our employees and customers first. With an award-winning atmosphere, we have matured into a company that boasts the best and brightest across multiple technical fields.

Career: At PeopleTec, we value your long-term goals. Whether it's through our continuing-education opportunities, our robust training programs, or our "People First" benefits package, PeopleTec truly believes that our best investments are our people.

Come Experience It.
#cjpost #dpost

If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the following email address, applicationhelp@peopletec.com and/or phone number (256.319.3800) to contact us about your interest in employment with PeopleTec, Inc.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, citizenship, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. title: System Administrator

description:
Description
Unleash your talents at Leidos! Grow and advance rapidly in your career by letting Leidos challenge you with the country's toughest technical problems.
The National Security Sector at Leidos currently has an opening for an Mid Level-System Administrator (SysAdmin) at Fort Meade, MD. This position is part of a large program supporting Air Combat Command’s (ACC) Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
Primary Responsibilities
The System Administrator (SysAdmin) candidate will be responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems; especially multi-user computers, such as servers. The SysAdmin will ensure that the uptime, performance, resources, and security of the computers they manage meet the needs of the users. The SysAdmin may be required to install or upgrade computer components and software; provide routine automation; maintain security policies; troubleshoot; train or supervise staff; or offer technical support for projects.
Primary Responsibilities
Maintain Responsibility for Local Area Networks (LAN) and Wide Area Networks(WAN) policies
Design and Monitor new complex systems
Configure and install systems hardware or software and maintain server and domain security requirements.
Solve complex networking and administration issues and use critical thinking to support network functionality along side Network Administrators.
Plan and schedule the installation of new or modified hardware, operating systems and applications software
Manage accounts , network rights , access to systems and equipment and implement security procedures and tools.
Resolve hardware and software interface and interoperability problems.
Ensures systems availability , functionality , integrity and efficiency.
Maintain systems configuration and mange the installation and integration of system fixes, upgrades and enhancements .
Perform feasibility studies on complex information systems and conduct in-depth analysis complicated by novel problems.
Participate in Management meetings, discussions , committees and special projects
Basic Qualifications
Current TS/SCI security clearance with the ability to pass a Polygraph after hiring
Bachelor’s Degree and 8 + years of related experience. Additional related experience may substitute for a degree.
Experience working as a System Administrator
Experience working with VMware utilization technologies
Experience working with Microsoft System Administration including lodging scripting ,Group Policy objects (GPO's) and Windows servers roles including DHCP, DNS and active directory.
Experience with SAN storage.
Knowledge of Linux system administration including lodging .
Knowledge of Microsoft Server 2012 System Administration and Troubleshooting.
Knowledge of essentials for IT security and security administration.
Information Assurance DOD 85701-M Certification.
Must have Security + certification.
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Experience with CISCO Identity Services Engine.
VMWare Certified Professional Certification
Experience with PowerShell scripting and Networking.
Experience with clustering.
Experience with Windows Deployment Services (WDS)
Knowledge of complex configuration management techniques and requirements appropriate to manage base level network systems.
MCSA Certification.
VCAP Certification.
CCIE Certification
CCNP Certification
Original Posting Date:
2024-09-19
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

description:
Title:
System Administrator
Program Summary
KBR Government Solutions U.S. advances the priorities of the U.S. government and related commercial entities. We deliver expertise and differentiated, technology-driven solutions in the fields of scientific research, systems engineering, data analytics and mission operations, and we offer a range of high-end services from a portfolio that spans defense modernization; military, civil and commercial space; intelligence; cyber; advanced logistics; and base operations.
Job Summary
The successful candidate will Provide Systems Administration support to the Test Resource Management Center’s (TRMC) All Domain Test Range (ADTR) and INDOPACOM Pacific-Rim Multi-Domain Training and Experimentation Capability Team, Joint Mission Environment Test Capability (JMETC) Secret Network (JSN) Node, JMETC Multiple Independent Levels of Security Network (JMN) Node, Secret Defense Research and Engineering Network (SDREN), Defense Research and Engineering Network (DREN);
As a SA, you will be a critical part of our team responsible for evaluating customer requirements pertaining to complex technical challenges. You will assist with providing solutions to complex problems in a manner which meets both functional and security requirements. You will be responsible for keeping the team’s testing environment operational and in compliance with all TRMC directives and applicable RMF requirements. To do this you will frequently work with other distributed team members to discuss current system status and desired future enhancements.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Responsible for the administration of: computer systems hardware, network gear, software, information systems & peripheral equipment such as servers, desktops, zero clients, storage devices, and virtualization infrastructure.
Install, maintain, upgrade and configure systems (Windows/Linux/VMWare/SQL Server, Horizon UAG, VDI)
Maintain security and recovery procedures such as patching, applying STIGs, and performing backups of systems.
Administration of infrastructure including but not limited to: servers, zero clients, malware protection software, HBSS, syslog servers, databases, ACAS, etc.
Upgrade systems and processes as required for enhanced functionality and/or security issue resolution.
Identify potential risks or inefficiencies associated with the configuration of the system and recommends appropriate mitigation strategies.
Ensure compliance with data security policies, relevant legal and regulatory requirements, and TRMC cyber security program implementation plans in accordance with TRMC directives and applicable RMF requirements.
Authors and/or reviews team standard operating procedure (SOP) documentation to ensure consistent systems configuration and knowledge transfer to other team members.
Basic Qualifications:
MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN WITH THE ABILITY TO OBTAIN A TOP-SECRET SECURITY CLEARANCE
Minimum 7 years in a technical systems administration role
Education: Technical Bachelor's Degree (experience may be substituted in lieu of degree)
Able to lift up to 35 lbs.
Willing to travel up to 25%
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong background in the setup, configuration, and maintenance of virtualization environments -VMware preferred (VxRail, vSphere, vDS, NSX)
Virtual Desktop Infrastructure – Horizon, UAG, Provision and Maintain VM pools
Solid understanding and experience maintaining zero clients
Strong Windows Skills (Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, Web Application Proxy, ADFS, PKI)
Strong Linux Skills (Docker, Containers, Kubernetes, RHEL, Satellite, scripting, ansible playbooks)
Experience maintaining systems within a DoD Risk management Framework (RMF) accredited environment
SIEM (Splunk, SolarWinds, etc.)
Strong documentation skills (Writing SOPs, Creating Networking Diagrams)
Coordination, Communication and Presentation skills
Basic Compensation:
$100,000-126,000
The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.
KBR Benefits
KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

description:
Southwest Power Pool (SPP) is about more than power. We’re about the power of relationships. Our employees have the opportunity to work together to ensure electricity is delivered reliably and affordably to the millions of people living in our service territory. We have been voted one of Arkansas’ Best Places to work by Arkansas Business and we are looking for a member of our team who is passionate about our mission to keep the lights on!
We have a core ideology here at SPP that we stand by: Do the right thing, for the right reason, in the right way.
We believe in supporting our employees through a fantastic benefits package:
Competitive pay with bonus opportunities
Excellent insurance package including three great medical plans to choose from, employer-paid short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance
Relocation assistance
Flexible working environment for positions that are eligible where employees have the flexibility to work from home and come in where collaborative in person work is needed.
Fantastic contributions to your retirement through a 401(k) savings plan with employer-match benefits and a defined benefit plan fully funded by SPP
As our GRC System Administrator I or II, you will:
Play a key role in enhancing SPP’s security posture and promoting a culture of compliance. Your responsibilities will include administering and maintaining GRC systems and tools, contributing to our risk management and compliance efforts. This position necessitates a solid understanding of GRC concepts, strong technical skills, and a dedicated focus on collaboration and effective communication.
Essential Functions:
GRC System Administration:
Administer, configure, and maintain assigned GRC platform(s) to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
Implement access controls, user roles, and permissions to enforce security and compliance policies.
Assist in managing system upgrades, patches, and integrations with other IT systems.
Troubleshoot and Resolve system issues in a timely manner.
Policy and Compliance Management:
Collaborate with stakeholders to define, document, and enforce security policies and procedures.
Assist in monitoring and reporting on compliance with relevant industry regulations, standards, and internal policies.
Support the development and maintenance of internal security controls.
Risk Management:
Assist in identifying and assessing risks to the organization's information assets, operations, and reputation.
Contribute to the development of risk mitigation strategies and action plans.
Assist in maintaining risk registers and supporting risk reporting to executive leadership.
Assist in analyzing risks for mitigation, remediation and prevention.
Participate in investigating non-compliance with security controls to determine root causes and recommend improvements.
Incident Response:
Participate in incident response activities and investigations as assigned.
Assist in analyzing incidents to identify root causes and recommend improvements.
Training and Awareness:
Assist in developing training material (e.g. user’s guides, presentations, procedure documents).
Support training sessions and awareness campaigns to educate employees about GRC policies and best practices.
Provide guidance to staff on security and compliance-related matters.
Vendor Management:
Collaborate with vendors to ensure the effectiveness of GRC tools and services.
Assist in evaluating and selecting new GRC technologies as needed.
Documentation and Reporting:
Contribute to maintaining comprehensive documentation of GRC processes and configurations.
Assist in generating regular and ad-hoc reports for management and regulatory authorities.
Continuous Improvement:
Stay current with industry trends, regulations, and best practices in GRC.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and system enhancements.
The statements contained herein describe the scope of the responsibility and essential functions of this position, but should not be considered to be an all-inclusive listing of work duties and responsibilities. Individuals may perform other duties as assigned including work in other areas to cover absences, or relief to equalize peak work periods or otherwise balance the workload.
To be successful as the GRC System Administrator I or II, we're looking for:
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Security, Computer Science, Business Administration) or one year of equivalent work experience beyond min. experience requirements
Level II: A minimum of 3 years of experience in system administration and configuration of GRC solutions or automated workflow solutions or other applicable IT solutions
Level I: No experience
Experience in GRC tools and platforms (e.g., Archer, ServiceNow GRC, SAP GRC) or applicable automated workflow solutions
Basic knowledge of compliance frameworks and regulations (e.g., NERC CIP, SOC, NIST, ISO 27001)
Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel)
Adaptability to learn and apply new technologies quickly
Good problem-solving and analytical skills
Effective communication and interpersonal skills
Commitment to understanding of, complying with and enforcement of SPP Policies and Procedures
Preferred Qualifications:
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are preferred
Experience with programming languages
Experience with Archer GRC solution
Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:
This is a full-time position. Days and hours of workweek are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Working extended hours may be required.
Travel Requirement:
This position requires minimal travel ( up-to 20%)
SPP is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans and is committed to excellence. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us at HR@spp.org and let us know the nature of your request. title: System Administrator

description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond
When you join the Federal Reserve—the nation's central bank—you’ll play a key role, collaborating with leading tech professionals to strengthen and protect our economic, financial and payments systems. We invest in contemporary and emerging technology each year to support the Federal Reserve and our economy, and we’re building a dynamic and diverse team for our future.

Bring your passion and expertise, and we’ll provide the opportunities that will challenge you and propel your growth—along with a wide range of benefits and perks that support your health, wealth, and life. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes tuition assistance, generous paid time off, top-notch health care benefits, child and family care leave, professional development opportunities, a 401(k) match, pension, and more. All brought together in a flexible work environment where you can truly find balance.
About the Opportunity
With the implementation of the Enterprise Resource Planning system, the Federal Reserve System transitioned its finance, human resources and procurement technology systems to one integrated, cloud-based platform using Workday and SAP Ariba. The Enterprise Resource Planning Support Office (ESO) was established to sustain and grow this technology solution, delivering on the Federal Reserve’s mission.
The ERP Systems Administrator is part of the ESO Security team whose responsibility it is to administer security over the cloud-based applications supported by the ESO. To do this, the team combines and applies intermediate knowledge of Human Resources, Finance, and Procurement business requirements and experience using Information Technology practices and technical tools. The team is responsible for supporting compliance to System-level information security/cybersecurity policies, procedures, and guidelines; and performing relevant security tasks related to the applications supported (e.g., Ariba, Workday, Adaptive, Alteryx, Workiva). This individual is part of a team that works closely with other ERP support organizations (HRPSC, FSO, NPO, and NIT) to ensure that the applications within the ERP platform are properly implemented, maintained, and secured.
What You Will Do:
Provides daily support for security issues/topics (access, troubleshooting, permission modifications, etc.) on all ESO-supported applications
Provides research and analysis of application security data; plans and provides recommendations to customers, colleagues, stakeholders, and management; and executes solutions.
Identifies issues of varying complexity and develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to application security.
Participates in cross-functionally linked teams to address application and information security policy/risk or compliance issues. Determines best practices and suggests how to improve current practices and/or monitoring.
Serves as second-level security support with elevated powerful administrative privileges within the ESO applications.
Performs day-to-day work with minimal supervision and direction.
Performs assigned duties, with a range of complexity levels, for all security aspects of supporting the ERP platform.
Performs assigned duties for annual security audit activities covering the applications, platform, external vendors and providers, and data privacy.
Contributes to developing policies and procedures to manage application security across the platform.
Develops and executes quality and assurance test plans to verify delivery of required security functionality.
Helps train new or less-experienced staff; provides instruction and reviews output to ensure understanding.
Identifies operational inefficiencies, seeks improvements to security processes by evaluating and refining processes and procedures.
Builds and consistently supports client relationships and upholds service level agreements.
Interacts with various management levels, providing the appropriate level of detail based on expertise to address and resolve issues.
Qualifications:
2-4+ years of system administration experience; Workday, Ariba, and/or Adaptive experience preferred
1-2 years of experience with large scale enterprise-level application security with demonstrated knowledge of HR, Finance, and Procurement business processing
Exercises independent judgment, makes decisions, resolves issues, and achieves results based on training and experience.
Intermediate level knowledge of, and ability to interpret and apply, information security fundamentals, technologies, risks, Federal Reserve policies and procedures, IT governance standards (SAFR, COSO, ISO17799, ITIL, NIST 800-53, etc.).
Exposure to product management/agile methodology
Shows a growth-mindset, is curious, creative, and innovative in problem solving. Is a self-starter.
Proven outstanding oral and written communication skills with experience conveying technical information to customers, technical staff, and management.
Results-oriented with a drive toward delivering value through standardization and ongoing improvements aligned to business needs.
Flexible and nimble working style that can shift quickly to new priorities and delivery of outcomes based on business needs.
Accepts accountability and ownership of responsibility area and continuously adds value while establishing trust within the team.
Demonstrates ability to delve into complex issues from a base of general knowledge.
Collaborative and has great ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Discover the Reason Why So Many People Love It Here!
When you join the Richmond Fed, not only will you find a challenging and purposeful career, you’ll also have access to a wide range of benefits and perks that support your health and wealth, including:
Great medical benefits
Pension and 401(k) with employer match
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Employee resource networks
Paid volunteer leave
Flexible work options
Onsite amenities that make working here fun!
Other Requirements and Considerations:
Candidates should review the
Bank’s Employee Code of Conduct
to ensure compliance with conflict of interest rules and personal investment restrictions.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please notify
rich.recruitment@rich.frb.org
.
Employees who work at and/or visit another Federal Reserve entity or outside business as part of their job duties are required to comply with any onsite safety and health protocols of those organizations (including, but not limited to, requirements to vaccinate or test, mask, social distance, etc.).
Sponsorship is not available for this role. Selected candidate is subject to special background check procedures.

The hiring range of the Analyst - Info Sec – Sr is $103,400 – $129,300 annually.

As an IT Administrator, you have experience deploying, operating and supporting Servers, Hypervisors, Storage, Backups, Monitoring, DNS, DHCP, MDM, Federated SSO and Active Directory. description:
Why be average when you can be ROMARKABLE?
Founded in 1954, Romark has established itself as a premier logistics provider with a strategic focus on innovation and technology, including robotics and automation, management of finished goods and plant support. The company leverages its leading-edge technology to provide best-in-class service to clients, including some of the world’s leading consumer packaged goods, pharmaceutical, and retail companies.
As a family-owned company with integrity, we understand the importance of long-term relationships with our employees and their families, customers, and vendors based on respect, flexibility, hard work, and doing the right thing every day. We are currently recruiting for the position of Systems Administrator.
The IT System Administrator serves as the leader for Information Technology services for the location. The primary responsibility for this role is to coordinate, plan and lead information technology related activities and serve as the local IT support contact for the location. The IT System Administrator helps determine the IT needs of the location and is responsible for implementing, supporting, and maintaining all information technology and software systems that fulfill the organization’s information technology requirements.
The tasks and responsibilities required of the System Administrator are outlined below:
Maintain computers and information technology systems:
Maintain the availability of technology and systems through dutiful administration of information technology systems that support the operation. This includes user account and system administration, Microsoft Windows file and print servers, warehouse management systems, order management systems, physical security control systems, network and wireless systems, tablet computers, desktop workstations, laptops, VOIP telephony equipment and multifunction devices.
Address disruptions in system availability and accessibility immediately.
Conduct information technology adds, moves, and changes of service:
Responsible for change management to support the dynamic needs of the business operation and to maintain technology currency.
Analyze, plan and design upgrades and anticipate future technology needs of the business through engagement with business and operational managers.
Conduct regularly scheduled maintenance activities in support of system updates, upgrades and replacement of technology equipment and systems.
Evaluate, propose, purchase, and implement new technologies as necessary.
Provide information technology support services:
Provide rapid, customer-centric support for all information technology requests and incidents using support request tracking and reporting systems.
Leverage in-house knowledge, colleagues and third party and partners in the troubleshooting and resolution of incidents.
Install, configure, troubleshoot, and fix hardware and software related to service requests and incidents.
Serve as the primary point of contact with third parties for replacement or repair of all information technology hardware and software systems at the location.
Manage network connectivity:
Responsible for maintaining a stable network services for all connected devices.
Leverage network management tools to continuously monitor the availability and health of network and server infrastructure.
Leverage third parties for troubleshooting and repair of network infrastructure services.
The Skills and Qualifications required for a System Administrator are outlined below:
Minimum of a B.S in computer related degree or industry related experience
Five or more years of information technology support and administration experience
Expert knowledge in the administration and maintenance of enterprise warehouse management and order management systems (Red Prairie, Blue Yonder, SAP)
Expert management capabilities of Microsoft Windows based infrastructure (Windows file and print servers)
Fluent use of incident management systems for managing IT support requests (ServiceNow, ConnectWise)
Superb written and oral communication skills, capable of communicating with all levels of associates in supporting a logistics and supply chain operating environment. Interface in a professional and courteous manner with fellow information technology professionals of customers and partners.
Capable of providing technical support to a variety of desktop applications including Microsoft Office 365, Citrix, Service Now, SAP clients, Remote Desktop, and supply chain specific software systems.
Experience managing voice-over-IP (VOIP) telephony systems (Mitel)
Familiarity with EDI, API, and XML business data exchanges that support supply chain operations.
We offer an excellent benefit and compensation package.
Medical, prescription, vision, and dental.
Paid time off and holidays.
Paid Life Insurance, STD, and LTD.
401(k) and Profit-Sharing Plan.
Successful completion of a pre-employment physical, drug screen and background check are required for all qualified applicants.

description:
Title:
System Administrator
KBR is seeking a highly qualified Systems Administrator to provide support for the NRO Mission Operations Directorate (MOD). MOD operates, maintains, and reports the status of intelligence satellites and their associated ground systems, provides defensive space control and space protection, monitors satellite flight safety, and provides space situational awareness. This effort includes support to innovation labs developing new tools, models, and algorithms to operate and exploit satellite space and ground systems.
Responsibilities:
Expertise and experience with acquiring, configuring, and maintaining computer servers, operating systems, networks and network file systems.
Skills include knowledge of coding, networking, problem-solving, and cloud computing.
Tasks may include upgrading, installing and configuring application software and computer hardware
Troubleshooting and providing technical support to users; creating and managing system permissions and user accounts
Performing regular security tests and security monitoring
Maintaining networks and network file systems.
Minimum Qualifications:
3-5 years of expertise and experience and experience with acquiring, configuring, and maintaining computer servers, operating systems, networks and network file systems
Ability to review and determine coding, networking, problem-solving, and cloud computing approaches
Ability to upgrade, install and configure application software and computer hardware
Ability to perform troubleshooting and providing technical support to users
Ability to create and manage system permissions and user accounts; performing regular security tests and security monitoring; and maintaining networks and network file systems
Ability to deliver MOD lab innovations and mission operations advanced support
Active TS/SCI with CI polygraph
Desired Qualifications:
5-10 years’ experience in Systems Administration services
Experience with cloud development processes
Strong interpersonal skills in order to influence, collaborate and work effectively with all levels of internal and external leadership
Knowledge of NRO Mission Operations Directorate

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

description:
EOE Statement
We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description
Provide full range of System and Database Administration support required to operate the GCCS system and hardware infrastructure. Provide administration, installation, operations and maintenance (IO&M) support for servers and computer workstations operating the GCCS software. Accomplish the following System Administration Tasks:
a. Performing system startups and shutdowns.
b. Adding and removing hardware.
c. Downloading software from the Defense Information Infrastructure (DII) Asset Distribution System (DADS) from Defense Information System Agency (DISA) Defense Enterprise Computing Center (DECC), Montgomery, Alabama.
d. Installing and removing software.
e. Maintaining access permission lists.
f. Performing user account administration.
g. Setting up GCCS User Identifiers (UIDs).
h. Monitoring and archiving log and audit files.
i. Monitoring the GCCS-J and GCCS-AF system as a whole.
j. Maintaining newsgroups and chat sessions.
k. Performing Domain Name Server (DNS) administration.
l. Performing system backup and restoral.
m. Generating periodic summaries of system performance and use.
n. Directing activities during and following an emergency condition to minimize loss of GCCS mission capabilities.
o. Diagnosing and reporting system problems to the GCCS Management Center (GMC)- Pentagon, GCCS-AF Technical Support Center (Air Force Life Cycle Management Center/HBBD, Hanscom AFB, Massachusetts), and HQ PACAF Computer Systems Flight GCCS Program Office (PACAF CSF/SCOO), Joint Base Pearl Harbor Hickam, Hawaii.
p. Helping users determine the cause of failures and perform error recovery.
q. Reconfiguring GCCS to regain processing capabilities for non-routine equipment malfunctions.

Position Requirements
4+ (four or more) years of experience in systems administration, of which at least 3 (three) years must be specialized experience in administrating Oracle (Sun) Solaris UNIX systems in a network environment and two years specialized experience in administrating Microsoft Windows systems in a network environment.
Associate’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or related field.
Certification(s):
A+ (CompTIA)
Security + or equivalent per DoD Directive 8570.01-M, Information Assurance Workforce Improvement Program.
Technical skills and knowledge:
Visual Editor, shell scripting, system startup procedures, network intercommunication protocols, file system management, ZFS administration, IMS Identity Management System, DNS/BIND configuration, zone management, implementing security procedures, and system maintenance procedures
Knowledge, skills, and experience required to install and configure GCCS-J enclave as per the current procedures for GCCS-J Server Deployment using the Automated Installer, and GCCS Automated Installation Server (GAIS)/Distribution Service Point (DSP) server and GCCS-J Windows Installation System-Joint (GWIS-J) documentation
Knowledge, skills, and experience required to install and configure Solaris and Windows Servers, Windows clients, setting up Global and Non-Global zones, loopback files systems, as well as configuring the J2EEDT web based software and Agile Client. Experience with new GCCS-J Agile Server/Agile Client application
