title: System Administrator

description:
IT System Administrator
Nashville, Tennessee

JOB SUMMARY

Due to our continued growth, VMG Health has created a new role for an IT System Administrator in Nashville, Tennessee to provide on-site desktop and system support for the primary VMG Health office as well as providing virtual support to seven additional VMG Health facilities.
The IT System Administrator will also function as an ERP Tech support specialist.

KEY RESPONSIBLITIES

Technical SME for our enterprise ERP system
System Support of employee applications, laptops, virtual machines, and all devices
Operational Support (troubleshooting employee connectivity issues, M365, Teams, CRM, SharePoint, Power BI Reports, PSA, OneDrive, etc.)
Support of tracking end-user laptops, security, access control, licensing, and provisioning
Documentation of processes, procedures, polices, and configuration
Assists in the procurement of all IT hardware and software
Supports on-boarding of new employees and user provisioning
Team Lead for Helpdesk Troubleshooting – Tier II & III requests; some afterhours “on call” shifts necessary
Provides in-house SharePoint expertise and acts as the designated data librarian
Security Administration: MDM, auditing, log review
Manages Active Directory administration and all licensing audits
Monitors and updates virus protection software to keep data and communications protected
Uses security tools to analyze security incidents, providing root cause and remediation steps
Develops IT automation and self-service functionality
Provides support to internal projects providing input on vendor, security, and integration

QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge & Skills:

Moderate to advanced understanding of ERP systems with significant preference for Deltek Vantagepoint experience
Moderate to advanced understanding of Microsoft Teams and SharePoint environments
Understanding of Microsoft Products including Office365 (operational and administrative)
Exposure to networking tools and topologies
Ability to multitask and work without direct supervision

Required Minimum Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or a related field

Experience:

Minimum of five years of relevant experience, including experience in acquisition migrations

License/Certifications:

Preferred Certifications: M365, Azure, Deltek Vantage Point, A+, Network, Security, MTA or MCSA

BSM Consulting is partnering with its parent firm, VMG Health, to recruit this role.

About the Firm:

Formed in 1995, VMG is a full-service healthcare transaction advisory and valuation firm focused exclusively on meeting the unique needs of the healthcare services industry. Over its 20-year history, VMG has performed over 25,000 valuation engagements. With offices in Dallas, Nashville, and Denver, VMG is a team of approximately 300 professionals specializing in specific disciplines to assist clients with their healthcare related business transaction needs, including:
Fair Market Value Opinions
Professional Service Agreement Valuations
Financial Reporting Valuations
Fairness Opinions
Real Estate Appraisals
Capital Asset Appraisals
Due Diligence Services
title: System Administrator

description:
Job Summary
This role will support many various facets of the Information Technology hardware, software, server, storage and network infrastructure and environments. This team member will be asked to support and interact with many other areas of the IT Department as necessary. The Systems Administrator will be responsible for installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining hardware/software and administering system accounts. This includes the installation of physical and virtual servers. The role will be responsible for the administration, management and support activities associated with on-premise and cloud-based applications as required. The role is vital to ensure the operational integrity and availability of critical systems at the College. This position reports to the IT Technical Director and ultimately to the Vice President of Information Technology.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Configures hardware, software and operating systems to ensure that business operations maintain high availability.
Designs/Ensures system integration success between critical systems.
Designs group policies and access control lists to ensure compatibility with organizational standards, business rules, and needs.
Manages, monitors and troubleshoots Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP.
Manages Multi Factor Authentication and Single Sign-on in conjunction with other IT personnel.
Manages databases and application programming interfaces as required.
Maintains system access management including system accounts. Sets up system, administrative and end user accounts as required. Manages accounts, network rights, and access to systems and equipment.
Conducts functional and connectivity testing to ensure continuing operability.
Develops and document systems administration standard operating procedures.
Maintains baseline system security according to organizational policies.
Plans, executes, and verifies data redundancy and system recovery procedures.
Installs, updates, and troubleshoots systems/servers. This includes upgrades and patch management.
Checks system hardware availability, functionality, integrity, and efficiency.
Complies with organization systems administration standard operating procedures.
Manages system/server resources including performance, capacity, availability, serviceability, and recoverability.
Monitors, maintains performance tuning of system/server configuration, updates and patches.
Manages Microsoft Azure environment, Microsoft Exchange/Outlook, Microsoft Office 365 tenants and Microsoft Defender.
Manages Mobile Device Management systems such as Microsoft Intune.
Applies SSL Certificates to systems and servers.
Serves as SharePoint administrator.
Oversees installation, implementation, configuration, and support of system components.
Diagnoses faulty system/server hardware.
Performs repairs on faulty system/server hardware.
Troubleshoots hardware/software/network interface and interoperability problems.
Assists users with retrieving documentation and data.
Administers teleconferencing technologies such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Dialpad
Sets up and maintains system backups and data backups
Responsible for managing disaster recovery tools (Unitrends)
Understands cloud computing requirements.
Understands web services and web site management.
Writes scripts/programming code to automate tasks like software installation, setting configurations, and system monitoring.
Ensures security through access controls, backups and firewalls under the direction of the Technical Director (TD) and the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO).
Develops documentation to include technical information, diagrams, manuals, Standard Operating Procedures and IT policies as required.
Interacts with the Executive Director of Applications (EDA) to ensure system availability and efficiency.
Develops training materials for staff as required.
Investigates new technologies and interacts with vendors under the direction of the Technical Director and the Vice President of Information Technology (VPIT).
Follows information security protocols under the direction of the CISO.
Follows change management and project management protocols as developed by the information technology department.
Provides regular and ad hoc system reports as required, including responses for public information requests (PIRs).
Participates in IT project planning as required.
Participates in College events and exercises as required.

Required Knowledge and Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment
Proactive attitude with a focus on continuous improvement
Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot system infrastructure technology such as servers, hardware, software, cloud solutions, disaster recovery, system backup solutions and cybersecurity.
Ability to work well with others and to demonstrate an excellent quality of work with little or no supervision required.
Must be highly organized and possess excellent communication and documentation skills.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
Must have experience with systems architecture, databases, and network concepts (LAN/WAN/Wireless)
Must have knowledge of system security such as intrusion detection and data loss prevention
Must have programming experience such as PowerShell
Must have experience with various operating systems such as SQL, Linux, Unix and Windows
Must have experience with VMware, VxRail and Hyper-V (or similar virtual environments)
Must be familiar with IT development frameworks such as Agile or ITIL
Must have experience with Endpoint Management Tools (SCCM, PDQ or similar).
Must have experience with teleconferencing tools, contact centers (UCCS, UCCX, T-Mobile or similar)
Experience managing Storage Area Network (SAN), ensuring performance, availability and reliability
Able to comprehend technical manuals, procedural documentation and OEM guides.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Education and Experience
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the education and experience required.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in IT support or a related field
Experience in IP network/wireless infrastructure implementation, maintenance, monitoring, and support.

Preferred Education and Experience
2 to 4 years’ experience with the following:
Client/Server application interaction
Office 365 and Azure Administration
Barracuda software administration
Microsoft Server/O365 Tenant administration
Networking Technologies
Active Directory
Virtualization Software (VMWare, Hyper-V or similar)
Technical support, Troubleshooting
DNS Administration (Cloudflare or similar)
Telephony/Teleconferencing technologies (UCCS, UCCX, Dialpad or similar).

Certificates and Licensures
Linux, Unix, Windows, VMWare, SQL certifications preferred


Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand. The employee is occasionally required to walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Notes: The duties listed are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position. The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities.

80 Fort Brown, Tandy 105

Our values drive our actions, behaviors, and performance with a vision for a safer, more connected world. At RTX we value: Trust, Respect, Accountability, Collaboration, and Innovation.
Learn More & Apply Now!
RTX solves some of the toughest challenges in aerospace and defense. That requires expansive thinking and bold innovation – and that, in turn, requires a culture that is diverse, equitable and inclusive.
We embrace individuality and diversity of thought to fuel opportunity for our employees, our customers, and our communities. We work toward progress, knowing that a more inclusive world is critical to our mission. Not just in this moment, but always.

Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.
This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.
RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.

Job Title: System Administrator

Foxhole Technology provides robust cybersecurity and IT support capabilities for federal civilian and defense agencies. A recognized leader in navigating technology and security challenges, Foxhole delivers mission-focused innovations to answer evolving and complex needs. Our talented employee-owners provide agile, scalable services and solutions that solve operational gaps, operate critical systems, and protect and secure the enterprise – across the organization and around the world.

Foxhole Technology is seeking a Systems Administrator to join our growing team in support of Security Operations Center. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a network security environment, such as a Security Operations Center (SOC), Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT), Computer Incident Response Center (CIRC) or Cyber Security Incident Response Center (CSIRC).
Job Description:
Install, configure, maintain Linux servers, Windows servers, and the underlying virtual infrastructure.
Perform configuration/life cycle management of existing virtual infrastructure and running virtual machines.
Manage and maintain multiple third-party software support systems
Perform day-to-day operations in Microsoft Active Directory.
Repair/replace hardware and software as required
Track software licensing
Perform/monitor daily backup of critical data
Track system vulnerabilities and correct/mitigate in a timely fashion
Document system configurations and update existing system
Scripting (shell/powershell) experience is a plus.
Support the stable operation of SOC computing infrastructure in a team
Experience with VMware vSphere (vCenter/ESXi)
Experience with Tenable.SC or Nessus
Experience with STIG process and/or OS hardening practices

Minimum five (5) years IT experience
BS Degree or additional work experience substitution
Install, configure, patch, upgrade and maintain Linux and Windows servers and workstations.

Foxhole Technology offers a competitive benefits package for our employees and their dependents, including health, dental, and vision care, paid leave, retirement plans (401K, Roth, and ESOP), life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, and education and training assistance.

Requirements of position: Think analytically, effective verbal and written communication skills, make decisions, observe/remember details, interpret data, concentrate on tasks, adjust to change, handle stress/emotions. Regular attendance, maintain work schedule, attend meetings, meet deadlines, keyboard/type, handle confidential information, use math/calculations, stay organized, operate office equipment, may direct others. Must be able to see, have eye/hand coordination, and lift up to 10 lbs. May be exposed to dust/dirt, humidity, and noise.

description:
Concept Plus is looking for a Linux Systems Administrator who is able to perform phases of the broader assignments, which are designed to enable the candidate to develop knowledge and skills sufficient to perform the full scope of the major duties as described at the full performance level. UNIX systems administrator implements security upgrades to systems, manages user accounts on systems, website administration, performs backup and restores of system data, audits access to system resources, collaborates with NMFS HQ, other FMCs, and local staff on requirements and problem resolutions. Carries out projects as support for research teams, working individually, or as a part of an IT team working with other IT and science staff, as an integral member of a larger initiative.
Primary Responsibilities:
Serves as a system administrator in assigned non-Windows OS (MAC, UNIX, LINUX) utilizing ability to load, configure, and maintain current network OS capabilities; deploys and installs servers, loads and configures customer software, configures and connects client workstations to networks/servers and shared devices.
Planning for backup and recovery of database information. Maintaining archived data and backing up and restoring the databases.
Working with various vendors for technical support. Uses IT resources and follows applicable IT policies and procedures.
Follows established standard operating procedures and offers updates and enhancements when needed.
Provides technical input for the planning and coordination of the installation, testing, operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of IT hardware/software systems and a variety of associated hardware/software. Working as part of a team, manages IT resources ensuring effective performance, capacity, availability, serviceability, and recoverability.
Uses system administration skills to plan, install, configure, and maintain a variety of products and services to include DNS services, authentication services, system logging, file servers, etc.
Provides administrative, technical and planning support for cloud-based services.
Ensures IT security directives, policies and mandates are implemented and monitored to keep the information system compliant.
Works directly with Information System Security Officer and System Owner to collect and interpret information required for documenting and reporting on the information system.
Required Qualifications:
3+ years of relevant experience
Fully fluent in RedHat / CentOS Linux 7 & 8; Oracle Linux 9; Ubuntu; SELinux; various Linux security tools and
methodologies.
Fluent with bash and perl scripts.
Comfortable with rsyslog, sendmail, postfix, ssh, sudo, sftp, X11, etc.
Additional Linux-hosted software packages:
Familiar with installing, operating, and patching Vertitas Netbackup version 10+.
Full understanding of Docker, Tomcat, HTTPD (including use as proxies) configuration, setup, and support; installation and support of Tomcat-hosted applications (WAR files).
Familiar with Oracle Enterprise Database 19c and database gateway installation, configuration, trouble-shooting, and patching
Familiar with Oracle APEX / ORDS server-side version 23+ installation under Tomcat: configuration, trouble-shooting, and patching
Can build and support Linux hosts as virtual machines on VMWare hypervisors.
Capable of supporting GitLab, SubVersion, MySQL, R-server, and AIDE services, plus miscellaneous client tools such as Nessus, BigFix, FireEye, etc.
Must be willing to work HST hours with occasional PST hours (Normal Shift 3p-11p EST)
Preferred Qualification:
Oracle DBA experience

Concept Plus is a consulting firm headquartered in Fairfax, VA. We are an Oracle Gold Partner, offering deep technical expertise, combined with business insights and an experienced team focused on providing technical solutions for our clients. We are proud to have been recognized as one of the "25 Most Powerful Oracle Solution Providers" in the area! We offer great benefits including competitive pay, comprehensive health insurance, dental and vision insurance, paid life insurance, paid time off, 11 paid holidays, bonuses, tuition reimbursement, unlimited training, and the opportunity to work in a collaborative, flexible, innovative environment! For additional information about our dynamic organization, please visit our website at www.conceptplus.com.
Concept Plus is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. As such, we will give your application full consideration without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
Radiance Technologies is an employee-owned company with benefits that are unmatched by most companies in the Huntsville AL area. Employee ownership, generous 401K, full health/dental/life/vision insurance benefits, interesting assignments, educational reimbursement, competitive salaries, and a pleasant work environment combine to make Radiance Technologies a great place to work and succeed.
Radiance is searching for an experienced Systems Administrator to provide support to critical computer systems and network infrastructure at the corporate facility. The qualified candidate will provide design, maintenance, sustainment, and enhancement support for the architecture in a classified environment; ensure compliance with applicable information assurance requirements; ensure 24/7 continuity of operations; and create and update relevant system documents. Work hours are normal business hours, however, occasional support during non-business hours may be required.
Successful candidates will have the following behavioral competencies:
Great attitude with high degree of customer focus.
Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities.
Solid trouble-shooter, problem solver.
Reliable and committed to getting the job done (including after hours as required).
Excellent coping skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities.
Self-managed; able to work independently or with a team as required.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide daily, on-site, support for the operations and maintenance across multiple classification level environments.
Experience in the installation, configurations, and maintenance of Linux (Ubuntu, Red Hat Linux, CentOS) servers, desktops, and all network devices in accordance with all NIST 800-53A r4, DISA STIG, and SRG requirements.
Demonstrated experience with information systems deployments in an air-gapped environment.
Experience in User account and access control management (Active Directory, LDAP, User Access Control) in a domain or stand-alone environment.
Demonstrated experience with integrating Linux workstations and servers with Windows Active Directory.
Experience with configuring and executing vulnerability scanning tools (Nessus), SCAP/STIG scans (SCC Tool, OpenSCAP, etc.), and remediating findings.
Experience with providing backup and recovery services; manage file systems and disk space.
Experience with log aggregation technologies allowing for the collection and filtering of Linux syslog and audit trails.
Experience with desktop and server virtualization within VMWare vSphere and EXSI.
Ability to gain comprehension of new technologies to assist with new requirement implementation efforts.
Good knowledge of the Linux filesystem.
Good understanding of permissions and user management.
Required Experience
Two (2) to four (4) years of experience as a System Administrator performing patching and configuring systems to be compliant with all applicable STIGs on a classified network.
A minimum of two (2) years of experience working with Linux operating systems.
Experience as a System Administrator performing patching and configuring systems to be compliant with all applicable STIGs on a classified network.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to effectively interface with numerous cognizant security agencies, customers, and senior management.
Ability to manage multiple networks in a dynamic, demanding environment.
Basic knowledge of Risk Management Framework requirements and how they impact the IT configuration requirements for Windows and Linux systems.
Required Skills
Minimum of a valid Secret clearance with in-scope background investigation date.
DoD Directive 8570 / 8140 Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II certification (e.g., Security+ CE, CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, CND, SSCP)
Desired Qualifications
Prior experience as a System Administrator at an organization of similar size and complexity.
Understanding of network concepts and Type 1 encryption devices, such as TACLANE.
Understanding of networking concepts and cybersecurity related tools to include, Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIG) and Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP), and vulnerability scanners.
Knowledge of and ability to securely configure network equipment (switches and firewalls).
Knowledge and experience with various network administration, monitoring, and security tools (Wireshark, Nessus, Snort, Netcat and PRTG).
Experience with SIEM tools, VMWare, NetApp, endpoint security tools.
Familiar with NISPOM/RMF, DAAPM, JSIG, and NIST/DFARS compliance security controls and how to implement on various OS computer systems.
Capable of scripting or programming to automate tasks.
Background in utilizing Red Hat Satellite, Ansible, and other Linux orchestration tools.

title: System Administrator

description:
Overview:
Our long-term client relationship with NASA has led to a need for a Sr. System Administrator on the Human Space Flight Technical Integration (HSFTIC) contract at Marshall Flight Space Center (Huntsville, AL).

This role will support the International Space Station (ISS) Project by providing Microsoft Windows Domain and System Administration.

Building on more than four decades of experience in providing innovative integration solutions for government and commercial space programs, Barrios offers an extensive range of engineering, software, and related technology integration services in support of the aerospace community. As a woman-owned and operated small business, we are a people-focused company that supports professional development, while working to ensure that you maintain a healthy work-life balance.

Barrios employees actively participate in the growth of the commercial spaceflight industry through our partnerships with companies leading commercial space development, as well as successfully supporting NASA as our primary government customer. Our long history supporting Low Earth Orbit (LEO) on the International Space Station, and now Commercial LEO, lays the groundwork for future missions to the Moon through our work on Orion, Gateway, and the Space Launch System.
Responsibilities:
The Sr. Systems Administrator will:
Support the International Space Station (ISS) Project by providing Microsoft Windows domain and exchange administration.
Assist with daily operations and assist with all matters related to these international services, including customer defined changes, technology refresh, diagnostic support using analysis tools, reporting metrics of performance, and network security documentation.
Interact with team lead and peers on a daily basis, and may interact w/customers. Interaction normally involves exchange or presentation of factual information.
Determine methods and procedures to be used on new assignments.
Contribute to the development of the organization's goals and objectives.
Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications:
Required Education/Experience/Skills:
Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university, plus seven (7) years of Windows Enterprise Domain experience.
Preferences:
Preferred skills in the following areas: System build and maintenance, Windows Server, Active Directory, Group Policy, Certificates, Folder Permissions, DFS, Exchange (On-Prem), SMTP Gateway, 2FA, System patching in an enterprise environment, Backups, Workstation BitLocker encryption, Virtualization (VMware), Share Point, MSSQL, Windows 10/11, Office Suite, Visio, Computer imaging, ECM Administration (SCCM), Symantec End Point Protection.

Essential Requirements:
Must be a U.S. Citizen and successfully complete a U.S. government background investigation.
Post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol as outlined in our Drug Free Workplace policy.
Applicant selected may be subject to government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Ability to work outside normal schedule and adjust schedule to meet peak periods and surge requirements when required.
Must be able to work in a team atmosphere.
Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation.
Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others.
This position may require some commuting and traveling to other installations as needed.
Don’t miss out on this great opportunity; for immediate consideration, apply now!

Barrios Technology is a drug-free workplace, which is imperative to the health and safety of all employees and is required as a condition of receiving contracts from federal agencies. Please remember that regardless of the legalization of marijuana in several states, possession and use continues to be illegal under the federal Controlled Substances Act. This includes the use of some CBD products. A post-offer, pre-employment drug test is a condition of employment.

Barrios Technology is an Equal Employment Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
Create the future of e-health together with us by becoming a System Administrator
At CompuGroup Medical we have the mission of building ground-breaking solutions for digital healthcare. Our vision is revolutionizing how healthcare professionals produce, access, and utilize information and thus enabling them to focus on the core value of their work: patient outcomes.

System Administration of Windows, Linux, and VMware environment. (Must have any 2)
Hand-on knowledge on vSphere 6.x/7.x/8.x Servers deployment and management
Hand-on knowledge on vCenter and ESXi Server installation, configuration
Troubleshooting skills in Networking, OSes & VMware related issues (Must have)

Your Qualification:

description:
The Language Technologies Institute (LTI) within the School of Computer Science is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior System Administrator to join our growing infrastructure team. In this role, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the operational health of our compute infrastructure. Your scope of work will include implementing software deployments, hardware upgrades, and automation solutions to enhance our infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of Linux-based systems, be proficient in scripting for automation, and possess a keen eye for troubleshooting both hardware and software issues. We value effective communication, problem-solving abilities, and a willingness to learn and adapt.
Your core responsibilities will include:
Provide technical problem-solving and consulting for Linux-based systems.
Perform OS upgrades, software deployments, and troubleshooting.
Perform hardware upgrades and troubleshooting.
Coordinate with end-users, plan maintenance, and ensure operational stability on a day-to-day basis.
Develop automation solutions for manual tasks.
Basic system administration, including user and group management, filesystem management, and process monitoring.
Other duties as assigned.
Inclusion and cultural sensitivity are valued competencies at CMU. Therefore, we are in search of a team member who can effectively interact with a varied population of diverse audiences. We are looking for someone who shares our values and who will support the mission of the university through their work.
Qualifications:
Associate's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent experience/certifications.
1-3 years of demonstrated work experience.
Type of Required Experience:
Working knowledge of Linux distributions (Ubuntu, CentOS, RHEL).
Proficiency in command-line tools and shell scripting (bash, python, perl, etc.).
Experience with at least one scripting language for automation (Ansible, Chef, Puppet).
Familiarity with package management (apt/dpkg, yum/rpm, dnf).
Understanding of network fundamentals, including IP addressing, subnets, and routing.
Experience with network-attached storage.
Ability to troubleshoot hardware and software issues.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI.
Additional Desirable Skills:
Knowledge of RAID technologies and file systems (ZFS, NFS).
Experience building software from source.
Knowledge of HPC technologies (Slurm, CUDA, OpenCL).
Familiarity with monitoring tools (nagios, prometheus).
Familiarity with containerization and virtualization (Docker, Singularity/Apptainer).
Understanding of basic security best practices (firewalls, SSH).
Front-end website development skills with expertise in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Soft Skills:
Problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to communicate technical concepts to audiences of varying technical expertise.
Ability to adapt and learn new technologies.
Attention to detail.
Requirements:
Successful background check

description:
Own Your Future.

Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is searching for a System Administrator to join our team.

Why is MTSI known as a Great Place to Work?
Interesting Work: Our co-workers support some of the most important and critical programs to our national defense and security.
Values: Our first core value is that employees come first. We challenge our co-workers to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry.
100% Employee Ownership: we have a stake in each other's success, and the success of our customers. It's also nice to know what's going on across the company; we have company wide town-hall meetings three times a year.
Great Benefits - Most Full-Time Staff Are Eligible for:
Starting PTO accrual of 20 days PTO/year + 10 holidays/year
Flexible schedules
6% 401k match with immediate vesting
Semi-annual bonus eligibility (July and December)
Company funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) - a separate qualified retirement account
Up to $10,000 in annual tuition reimbursement
Other company funded benefits, like life and disability insurance
Optional zero deductible Blue Cross/Blue Shield health insurance plan
Track Record of Success: We have grown every year since our founding in 1993
Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is a 100% employee-owned engineering services and solutions company that provides high-demand technical expertise in Digital Transformation, Modeling and Simulation, Rapid Capability Development, Test and Evaluation, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomy, Cybersecurity and Mission Assurance.

MTSI delivers capabilities to solve problems of global importance. Founded in 1993, MTSI today has employees at over 20 offices and field sites worldwide.

For more information about MTSI, please visit www.mtsi-va.com.
Responsibilities:
The System Administrator you will be responsible for the installation, operation and maintenance of system and networking technologies. This position will be located in the Washington, DC area.

Your essential job functions will include but may not be limited to:
Performing systems administrator functions on Windows servers and workstations.
Configuring and maintaining routers, switches and other networking equipment.
Servicing more than 400 local and remote network users of multi-level classified systems.
Working with an IT and IA team to establish overall priorities and respond to the daily and unique requests from team members, users and program support personnel.
Maintaining a professional and courteous relationship with all team members is absolutely critical as is an earnest desire to find and detect problems and then work with the IT and IA team to develop and implement a solution.

Qualifications:
Qualified Candidates Will Have:
10 years experience working experience with DoD networks.
Must have a strong working knowledge of:
o Windows 10 desktop operating systems
o Exchange Server 2013 and Windows Server 2016 and 2019 in both physical and virtualized environments.
Must have a DoD IAT Level II – DoD 8140 (Formally 8570) certifications (i.e., Security+)
Must have experience with configuring Windows Active Directory and Group Policies
Have a robust familiarization with the DISA Security Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIG) that deal with maintaining the network security posture and be able to communicate to leadership with recommendations/guidance to growing and improving the network design.
Experience with planning, implementing, administering, and securing network infrastructure including network security appliances, routers, managed switches, servers, workstations, peripherals, cabling, and other equipment
Experience with TCP/IP protocols and advanced IT networking concepts required.
Working knowledge of several of the following technologies: Microsoft Windows, Linux, Cisco IOS, DNS, Disk SAN, security assessment tools and network hardware and media (blade-servers, fiber- channel, and network cabling)
Experience implementing, upgrading, and administering Windows servers, including SQL Server.
Good communications and people skills, both oral and written, is an absolute must.
Must be able to interact and communicate effectively with individuals of different experience levels and backgrounds including government and external industry personnel.
Education Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in an IT-related field (e.g., cybersecurity, computer science, computer engineering).
10 years' of experience is accepted in lieu of a degree.
Clearance requirement: Top Secret with SCI (TS/SCI)

description:
Overview:
About Berry
At Berry Global Group, Inc. (NYSE: BERY), we create innovative packaging and engineered products that we believe make life better for people and the planet. We do this every day by leveraging our unmatched global capabilities, sustainability leadership, and deep innovation expertise to serve customers of all sizes around the world. Harnessing the strength in our diversity and industry-leading talent of over 40,000 global employees across more than 250 locations, we partner with customers to develop, design, and manufacture innovative products with an eye toward the circular economy. The challenges we solve and the innovations we pioneer benefit our customers at every stage of their journey. For more information, visit our website, or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter.

The UKG System Administrator is a key member of the HCM/HRIS team and will leverage their skills to build, support, maintain and enhance Berry’s Time and Attendance platform. We are looking for you to bring your experience to the team as a subject matter expert and directly support our high-speed Consumer Packaging deployment team and ultimately, the overall corporation as this platform expands in our organization. The IT HCM/HRIS team supports multiple, large-scale technology deployments across hundreds of plants and geographical regions, globally. The UKG System Administrator will be the first level of response to issues, questions and requests; and will also help evangelize the platform and train our human resource professionals on the solution. This position can be in-person in Evansville, Indiana, hybrid, or remote. If you are looking to join an exciting team with great coworkers and managers, we welcome you to apply.
Responsibilities:
The ideal candidate will have a strong, multi-year foundational understanding of the UKG Pro WFM and other modules within the platform
Partner with other departments across HR and Plant Operations to fully support the UKG solution and strategic priorities and projects set forth by IT and HR leadership
Work with the functional owners and other stakeholders on the development of product enhancements and deployment; including test plans, UAT and training
Execute change requests, service requests and ensure critical issues are resolved quickly
Review UKG Pro WFM releases for changes and functionality being introduced or retired
Champion innovation and change to drive continuous improvement
Qualifications:
Minimum 2 years directly configuring/managing UKG Pro WFM Attendance and Advanced Scheduler is required. 3-5 years direct experience is preferred
UKG certifications / formal training highly desirable
Experience with UKG Pro WFM Data views and Reports desirable but not required
Able to create cross-functional relationships and work in a global, matrixed environment
Strong organizational skills with proven ability to complete multiple tasks simultaneously
Able to work independently, self-guided as well as part of the greater team
Experience conducting design sessions, build, test and deployment
Experience in manufacturing environment is desirable but not required
Excellent communication skills
Experience with Payroll, Time & Attendance, Performance Management, and other system inside Oracle HCM and/or as separate solutions is highly desirable
Bachelor’s Degree or greater preferred or with 3-5 years equivalent experience

description:
System Administrator

Austin, TX, US, 78701
RWE Clean Energy, LLC

The System Administrator (SA) is responsible for the effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware, software, and related infrastructure. This individual participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. This individual ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values. The SA supports the operations of all RWE power-generating assets in the Americas to ensure we minimize downtime, which is crucial for our ability to maintain control.
Responsibilities :
Maintain the lifecycle of systems, patching, compliance, and capacity planning in the OT environment
Installs, monitors, and manages Windows, Virtualized (VMWare), or Unix/Linux server infrastructure
Lead internal project initiatives and work closely with Project Managers to understand deliverables and meet delivery deadlines
Performs installations, patches, upgrades, capacity planning, and performance tuning through approved change management mechanisms
Manages incident tickets to resolution within SLA and approves documented standards
Investigate the root cause of system failures and propose corrective actions to prevent future occurrence
Work within a global team, reporting to a regional lead and working closely with other technical teams supporting the Windows server fleet
Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems, and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
Travel to sites to perform upgrades and necessary maintenance when needed
Perform help desk tasks such as creation, maintenance, and completion
Participate in the design, execution, and risk mitigation regarding vulnerability assessments and security/regulatory audits.
Participate in creating enterprise security documentation (policies, programs, standards, baselines, guidelines, procedures, and metric/key performance reporting).
Perform the deployment, integration, and configuration of security solutions and enhancements to existing information/operational technology in accordance with standard best practice procedures and enterprise security policy.
Assist subject matter experts on compliance standards and application of associated requirements
Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communicate with impacted constituencies
Respond to Tier 2/3 problems/incident support requests
Ensures all corporate processes are adhered to, ensuring changes to the Enterprise Service infrastructure are fully documented and following the best practice principles of ITIL
Provide technical leadership to others across the organization
Following process documentation to complete scheduled tasks
Documenting operational processes and solutions in the knowledge base and other information repositories
Continued evolution and learning of the environment and infrastructure

Active Directory and Group Policy Management

Have a record of accomplishment in identifying and delivering operational improvements, both technical and process
Accuracy and attention to detail
Certified Systems Engineer - MS preferred
Experience configuring laptops, servers, workstations, operating systems, and applications preferred
Familiar with VMware technologies preferred
Ability to self-learn new applications/technologies
Excellent analytical ability, consultative, and communication skills
Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, EAP, Education Assistance, Parental Leave, Paid time off, and Holidays. Eligible employees also participate in short-term incentives, in addition to salary.

For 125 years RWE has been the source of energy for millions of people across the globe. Now we’re making all that energy green. This decade alone we’re investing €50bn into renewables and will be carbon neutral by 2040 – ten years earlier than most other global targets. This is a chance to play a key role on our journey.

Join our renewables specialists, working across the clean energy spectrum to grow our operations to 50 GW by 2030 – with some of the world’s largest on and offshore wind farms and industry-leading hydrogen initiatives. title: System Administrator

description:
The Sr. Systems Administrator is at the forefront of deploying and supporting new technologies at HRT. In support of the strategic initiatives following the established project plan under the direction of the Director of Technology Services, implement and support datacenter infrastructure using “Cloud First” approach, augmenting existing on-prem data centers with SaaS and IaaS solutions when feasible. Build and maintain on-prem infrastructure to support Agency needs. While acting as a top-level support tier, provide problem resolution services for all escalated issues.
Essential Job Functions:
(Duties listed are not intended to be all inclusive nor to limit duties that might reasonably be assigned.)
Takes part in all phases of the infrastructure system lifecycle including requirements gathering, hardware design, software deployment and configuration, testing, commissioning, cutover, integration, documentation, and ongoing maintenance.
Configures and deploys hardware including servers, storage, networking, end-point devices, etc. at all HRT sites as needed to support ongoing projects and initiatives.
Deploys and configures operating systems, services, and applications on existing infrastructure in support of the agency’s line of business applications such as Intelligent Transportation Systems, Enterprise Resource Planning Systems, Revenue Systems, Business Intelligence & Database Systems, Safety and Security Systems.
Builds out, tests, and commissions virtualization solutions utilizing VMware vCenter, Microsoft Hyper-V, or Microsoft Azure IaaS platforms.
Deploys workloads into a virtualized environment through either new VM provisioning or by utilizing a P2V (physical to virtual) conversion approach.
Develops and executes infrastructure Preventative Maintenance Plans.
Implements software and firmware updates in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines for the entire datacenter stack, including hardware, storage, operating system, hypervisors, applications, and associated management tools.
Establishes and maintains cyber security posture for entrusted systems through application of sound cyber security engineering principles such as implementation of access control, utilization of least privilege principles, central authentication mechanism deployment, as well as following vendor recommendations.
Monitors internal system operations, troubleshoots and repairs system accordingly.
Takes a leading role in the Incident Response activities including identification, stabilization, resolution, documentation, and closure as per established guidelines.
Assures State of Good Repair compliance.
Provides support for safety-sensitive Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems.
Performs after-hours “on call” duties as per established policies and rotation schedule.
Implements, tests, and provides ongoing support for the backup solutions using “backup to disk” and “backup to cloud” methodologies.
Strives for automation and centralized management solutions deployment in all implementations; administers SCCM server.
Configures endpoint antivirus protection, intrusion detection systems, host firewalls; integrates with security systems; establishes log collection.
Develops and maintains System Design Documentation, Tailored Procedure Documents, and other supporting documentation.
Provides support for the specialized Transit line-of-business software packages and systems.
Performs advanced Office 365 administration tasks, including Exchange, OneDrive, Teams, etc.
Monitors various system logs for problems or unusual behavior.
Follows principles of Project Management, Change Management, and Configuration Management.
Remains a cyber security practitioner at all times.
Manages records created and received in compliance with the Hampton Roads Transit Records Management Policies and Procedures.
Performs other duties as required by the Director of Technology Services.
Required Knowledge, Abilities and Skills essential to Job Functions:
Ability to install, configure, and maintain server hardware, operating systems, and software is required. HP ProLiant, Dell PowerEdge server hardware. Mid and entry level SAN hardware, such as HP MSA, Dell PowerVault, Compellent, EqualLogic. In depth knowledge of Microsoft server operating systems and Active Directory technologies including domain administration, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, ADFS, Certificate Authority administration, etc. In depth knowledge of the file and printing services, Remote Desktop Services, WSUS, IIS, RADIUS, and other Windows server roles. Proficiency in shared storage administration and performance tuning (SAN/NAS/DAS environments). Extensive knowledge of virtualization technologies (VMware 6.5+ and Hyper-V), clustering, high availability, fault tolerance, DRS, load balancing. In depth knowledge of backup software and BCDR process implementation. Ability to support typical enterprise workloads such as database servers, application servers, Microsoft Exchange. Broad understanding of WAN/LAN communications, VPN technologies, IP addressing, etc. In depth knowledge of central management tools (SCCM) and system monitoring tools (Solarwinds). Scripting language expertise (PowerShell). In depth knowledge of the IaaS platforms (MS Azure) and SaaS platforms (Office 365). Apply critical thinking to quickly identify problems and implement solutions with minimal downtime. Utilize software and hardware diagnostic tools to identify, diagnose, and repair complex problems affecting system availability and performance. Using logic and wholistic analysis identify the strengths and weaknesses of different approaches. Be able to qualify decisions with solid reasoning and justification. Ability to multitask and perform a multitude of administrative and engineering tasks at one time unsupervised. Effectively collaborate in a team environment or work independently as needed. Provide mentorship to others and perform knowledge transfer as required. Maintain awareness of advances in information technology and developments in cyber security realms. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Strong work ethic is required.
Required Software Knowledge and Skills essential to Job Functions:
Proficiency in using listed technologies, software applications, and cloud services is essential for adequate performance in the assigned job duties. Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving skills associated with hardware, software, services, and systems are expected. Software usage relevant to job duties will be evaluated.
Safety Responsibility:
Perform all job duties and responsibilities in a safe manner to protect oneself, fellow employees, and the public from injury or harm. Promote safety awareness and follow safety procedures and policies. Take an active part in reporting unsafe conditions and any hazards within the workplace to their Supervisor, Manager and/or the Safety Department.
Training and/or Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Systems or a related field. Certifications and applicable job experience may be counted in lieu of education requirement.
Required Experience:
Over 10 years of infrastructure management and administration experience with progressively escalating responsibilities, with at least 5 years of infrastructure project implementation experience. Knowledge of networking protocols and technologies; knowledge of server hardware and troubleshooting skills; demonstrable experience with data storage systems management (SAN/NAS) and virtualization; experience in backup technologies; experience with application administration; experience establishing and supporting hybrid datacenter environments leveraging IaaS offerings (Microsoft Azure and Amazon EC2); experience in managing SaaS environments (Office 365); experience working in environments that utilized Change Management and other ITIL concepts is a plus.
Licenses or Certificates:
Possess a valid driver’s license. Acquire a Virginia Driver’s License within 60 days after the date of hire (in instances when an out of state license is not the applicant’s current state of residence.
Special Requirements:
This position is classified as essential personnel.
Must be able to pass federal government background screening process for local military installation access.
FLSA Status:
Exempt
Physical Demands:
Work requires high-speed operation of keyboard devices. Also requires lifting and transferring of computer equipment as needed. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Unusual Demands:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Work involves meeting multiple demands on a timely basis. Duties may require some seasonal overtime.

Systems are operational 24x7 and occasionally require work effort beyond standard work hours.

Full time 100% Onsite position.

Typically, Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of experience or 6 years of directly related experience.
Active and transferable U.S. government issued Secret security clearance is required prior to start date. U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.
Must have SIPR and Windows experience in a client/server environment.
Experience with Active Directory, VMware, Administration, backup and recovery.

development.

Learn More & Apply Now!
RTX solves some of the toughest challenges in aerospace and defense. That requires expansive thinking and bold innovation – and that, in turn, requires a culture that is diverse, equitable and inclusive.
The salary range for this role is 64,000 USD - 128,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills.
Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. description:
BT Commercial Ltd, a leading provider in air conditioning, heating, ventilation, and alternative energy products/services, is expanding and seeking a dedicated IT System Administrator to join our dynamic team.
About the Role: As an IT System Administrator, you will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of our internal IT systems. You will be responsible for analyzing and troubleshooting business and technical process incidents, catering to internal IT requests, and supporting a variety of technologies.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze, investigate, and troubleshoot business and technical process incidents.
Handle internal IT requests and log service calls in our CRM system to manage and prioritize tasks.
Collaborate with a small team of IT support specialists.
Provide support for audio-visual technologies, including video projectors.
Support CCTV recording equipment.
Conduct network analysis, monitoring, capacity management, and system security.
Plan and implement technology updates and new infrastructure.
Ensure SLAs are accurately set and adhered to.
Set up and maintain the CRM system.
Create and maintain documentation for business processes.
Assist in setting up remote monitoring equipment via the internet.
Work closely with management to design, plan, and configure new IT solutions for improved scalability and efficiency.
Ideal Candidate Qualifications:
A minimum of 2 years of experience in a business/application support role is required.
Strong knowledge of Windows Servers, Azure, Office 365, and CRM systems.
Solid understanding of networking concepts.
Proven experience in a business environment.
Proficient in English with excellent communication skills.
Professional and proactive attitude.
Possession of a diploma in IT or a related qualification.
Ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the company.
Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new technologies and tools.
Knowledge of SQL and exposure to APIs is highly valued.
Good knowledge of Excel.
Client and quality-focused with strong problem-solving skills.
How to apply
Send an email along with your CV.

Only applications submitted via email will be considered. For any questions, email: recruitment@btmalta.com

Spectrum’s Information Security strategy aligns talented employees, innovative IT processes, and leading technology to safeguard information systems and protect critical business data. Resolves and appropriately completes assigned cases and change requests and acts as an escalation for support issues. description:

PMO, System Administrator
About the role
Passionate about Systems Administration? Your next role will play a crucial role in managing and maintaining our IT infrastructure. We’re on the lookout for an enthusiastic and personable PMO, System Administrator who can install, configure, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot our systems. Based in our modern Atlanta office you will be responsible for the backbone of our internal systems.
What you’ll be doing
As part of the PMO Organization, you’ll be interfacing with many different internal teams. It’s a role with a lot of variety, and day-to-day, you’ll mainly be involved with:
Provide system administration support for Boldyn’s mTRAC tool
Manage the mTRAC trouble ticketing. Serve as a Tier 1 and 2 support for customer issues. Escalate urgent issues as appropriate
Deliver system improvements by implementing effective and timely solutions
Configure and maintain system architecture, content, and interfaces
Create and maintain system logic and automation
Work collaboratively with business process stakeholders to ensure integrity and accuracy of Company information remains high
Support cross functional teams to document and implement requirements which improve process and system efficiency and reliability
Train for and serve as alternate mTRAC Administrator
Perform other related duties as required and assigned
What you’ll bring
Think you could make a difference here? We’re looking for someone who genuinely cares about the welfare of our team. You’ll want to make an impact from day one. With big ideas about how to improve our culture and the knowledge to get people on board. You will also have some of the following:
Bachelor’s Degree required from accredited university in related discipline
Strong research and analytical skills
Experience with PL/SQL from basic SELECT statements to programming stored procedures
Experience with data visualization tools MS Excel, Power BI or Tableau with an ability to construct executive dashboards
Expert in Microsoft Office skills including Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Adobe Acrobat
Understand basic project management principles. PMP certification a plus
Experience with OneVizion Software a plus
Willingness to take direction with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
Ideal candidate will strive to improve Company processes and mTRAC configuration to increase user productivity
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced working environment
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Excellent organization skills
About us
At Boldyn Networks, we’re reimagining the future of interconnectivity. Our network solutions are solving some of tomorrow’s greatest challenges. We are one team across the globe. Always listening. Learning. We value different perspectives and challenge each other to be our best. Here, you can change lives today and create a better tomorrow.
Why work with us?
We’re large enough to deliver and maintain large-scale operations, giving you the opportunity to work on exciting projects and expand your skills. You’ll be surrounded by talented colleagues who thrive on solving problems, just like you. Together, you’ll make your mark on projects that matter and find new strengths along the way.
We also offer:
Salary: $70,000 - $90,000 per year

Thousands of LinkedIn Learning courses
Flexible working opportunities
Competitive benefit packages
Parental leave with up to 20 weeks paid at full salary

Ready to apply?
Are you ready to create an impact that will last for generations? Join us at Boldyn Networks today. Hit apply and follow the instructions to get started.
Diversity recognizes the ways we differ. Our backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are what make us unique. And it’s important to us, to our future. About Caribou Thunder
Caribou Thunder, LLC is a Woman Owned, HUBZone Certified, Native American Owned, SBA and SDB Certified global engineering services company, incorporated in 2006.
Caribou Thunder is a Global Service Provider supporting a wide variety of DoD, Space, and Intelligence programs with consistent growth since inception to over 100 associates and $10M in annual sales with solid performance in 35 states across the U.S. and 22 countries around the world. Caribou Thunder, LLC is an established Defense contractor with nearly 20 years of experience delivering engineering services worldwide. We offer industry leading salaries, flexible work life balance, full range of benefits (career development and mentoring, PTO, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401k match). Caribou Thunder, LLC offers meaningful career opportunities within a true team-based environment, where each and every employee matters, contributing to a higher goal supporting National Security programs.
Caribou Thunder, LLC is committed to hiring and maintaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. United States citizenship is a requirement for all positions.
About the role
Caribou Thunder is seeking an experienced Linux Systems Administrator V to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining the operations of multi-user computer systems, virtual computer systems, and COTS software products. Your expertise in system administration will be utilized within the program's scope. If you are a highly skilled Linux Systems Administrator looking for an exciting opportunity to take on a challenging role, we encourage you to apply for this position.
What you'll do
As a Linux System Administrator V, you have a strong background in Linux administration, database applications, Microsoft Server platforms, familiarity with IBM AIX Unix Systems, and experience with virtualization platforms. This position offers opportunities to work on special projects, collaborate with operational crews and contractor teams, and contribute to system and network issue resolution.
Monitor and address system performance issues to ensure optimal operation.
Perform tasks such as file backups and restores, system and operating software patching, and maintenance of software licenses.
Collaborate with Information Assurance teams to manage accounts, address system vulnerabilities, and respond to security issues/incidents.
Work closely with customers and peers to accomplish assigned responsibilities effectively.
Provide on-the-job training on system configuration to team members.
Assist in deploying software/hardware deliveries.
Support special projects as assigned.
Aid operational crews and contractor teams in resolving system and network issues.
Assist the IA team by providing access to system logs, instructions for monitoring user accounts, and identifying/responding to security issues/incidents.
Qualifications
Extensive experience in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) installation, configuration, and administration.
Proficiency in supporting database applications, including SQL and PostgreSQL.
Administration experience on Microsoft Server platforms.
Familiarity with IBM Advance Interactive eXecutive (AIX) Unix Systems.
Experience with IaaS virtualization platforms such as VMWare or OpenStack.
Configuration automation experience using tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
Experience with Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI).
Preferred Qualifications

Experience working in DevOps or DevSecOps environments.
Certification or proven experience using VMWare products.
Linux+, MCSE, or equivalent systems administration certifications highly desirable.

description:
We are as invested in your career as you are.
As you navigate through these uncertain times, know that Pinkerton has been a stable, thriving corporation for over 170 years. As recognized leaders around the globe in the corporate risk management industry, you can rest assured that joining us now means moving to a future-looking company. We are here today, will be here tomorrow, and are a thriving community of over 2,000 risk management professionals.
This is just one of the several exciting career opportunities that are currently available.
Job Summary:
The Area Access Management System Administrator, assigned to one of Pinkerton's largest global clients, requires the ability to operate both at the tactical and operational levels. The Administrator ensures that only authorized persons are able to access the appropriate spaces while applying principles of the “Zero-Trust” model to the corporate security program. In this role, it is important to review logical connections between permissions groups and physical devices and auditing access levels to identify misconfigurations while validating that only verified persons have the relevant permissions, and autonomously driving the execution of necessary changes to the system to closure.
Essential Functions:
Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
Support the client's Regional Program Security Manager on day-to-day approval of access requests across multiple sites and execute against individual need and verified persons lists.
Proactively audit system connections between device and access permission to identify potential misconfigurations that could unintentionally allow unwanted access to restricted spaces.
Drive the execution of action items related to correcting misconfigurations or removing individual permissions to closure.
Cultivate intimate understanding of space functions, owners, and occupying organizations that will allow the applicant to apply the principle of least privilege (PoLP) to individual permissions.
Manage multiple area access management security workflows crucial to operational success.
Analyze datasets and space layouts and leverage software systems to accomplish key tasks.
Assist with security design and implementation for facilities.
All other duties, as assigned.
Education, Experience, and Certifications:
Degree preferred and three or more years within similar physical security roles including Lenel OnGuard experience. Pinkerton is an inclusive employer who seeks candidates with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.
Competencies:
Lenel access level design and management skills, preferred.
Data entry or coding skills, preferred.
Understanding of Python, SQL, and Splunk Search Processing language.
Able to effectively troubleshoot within ambiguous environments.
Root cause analysis skills.
Able to communicate complex issues effectively both verbally and in writing.
Results-oriented with a strong delivery focus.
Able to work independently and collaboratively with global and remote teams across all levels within the organization.
Attentive to detail and accuracy.
Able to work efficiently to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.
Able to analyze both qualitative and quantitative metrics
Computer skills; Microsoft Office.
Working Conditions:
With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;
Regular computer usage.
Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Ability to work non-standard hours including earlier or later than 9:00 am - 5:00 pm plus weekends, as needed.
Frequent sitting.

Salary & Benefits Information:
Rate of pay: $48 /hour.


Benefit options include employer-paid life and AD&D, voluntary life and AD&D, medical, (HSA) Health Savings Account, (FSA) Flexible Savings Account, dental, vision, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(K), paid time off (vacation, personal, sick, and holidays) and several employee assistance-related programs. description:
System Administrator, Senior
The Opportunity:
Your combination of people skills and system administrator knowledge makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting Air Force Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR)? We’re looking for a system administrator to build and maintain the infrastructure solutions that meet customer needs and take advantage of cloud capabilities and services to help us maintain ISR capabilities.

As a system administrator on our team, you’ll help clients overcome tough challenges through monitoring and performance management. Your knowledge will be vital as you identify problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network. Your communication skills will come in handy as you turn metrics into information and articulate their meaning. This is an opportunity to gain experience in the latest cloud technologies, as you look for ways to improve your customer’s environment using cloud capabilities and services. You’ll be able to sharpen your skills in computer programming and scripting languages while developing critical systems for the Air Force. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve and optimize for the next generation of ISR. This position will require travel of up to 30% of the time.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
15+ years of experience with IT system administration
Experience with sustaining IT data centers
Experience with server hardware installation and configuration
Experience with Windows Servers
Experience with RHEL V7.9 and V8.X
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time
TS/SCI clearance
Ability to obtain DoD 8570 Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II Certification, including Security+ or CASP+ within 2 months of start date
Nice If You Have:
Experience with AI technology and Machine Learning
Experience with Dell EMC Isilon storage solutions
Experience with containerization, including Kubernetes
Experience with scripting languages, including Python, BASH, or Perl
AWS SysOps Administrator Certification
Windows Server Administrator Certification
Red Hat Certified Administrator Certification
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $75,600.00 to $172,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
