description:
About Peraton
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.
Responsibilities

The Mobility and Intune System Administrator is responsible for the administration, configuration, and support of enterprise mobility management solutions, primarily focusing on Microsoft Intune. This role involves managing mobile devices, ensuring secure access to Coast Guard resources, and deploying applications and updates efficiently. The administrator will collaborate with various departments to ensure that mobile solutions meet the organization's security and productivity needs.

Job Responsibilities:

Configure and manage Microsoft Intune for device management, application deployment, and policy enforcement.
Monitor and maintain the Intune environment, ensuring its optimal performance and availability.
Develop and implement Intune policies for mobile devices, including iOS, Android, and Windows platforms.
Understand and comply with Change Enablement processes for clients environments
Administer the enterprise mobile device management (MDM) solution, ensuring all mobile devices comply with organizational policies.
Enroll devices into MDM and troubleshoot enrollment issues.
Manage device lifecycles, including provisioning, maintenance, and decommissioning.
Implement and manage security policies for mobile devices, including encryption, remote wipe, and password policies.
Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements for mobile device usage.
Monitor and respond to security incidents related to mobile devices.
Deploy and manage mobile applications via Intune, including configuring app protection policies.
Ensure that all applications are updated and functioning correctly on mobile devices.
Provide technical support for users experiencing issues with mobile devices or Intune services.
Conduct training sessions for users on how to use mobile devices securely and efficiently.
Develop and maintain user documentation for mobile device usage and Intune policies.
Collaborate with IT teams to integrate Intune with other systems, such as Azure AD, Office 365, and other third-party applications.
Communicate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on mobility solutions.
Participate in the evaluation and testing of new mobility technologies.
Qualifications

Skills:

Proficiency in configuring and managing Microsoft Intune and other MDM solutions.
Knowledge of mobile security practices and regulatory compliance requirements.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Education/Experience:

Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT with BS/BA or 12 years with a HS Dipolma
Minimum 3 years focus on mobility management and Microsoft Intune.
Experience with mobile device management (MDM) solutions, particularly Microsoft Intune.
Familiarity with Azure Active Directory, Office 365, and other Microsoft cloud technologies.
Experience with mobile operating systems (iOS, Android, Windows)
CompTIA Security+ certification.
ITILv4 Foundations certification preferred.
Secret Clearance

Target Salary Range

$104,000 - $166,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

EEO
An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Our Values

Benefits
At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

Paid Time-Off and Holidays
Retirement
Life & Disability Insurance
Career Development
Tuition Assistance and Student Loan Financing
Paid Parental Leave
Additional Benefits
Medical, Dental, & Vision Care

description:
Amentum is currently seeking an HPC System Administrator to support an IT Managed Services program in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The overall program includes a 500+ work force performing Enterprise IT support, Service Desk, and Telecommunications support across multiple facilities and locations, for classified and unclassified telecommunications and information technology (IT) systems.
As a member of the team, you will:
Monitor the state of the HPC clusters and storage using software utilities, shell scripts, and command line interfaces.
Troubleshoot and identify failed hardware, implement parts replacement through the RMA process, and work with HPC SMEs to resolve system failures.
Work with HPC team and vendors in the delivery and deployment of clusters and storage systems including SNL shipping and receiving.
Rack and cable servers and storage systems using HPC SME’s diagrams and spreadsheets.
Actively seek opportunities to broaden and deepen your knowledge base and proficiencies.
Build your professional development through mentorship partners and informal training
Minimum Qualifications:
Must have a Bachelors degree and 2 years of experience OR an Associates degree and 5 years OR High School degree/ GED and 8 years of experience OR equivalent.
Related experience can be substituted for relevant education and vice versa.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a TOP SECRET (TS) or DOE Q Government Clearance. Note: US Citizenship is required to obtain a TOP SECRET (TS) or DOE Q Clearance.
Experience with Linux Command Line.
Proven track record of problem solving using strong critical thinking, analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Strong technical aptitude and ability to research and solve complex issues independently
Working knowledge and experience with bash shell scripting and other languages (Python, Perl, or Ruby)
Experience in another IT field, such as Storage, Networking, Databases, or Cyber Security
Ability to work seamlessly within a team as an active contributor.
Strong verbal and written customer service and communications skills
Knowledge of, and desire to follow IT Operations best practices and procedures such as issue management and incident response
Familiar with information security best practices
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to apply critical thinking skills and apply detailed data into useful information, such as documentation and developing policies, processes and procedures
Ability to work independently and within a team
Cybersecurity experience or interest

Amentum is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. description:
ActioNet has an immediate opportunity for a System Administrator. ActioNet is an IT service provider and solutions integrator headquartered in Vienna, VA that works with the Federal Government and Department of Defense.
Location: Aurora, CO
Join our dynamic team, where you will play a crucial role in collaborating with Government Support staff to execute system backup and restoration operations. You will develop, maintain, and utilize documented Standard Operational Procedures (SOPs) aligned with ITIL and industry best practices to meet application/system owner requirements.
Responsibilities:
Implement processes to provide support and assistance to ensure system and infrastructure backups are completed, when scheduled, as required
Follow Enterprise directives and procedures to periodically test backup and restore operations procedures where applicable
Aid with documenting all backup and restoration operations in logs to allow for auditing of the activity
Assist with and make recommendations to the Government to improve processes, tools, and/or procedures that will improve backup efficiency and reliability
Assist with the coordination of appropriate government activity or agency in the resolution of any issues with backup/restore processes.
Ensure all backups and other removable media are encrypted in accordance with Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) or other DoD/Federal requirements; all backups and other removable media shall be properly labeled and properly stored in fire-resistant vaults for operational back-ups (on-site storage) and historical backups (off-site storage) in accordance with DHA Enterprise policies directives and procedures
Perform technical duties related to VOIP, IX Messaging, ACD and custom Call Center applications; perform or assigns adds moves, changes related to end points
Knowledge and expertise in Red Hat Linux OS
Monitor daily performance alarms, errors, and outage trends
Review product delivery and host acceptance duties; verify hand receipts/ownership responsibilities
Confirm diagrams, sustainment & operational documentation are available to the support staff
Track pertinent system information, architecture, and performance; identify significant metrics
Submit all Circuit Management request, submit all JBSA-FSH circuit request; perform all circuit sustainment actions to include Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA), Toll Free Number and DSN activities
Define and create Avaya system permissions and skill level access.
Update and document VOIP system structure
Update and document VOIP VLAN Configuration and submit all VLAN requests to IPVM via Service Now ticket
Update and document VOIP File Server settings
Update and document Avaya Ports, Protocols, and Services Management (PPSM)
Maintain credentials to access hosted environments
Participate in project, leadership, DGIS, and other telecommunication related meetings
Manage and troubleshoot new or existing server operating systems for related infrastructure software and hardware
Administer day-to-day sustainment, integrity, security and availability of infrastructure platforms
Execute capacity analysis, maintain security posture of infrastructure systems, and monitor performance
Create standard operating procedures, maintenance guides, and knowledge base articles, as necessary to ensure proper documentation is established for the operational upkeep of the infrastructure platforms
Perform platform maintenance upgrades to ensure a proper security and operational posture is maintained
Assist architecture and engineering with evaluation, making recommendations and testing of infrastructure hardware and software products
Provide support for Virtual Machines (VM)
Execute Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) compliance
Provide Support for Group Policy Objects (GPO)
Provide Support for Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager
Support End User Devices (EUD), as required

Secret Clearance

ActioNet is a CMMI-DEV Level 4, CMMI-SVC Level 4, ISO 20000, ISO 27001, ISO 9001, HDI-certified, woman-owned IT Solutions Provider with strong qualifications and expertise in Agile Software Engineering, Cloud Solutions, Cyber Security and IT Managed Services. ActioNet is proud to be named as a Top Workplace for the ninth year in a row (2014 - 2022). We have 98% of Customer retention rate. We are passionate about the inspirational missions of our customers and we entrust our employees and teams to deliver exceptional performance to enable the safety, security, health and well-being of our nation.

We give you the tools to be successful; all you need to do is bring your best ideas, your energy and a desire to develop your skills, experience and career. Are you ready to make a difference?

description:

JOB SUMMARY: The System Administrator is responsible for maintaining and administering New World Medical's networked system of computers. This role will include troubleshooting hardware, software, and networking issues, as well as ensuring that all computing operations run with optimal performance and security.
Requirements:
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Configuring and maintaining the networked computer system, including hardware, system software, and applications.
Diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, networking, and system issues when they arise.
Replacing and upgrading defective or outdated components when necessary.
Assist with desktop and helpdesk support efforts, making sure all desktop applications, workstations, and related equipment problems are resolved in a timely manner with limited disruptions.
Monitoring system performance to ensure everything runs smoothly and securely.
Providing technical support when requested.
Documenting any processes which employees need to follow to successfully work within our computing system.
Liaison to third party vendors, IT providers, etc. for specific requirements.

Single Sign On (SSO)
SharePoint
Cloud computing
Virtualization
Office 365
Windows 2016/2019
Active Directory/ Entra
Strong knowledge of systems and networking software, hardware, and networking protocols
Experience with scripting and automation tools.
Excellent problem-solving using in-depth understanding of information systems and computing solutions.
Excellent interpersonal skills to handle all support requests.

Bachelor’s degree in Information systems or information technology.
Minimum 5 years of administering server-side technology and networked computing systems.
Ability to prioritize a wide range of workloads with critical deadlines.
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Patient and professional demeanor, with a can-do attitude.

www.ovationhc.com
.
The Windows Systems Administrator is responsible for the build, maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of physical and virtual server environments. They ensure that the server systems are running efficiently, effectively, and securely to meet the organization's needs.
Key responsibilities
Build, manage and maintain servers running Windows Server operating systems
Manage Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, and DHCP
Install, configure, and maintain Windows operating systems and applications.
Support the management of system security, including firewalls, intrusion detection, and data encryption.
Maintain and monitor system backups and disaster recovery plans.
Maintain, monitor, and adjust assigned server storage.
Upgrade and patch systems to ensure they are up-to-date with the latest security updates and software versions.
Investigate and troubleshoot system and network issues and provide solutions to mitigate them.
Monitor and maintain system performance to ensure optimum performance and scalability.
Create and maintain system documentation, including configuration, installation, and troubleshooting notes.
Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure consistency in IT infrastructure.
Work with other IT teams to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
Qualifications and skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field and/or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in managing Windows systems as a Systems Administrator for Windows Server 2008, 2016, 2019, and 2022
Proven experience in managing complex Windows environments.
Hands on experience and deep knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, and DHCP
Experience with PowerShell and other scripting languages
Hands on with virtualization technologies such as VMware and Hyper-V.
Hands on experience with Storage, Nimble storage a Plus.
Hands on experience with Backup and Recovery tools, Commvault a Plus.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to provide off hour support for server environments when needed.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
Hands on Experience with Microsoft Azure and cloud computing.
Hands on Experience with Linux and REHL based servers

IAT Level 2

NetApp OnTap

description:
Job Description
US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED
#LI-NP1
BAE Systems, Inc. is seeking a System Administrator to join our team supporting the U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) Sensors Directorate located at Wright-Patterson AFB, Ohio. This individual will serve as an IT Subject Matter Expert (SME) for one or more Isolated Lab environments. This position shall oversee day-to-day information system administration operations, resolve complex problems, and develop innovative solutions to meet changing security requirements. This individual will be able to work independently as well as collaborate with internal and external customers to create a positive, productive work environment. The ideal candidate will be adaptable to diverse technology, procedures, and demands beyond a standard desktop computer environment.

The Engineering, Science and Analysis (ESA) Strategic Capabilities Unit comprises the technical talent and organizational leadership that enables the successful delivery of high-impact discriminating technologies for our customers’ missions. Our collaborative, cross-functional teams are committed to innovation, integrity, continual learning and strong execution.

What You’ll Do:
Install, manage, and maintain Active Directory 2016 and 2019 Networks, Windows 7, Windows 10, Windows 11 as well as various Linux based operating systems, such as Ubuntu, CentOS, and Red Hat hosted on physical platforms in secure stand-alone as well as domain environments in support of program initiatives.
Update and maintain Linux repositories and GitHub repositories.
Install, configure, and troubleshoot network issues including DHCP, DNS, and IP conflicts.
Provide support to engineering/development applications and environments.
Install and configure local managed network switches.
Ensure backups, OS patching, virus definition updates, security scanning and remediation are completed within established timeframes.
Manage Network Attached Storage (NAS) and replication of data to ensure no data loss due to lack of backups or storage capacity.
Conduct security reviews and tests of systems to verify security features and controls are functional and effective.
Install and manage Virtual Machines (VM).
Take corrective action to resolve problems identified and ensure systems are operated, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with established policies and procedures.
Support security authorization activities in compliance with National Institute of Standards and Technology Risk Management Framework (NIST RMF).
Design hardware and software infrastructure to meet architecture, project development and QOS requirements.
Implement process for the management, review, and retention of security audit data.
Establish system specific recovery processes to ensure security features and procedures are properly protected and restored.
Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Capabilities Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment.
Perform other duties as necessary.

On-Site Work Environment: This position requires regular in-person engagement by working on-site five days each normally scheduled week in the primary work location. Travel and local commute between company campuses and other possible non-company locations may be required.

Working Conditions:
Work is performed in an office environment, laboratory, cleanroom, or production floor.
#IJS

Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Related Bachelor’s and 5 or more years of related experience; or HS Diploma and 9 or more years of related experience.
Each higher-level degree, i.e., Associate’s, Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree or Ph.D., may substitute for additional years of experience.
Related certifications may count towards years of related experience.
Related technical experience may be considered in lieu of education. Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education.
A current, active Secret security clearance is required with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance with SCI.
Possess current DoD 8570.01 compliant certification for IAM Level I, e.g. Security+ CE.
Be highly skilled in executing DISA STIGs via Windows Active Directory Group policy and Local Group Policy Objects.
Extensive experience with Windows and Linux operating systems.
Experience with updating both Linux and Windows in an air gapped environment.
Excellent customer service, and interpersonal communications skills supported by excellent documentation and organizational ability.
Ability to work independently with little to no guidance, prioritize, schedule, and complete multiple tasks.

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
Ability to configure and manage advanced network switches and routers.
Experience conducting security audits of information systems.
Vulnerability assessment and analysis experience utilizing SCAP, ACAS/NESSUS and DISA STIGs.

Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $83900.000 - $142600.000

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Space & Mission Systems
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.
Headquartered in Boulder, Colorado, Space & Mission Systems is a leading provider of national defense and civil space applications, advanced remote sensing, scientific and tactical systems for the U.S. Intelligence, Department of Defense and scientific communities. We continually pioneer ways to innovate spacecraft, mission payloads, optical systems, and other defense and civil capabilities. Powered by endlessly curious people with an unwavering mission focus, we continually discover ways to enable our customers to perform beyond expectation and protect what matters most.

We are hiring for a NetSuite Administrator to join our team! This person will be part of our NS team and will play a key role leading, planning, collaborating and executing business systems initiatives across various business units. They will partner and work with business leaders and employees from various areas understand and interpret business requirements, translate into technical specifications and work with team members to implement and deliver solutions. They will also play a key role in ongoing system analysis and maintenance, trouble shooting and best practices recommendations as it relates to NetSuite solutions.

Work with internal stakeholders to analyze complex needs and issues, and assess how NetSuite can be utilized as a solution.
Assist with data analysis, reporting needs, continuous improvement initiatives, chance management and support for optimal usage within NetSuite.
Develop business requirements, test and deploy customizations, custom objects, new functionality and SuiteApps based on evolving business needs.
Provide Level 1 support to debug and troubleshoot production issues, and coordinate with NetSuite Developer or team on issues that cannot be initially resolved.
Perform functional configuration and enhancements, system maintenance and business process testing for NetSuite maintenance, which includes managing custom fields, forms, records, workflows, searching and reporting, and user roles to support business requirements.
Maintain serialized inventory for procurement and warranty management.
Perform other duties, as requested.

High School Diploma or equivalent required; 4-year Degree preferred and/or equivalent working experience
Minimum 3 years of proven experience as a System Administrator with hands-on NetSuite experience, including integration and design.
Experience with Advance Inventory, Advanced Financial and Demand Planning Modules.

Consulting experience is highly desired
Strong problem solving and analytical/critical thinking skills needed, as well as exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with working with onsite and remote internal customers across multiple business areas and disciplines.
NetSuite certification is helpful, but not required
EMPLOYMENT CONDITIONS: As a condition of employment, all successful candidates are required to consent and successfully pass mandatory drug and background screening prior to first day of employment.

description:

Full time

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
Education Desired :

Job Description
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides 24 x 7 on-call support for all assigned production-related systems.
Deploy release of new technologies as well as design, install, configure, maintain and integrate system testing performance of PC/server operating systems, related utilities and hardware.
Installs, maintains and upgrades internal computer hardware and software systems used for designing and developing company products.
Controls user access and passwords.
Proposes and implements system enhancements that will improve reliability and performance of system.
Monitors usage and performance.
Trains personnel on system usage.
Troubleshoots server, software, and hardware issues.
Assists with recommending, scheduling, and implementing system hardware and/or software upgrades or repairs.
Researches, evaluates, and recommends software and hardware products.
Provides new hardware specifications to users based on application needs and anticipated growth.
Other related duties assigned as needed.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, business administration or other related discipline or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience. Experience in one or more of the following disciplines: software quality control, systems analysis or system support preferred.

General Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Knowledge of multiple operating systems and related utilities and hardware
Knowledge of storage management, TCP/IP, network monitoring and tools and technical writing principles and practices
Effective analytical, problem solving, installation and maintenance skills.
Ability to work independently as well as within a team.
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, vendors, clients and public.
Skills required for this position:
Deployment automation with Octopus Deploy and/or Jenkins.
Windows Servers with strong scripting experience. Focus on automation and remote management.
General VMWare vCenter and ESXi experience.
Security with a focus on remediating insecure configurations and vulnerabilities.
Understand server/network monitoring concepts.
Basic Networking and load balancing knowledge.
SQL query knowledge important
Public cloud experience, specifically related to availability, design resiliency, deployment, and monitoring.

FIS JOB LEVEL DESCRIPTION
Advanced professional role. Highly-skilled with extensive proficiency. Leads IT support group activities and provides analytical and technical assistance to the support team. May coach and/or mentor junior System Support Analysts and support staff. Works under minimal supervision on complex projects. Wide latitude for independent judgment. Generates statistical reports and analyses for management. Monitors team activity for quality control. Provides recommendations for enhancements to department processes and procedures. Maintain current operational procedures. Actively participates in all phases of product development to ensure a smooth transition into production for the users, clients and support personnel. Manages and administers the change management process. Develops audit utilities to verify data integrity. Coordinates and executes code installations. Works with business units to quality control applications. Administers application logins. Performs monthly user access audits by application. Creates and executes queries for one-time extraction of data. Sets up and tests interface files. Coordinates and prioritizes requests/tickets among team members. Executes system processes not yet ready for hand-off to operations and reviews results. Maintains support test areas and utilities. Works with external and internal auditors on SOX, SSAE16 and internal audits. Works with DBAs to modify databases and schemas. Identifies complex problems and develops, evaluates and implements solutions. Develops and designs effective system-generated reports. Prepares detailed analyses of processes and procedures. Performs operational analyses of procedures. Develops and maintains training material. Typically requires five or more years work experience in software quality control, systems analysis, system support, software development or related discipline or three or more years as a System Support Analyst II. Requires strong leadership and project management skills. Must be able to identify alternative solutions and approaches to problems and influence others on the best approach to take.

FIS is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $102,560.00 - $172,280.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. Please consult with your recruiter about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
EEOC Statement
FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. System Administrator
Key Role:
Organize and direct the configuration and operation of information management systems. Provide the day-to-day system administration, including system and resource optimization, and user assistance. Conduct capacity and performance analysis and provides system configuration change and upgrade recommendations. Increase system administrator efficiency and accuracy via the use of automated tools and scripts, develop system administrator procedures, and conduct system administrator training and skills assessment. Determine computer user needs. Analyze system capabilities and programming techniques and controls.
Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of experience as a systems administrator
Experience with managing daily activities of configuration and operation of systems
Experience with performing system capacity analysis and planning
Experience with maintaining servers, creating monitoring reports and logs, and ensuring functionality of system links
Ability to monitor systems for acceptable performance and user accessibility, establish back-ups, and monitor systems security
TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
HS diploma or GED

description:

The System Administrator role is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. This individual participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the infrastructure. This individual also ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational values, which will enable staff, volunteers, and partners.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Install new / rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements.
Research and recommend innovative, and where possible, automated approaches for system administration tasks. Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide scalable solutions.
Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups.
Build and maintain secure systems.
Provide escalation, problem management, and investigate and troubleshoot issues.
Repair and recover from hardware or software failures. Coordinate and communicate with impacted users / departments.
Prerequisites:
Ability to communicate and discuss information with others, which involves terminology or concepts not familiar to many people; regularly provide advice and recommend actions involving rather complex issues.
Highly tuned troubleshooting and analysis skills are necessary to this role.
Ability to move easily between complex issues, keeping focus on needs and responding well to demanding moments.
Stay current with training and awareness around changing business needs and the appropriate technology to meet and exceed those needs.
Willingness to operate as part of a team.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Required

Preferred
Bachelors or better

The Senior System Administrator will advance the capabilities of the Naval Oceanographic Office (NAVOCEANO) and Commander, Naval Meteorology and Oceanography Command (CNMOC) by performing design, integration, monitoring, and documentation tasks for geospatial software and enterprise architectures. NAVOCEANO and CNMOC are located at NASA’s Stennis Space Center, and all tasking is performed on-site.
Job Duties:
Design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure using industry-standard best practices.
Perform tasks related to storage provisioning and host integration.
Analyze, troubleshoot, and implement solutions related to storage technical problems.
Implement data storage management guidelines, policies, standards, procedures, and other documentation.
Propose a highly available storage and backup environment to eliminate single points of failure.
Develop automation scripts to improve the deployment and management of cloud resources.
Ensure the security and compliance of cloud environments, including data protection and privacy.
Monitor and analyze cloud infrastructure performance to identify and resolve issues proactively.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize cloud-based applications for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
Participate in the design and implementation of disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
Provide daily, weekly, and monthly monitoring while delivering trackable reports.
Identify areas for change or enhancement to improve quality efficiency, and continually evaluate and improve existing and new services.
Utilize monitoring tools to detect and report application, network, and security issues
Participate in user support as needed.
Develop long-term, cross-discipline strategies and roadmaps for implementing retention, data security classification, access control and collaboration for unstructured and semi-structured data in M365.

Active SECRET Clearance with T5 investigation
B.S. in Computer Science or related IT degree
IAT/IAM II certification (such as Security+)
Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Internet browsers, LAN/WAN networking, enterprise Wi-Fi, VMWare, and storage technologies
Experience in system administration of Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Esri ArcGIS software suite, Apache, Java Application Servers, and PostgreSQL
Experience with managing operational availability of web-based software systems and services such as OGC services, geospatial technologies, Python, JavaScript, and Java applications
Experience with DISA STIGs, cybersecurity, vulnerability management, and DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF)

Core Values
of community, diversity, equality, excellence, integrity, justice, and stewardship.

students from a range of diverse backgrounds
. Guilford attracts those who are seeking a professional challenge and career advancement. It also attracts those who want to enjoy a beautiful campus and location in the dynamic city of

.
Guilford College offers a wide range of benefits for full-time regular employees, including 13 paid holidays, tuition remission, health insurance, telemedicine, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, a retirement plan, and optional dental and vision insurance. In addition, employment at the College provides employees with access to numerous discounts for products, services, and attractions.
Position Summary
Position Summary:
The Workday System Administrator is responsible for the overall management, security configuration, reporting administration, and integration support for the Workday tenant. This role ensures the smooth operation of the Workday system, maintaining its integrity, security, and performance. The Workday System Administrator will collaborate with various departments to ensure that the system meets the needs of the institution, particularly within the areas of Human Capital Management (HCM), Finance, and Payroll.

Key Responsibilities:
Workday Security Management: Establish and maintain Workday security roles, ensuring appropriate governance, controls, and adherence to campus data privacy policies.
Tenant Management: Oversee daily Workday tenant operations, including system configuration, user authentication, and integration monitoring.
Reporting Administration: Coordinate and manage reporting needs across campus systems, utilizing advanced reporting tools such as calculated fields, composites, matrices, and discovery boards. Experience with Workday Prism is a plus.
Integration Support: Provide support for Workday integrations, including design, troubleshooting, and maintenance, ensuring smooth operation of downstream systems.
Business Process Configuration: Assist Functional Leads in the evaluation, testing, and configuration of business processes, particularly in preparation for semi-annual release updates.
Community Engagement: Regularly engage with the Workday online Community and monitor weekly Service Updates to assess and address potential impacts on the system.
Support Case Management: Manage Workday Support cases as a Named Support Contact, ensuring timely resolution of issues.
Project Participation: Participate in special projects as directed by staff, providing Workday-related expertise and support.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Workday Security Administration: Strong knowledge and proficiency in Workday Security Administration, including role configuration and governance.
Integration Expertise: Proficiency in Workday Integrations, including design, troubleshooting, and ongoing support.
Functional Knowledge: Familiarity with Workday functional areas and touchpoints between HCM, Finance, and Payroll.
Reporting Proficiency: Experience with advanced reporting concepts within Workday, including calculated fields, composite and matrix reports, and discovery boards. Experience with Prism is an advantage.
Business Process Configuration: Understanding of business process configuration within Workday.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree: A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Workday Experience: A minimum of five years of experience working with Workday systems, with a focus on security administration, integrations, and reporting.
Higher Education Experience: Previous experience working with Workday in a higher education environment is highly desirable.

Preferred Qualifications:
Workday Prism Experience: Familiarity with Workday Prism for advanced data analytics and reporting.

Work Environment: This position requires the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment with various departments across the institution. The Workday System Administrator must be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.

Education and Experience: Minimum of a 4-year degree and four (4) years of related experience, OR a Master’s degree and two (2) or more years of related experience.

Guilford College does not discriminate on the basis of sex/gender, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic information, military status, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable local, state or federal law, ordinance or regulation. See our
full Statement of Non-Discrimination
.

Core Values
Guilford’s longstanding mission is clear and distinctive: To provide a transformative, practical, and excellent liberal arts education that produces critical thinkers in an inclusive, diverse environment, guided by Quaker testimonies of community, equality, integrity, peace and simplicity and emphasizing the creative problem solving skills, experience, enthusiasm, and international perspectives necessary to promote positive change in the world.
Guilford College is grounded in the relentless pursuit of its seven Core Values. These enduring values are the basis of the College’s mission and are guided by the Quaker testimonies. The College was founded by the Society of Friends (Quakers) in 1837, and their principles are reflected in the campus culture.
Community
Diversity
Equality
Excellence
Integrity
Justice
Stewardship
The campus community identified these values through a participative and inclusive process in 2003. The pursuit of these Core Values is integral to the educational experience we offer, abundantly visible in academic and co-curricular campus life.

title: System Administrator

description:
This position is responsible for the day-to-day management and support of the university’s enterprise storage infrastructure including storage area networks, block storage arrays, and network attached storage and related equipment and applications. Responsibilities include troubleshooting and resolving simple and complex problems; installation, configuration; testing and documentation of software/hardware issues and resolutions. The position will collaborate and consult with internal and external resources offering technical expertise and recommendations.

Monitor storage systems’ hardware, security, and other logs to identify system anomalies, errors and failures.
Replace failed hardware components alone or with assistance from team or vendors as needed.
Monitor system performance and operating parameters.
Install, configure, and support system software and firmware updates.
Configure and monitor backups, resolving failures when needed.
Follow ITCS change management process.
Harden systems per security best practices and monitor overall system security.
Maintain current documentation for supported systems to assist team members with on-call support.
Provide level-1 storage support to the university community by working assigned helpdesk tickets, resolving if possible and escalating when unable to resolve.
Function as a technical resource for both ITCS and Distributed IT staff.
Troubleshoot and resolve routine, non-routine and occasionally complex internal technical problems.
Document support issues and resolutions.
Assist with root cause failure analysis to understand underlying issues and implement solutions to prevent future occurrences.
Recommend methods of resolving problems to team analysts or client representatives.
Develop, and maintain a high level of technical understanding for team supported systems.
Demonstrate the ability to think independently, research, interpret and apply technical knowledge to bring new ideas into focus when evaluating software and hardware.
Conduct independent research and make recommendations to improve the reliability, performance, and security of environment.
Utilize project management software and methodologies to update projects.
Participate in short and long-term projects of varying degrees of size and complexity.
Maintain accurate project documentation, timelines, and project priorities.
Provide frequent status updates, ensuring projects are completed according to schedule.
Maintain a good understanding of the industry and how that may impact customers.
Consult with customers to understands needs and requirements.
Build on-going partnerships with customers and relay information regarding resolution plans.
Interpret complex technical information and translate that into layman’s term for customers.
Understand and present the viability of alternative solutions to clients, team and management.
Represent the team at conferences or during customer tours.
Demonstrate the ability to work effectively with employees at all organizational levels.

Other duties as directed.

This position requires the employee to domicile within a reasonable commutable distance of the ECU main campus. “Reasonable commuting distance” is defined as a location that does not exceed a distance that can be safely traveled in two hours by automobile under average conditions of traffic, weather, and roads to employee’s assigned duty station in Greenville, NC.

The standard work schedule for this position will need to be adjusted to meet the position requirements, which include and are not limited to evening and weekend hours to perform scheduled and unscheduled workload requirements to maintain University operations.

This position’s job duties require periodic on-call responsibilities, which will require the employee to be onsite (at a minimum) during defined business hours, as well as maintain the ability to quickly engage and work remotely weeknights and weekends and also maintain the ability to rapidly report to the site(s) after hours and on weekends if called to do so.

Contingent upon availability of funds.

Minimum Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.

License or Certification Required by Statute or Regulation
NA

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Master’s degree
Minimum of 2 years of experience supporting enterprise information technologies.
Experience providing IT customer support using an enterprise ticketing system.
Knowledge of enterprise-class storage array practices and usage.
Knowledge of enterprise-class switching practices and usage.
Knowledge of enterprise-class servers practices and usage.
Knowledge of common storage network protocols.
Knowledge of practices for providing data access to end users via network shares.
Knowledge of backup/archive/restore concepts and associated software and hardware.
Knowledge of IT infrastructure management and monitoring software, tools and utilities.
Knowledge of datacenter topology, performance and high-availability best practices for both physical and virtual server environments
Knowledge of LAN concepts and troubleshooting
Training: Relevant certification preferred


Special Instructions to Applicant
East Carolina University requires applicants to submit a candidate profile online in order to be considered for the position. Candidates must also submit a cover letter, resume, and a list of three references, including contact information, online.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Additional Instructions to Applicant
In order to be considered for this position, applicants must complete a candidate profile online via the PeopleAdmin system and submit any requested documents. Additionally, applicants that possess the preferred education and experience must also possess the minimum education/experience, if applicable.

UCI Health is the clinical enterprise of the University of California, Irvine, and the only academic health system based in Orange County. Listed among America’s Best Hospitals by U.S. News & World Report for 23 consecutive years, UCI Medical Center provides tertiary and quaternary care and is home to Orange County’s only National Cancer Institute-designated comprehensive cancer center, high-risk perinatal/neonatal program and American College of Surgeons-verified Level I adult and Level II pediatric trauma center, gold level 1 geriatric emergency department and regional burn center. Regular Full Time
Location:

General Description
The System Administrator will be responsible for maintaining the computer systems of the Absentee Shawnee Tribe. Server management is a primary responsibility, and the System Administrator would be responsible for installing, maintaining, and upgrading servers. This position would also be responsible for ensuring the servers are backed up, and that the server data is secure from unauthorized access. The System administrator will also often perform light programming (usually scripting, which involves writing programs to automate tasks).
Responsibilities & Duties
Knowledge and expertise on how to maintain an enterprise-wide computer system.
Stay informed of evolving security issues, and installs software and patches as required.
Ability to resolve problems that arise to maintain a consistently operational computer system.
Ability to maintain uptime and ensure security of data files, databases, and other critical systems of each department and program of the Absentee Shawnee Tribe.
Ability to monitor the system to prevent potential downtime or data loss and to enhance overall system performance.
Ability to execute backup and recovery of systems to ensure that in the event of a disaster, data can be restored.
Monitor, implement and enforce Disaster Recovery Procedures; perform testing periodically to ensure procedures are effective.
Continue to monitor all backup systems, fail-over and recovery procedures, ensuring all data is backed up nightly and stored according to tribal computer system policies and procedures.
Perform basic System, Application Server, and Database Administration / tuning duties.
Allocate and track server assignments for different departments.
Troubleshoot problems with application server, database, and operating system configurations.
Ensure that licensing and subscriptions are kept up to date and renewed as required.
Ability to plan and budget for future IT needs and requirements.
Maintain control of all security and access privileges, also required to setup/delete and maintain user accounts on an as-required basis.
Implement software and application updates for the Microsoft and Linux products.
Keep abreast of current and ongoing data communications technologies in order to provide state-of-the-art operations requirements for the Tribe.
Must adhere to Absentee Shawnee Tribe Personnel Policies and Drug and Alcohol Policies.
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Qualifications
High School Diploma or GED
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field of study is required.
Knowledge and understanding of Microsoft System Administration to include Active Directory, Group Policy management, WSUS, DNS, DHCP, Print Services, File Services, as well as basic Exchange Administration.
Knowledge and/or experience with Windows Server 2008-2016, Microsoft Exchange 2013 and/or 2016, VMWare Virtual Infrastructure Administration, Veeam/Exagrid Backup Administration, Cylance and Kaspersky Anti-virus.
Knowledge and/or experience with Dell PowerEdge Servers, Dell Compellent/EqualLogic Storage, Palo Alto and/or FortiNet Firewalls, Alcatel-Lucent and/or Arista switches.
Effective oral and written communication skills.
Must be able to pass a drug test for pre-employment for the Tribe.
Must have a valid Oklahoma Driver’s License.
Must be able to pass a background check.
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, bend or kneel for long periods of time.
Sitting or standing or Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, bend or kneel for long periods of timewalking for long period of time; occasional bending, squatting, kneeling, stooping; good finger dexterity and feeling; frequent repetitive motions; talking hearing and visual acuity.

title: System Administrator

description:
Overview:
Hexagon Autonomous Solutions is looking for System Administrator to work as part of a knowledgeable and skilled team that operates a global network of Cloud and on premise server infrastructure. In this position, you will deploy, configure, and monitor and maintain the underlying infrastructure components of on premise and cloud-based services, platforms, and applications. While part of the IS Server team, this position will join a high-performance international team focused on delivering secure, reliable and scalable infrastructure services that underpin the technology deployment and development of an organisation that customers depend on across multiple continents.

The Location: This hybrid position is would be based in the US in close proximity to one of the Hexagon AS offices in either Torrance, CA, Morton, IL, or Tucson, AZ.
Responsibilities:
As a System Administrator, you would be responsible for:
Manage and maintain the company's cloud and datacentre infrastructure, ensuring high availability, performance, and security. This includes both public cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and private cloud environments.
Deploy, configure, monitor and maintain cloud-based services, platforms, and applications. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and optimize cloud solutions that align with business requirements.
Conduct regular system audits to identify vulnerabilities, perform system updates, and implement security measures to protect against potential threats.
Troubleshoot and resolve system and network issues, providing timely support to end-users and ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
Develop and maintain documentation related to Cloud and datacentre infrastructure, system configurations, and standard operating procedures.
Collaborate with IS and development teams to define and enforce best practices for cloud infrastructure, including automation, monitoring, and disaster recovery.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in cloud technologies, recommending and implementing improvements to enhance system performance and security.
Maintain all US based ITAR compliant assets
Qualifications:
Must-Have:
All required US security clearances to ensure Hexagon maintains ITAR certification.
Proven 4-7 years experience as a System Administrator, with a focus on managing cloud-based systems and infrastructure.
Strong knowledge of cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Solid understanding of VMware virtualization technologies, including vSphere, ESXi, vCenter, and vSAN.
Extensive experience with Windows server administration, including Active Directory, Group Policy, DHCP and DNS services.
Key Success Factors:
Able to analyze and troubleshoot complex system and network issues, with a focus on VMware and Windows-based systems, both on premise and in the cloud.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team and interact with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Ability to work independantly when needed, while being part of a larger team.
Nice-to-Have:
Familiar with Linux server administration including using configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef).
Familiar with networking concepts, protocols, and security principles, specifically as they relate to VMware, Windows and cloud environments.
Proficient in scripting languages for automation and infrastructure management in a Linux and Windows environment.
Relevant certifications, such as VMware Certified Professional (VCP) and Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate, are considered an asset.
Experience in a highly complex and compliance heavy environment.
Not sure if you meet all the qualifications for this role? Let us decide! At Hexagon, we are committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. If you’re excited about the opportunities this role could bring, we encourage you to apply. For any questions about the role or our company or for applicants who require an accommodation in the application process, please email our team at hrrecruitingteam.ap@hexagon.com and we will be pleased to follow up with you. Please do not send cover letters or resumes to this address.

The Company: Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. You’ll be joining over 24,000 people in 50 countries on the leading edge of your field.

This position is with Hexagon’s Autonomy & Positioning division, a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions industry leaders rely on for assured positioning and autonomy on land, sea and air. Our work touches every aspect of life, from sustainability on Earth to enabling autonomy.

We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.

description:
Harmonia Holdings Group, LLC is an award-winning, rapidly growing federal government contractor committed to providing innovative, high-performing solutions to our government clients and focused on fostering a workplace that encourages growth, initiative, creativity, and employee satisfaction.
We have an exciting job opportunity for a System Administrator. System Administrators are responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, and security of an organization's computer systems. They ensure the smooth operation of IT infrastructure and provide technical support to end-users. This role requires a Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain SCI. While a bachelor's degree in a relevant field is preferred, equivalent experience is also considered. While certifications are preferred, they are not mandatory.
Responsibilities:
System Configuration and Maintenance: Install, configure, and maintain operating systems, applications, and software patches. Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal operation.
Security Management: Implement security measures to protect systems from unauthorized access, viruses, and other cyber threats. Conduct regular security audits and apply patches and updates as needed.
User Support: Provide technical support to end-users, including troubleshooting hardware and software issues, setting up user accounts, and resolving connectivity problems.
Backup and Recovery: Implement backup and disaster recovery solutions to protect data integrity and minimize downtime. Test backup systems regularly to ensure reliability.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate documentation of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps. Generate reports on system performance, capacity, and security.
Automation and Optimization: Identify opportunities to automate repetitive tasks and streamline system administration processes. Implement automation tools and scripts to improve efficiency.
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with other IT teams and departments to support organizational goals and initiatives. Communicate effectively with stakeholders to ensure alignment and transparency.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field preferred.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in system administration or a related role.
Active Top Secret clearance with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) access.
Strong knowledge of Windows and/or Linux operating systems.
Experience with virtualization technologies such as VMware or Hyper-V.
Familiarity with networking concepts and protocols.
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Work Location: Onsite in Washington, DC

description:
Emery Telecommunications & Video has a full-time position open for a System Administrator with a Linux focus. The standard hours for this position are from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. Some after-hours and weekend work will be required. This person will perform networking and business system support functions including installation, configuration, and maintenance of equipment and software used to provide information services to Emery Telcom customers and employees. This candidate will need to report to the needed office Emery Telcom’s serving area. This will enable the candidate to perform the necessary hands-on work on equipment and infrastructure.
Essential Functions/Major Responsibilities:
Perform administration of Linux and/or MS Windows servers including performing system updates and security patches, installing and configuring software, and troubleshooting applications such as DHCP, LDAP, TACACS+, DNS, and email.
Perform system monitoring and troubleshooting of server operating systems and software applications including FTP, TFTP, Apache web server, DNS, DHCP, Zabbix, and other applications.
Configure and maintain server firewall, antivirus, and related security controls.
Manage and maintain server and data backups and recovery through tools such as Rubrik Data Protection, VMWare snapshots, etc.
Write and maintain scripts and utilities used to perform and automate network tasks, file transfers, data exchange, and reports.
Assist in the development and maintenance of network maps, diagrams, documentation, monitoring, alarming, and the security of the voice and IP networks and related applications.
Provide basic support of internal billing and tracking systems including entry of new equipment and facilities for record keeping and deployment of services to customers.
May be asked to assist in operation and maintenance of the telephone voice switches and ancillary services and equipment including software and configuration updates.
May be asked to assist with installation, configuration, and maintenance of Fiber to the Home (FTTH) and other business or service provider equipment as needed.
May be asked to assist with install and maintenance of central office infrastructure including equipment and cable racks and DC power.
Provide support to the business sales and installation team for voice and data services including email, DHCP, and DNS applications.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

A bachelor degree in information systems/related field or equivalent experience with a focus on server and application administration is preferred.
Experience with configuration and administration of Linux and/or Unix operating systems with a preference for Debian, CentOS/RHEL, SUSE, and/or Rocky Linux.
Experience with VMWare or other hypervisors for management of server virtualization.
Experience with Python scripting, SaltStack/SALT, or other Linux automation and administration tools is preferred.
Experience with Palo Alto or other Next Generation Firewall appliances and software is preferred.

To Apply:
Call Ryan Sharp @ 435-748-3144, email rsharp@emerytelcom.com
title: System Administrator
