description:
Company Summary:
DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile.
Department Summary:
Our Customer Experience Operations (CXO) teams go above and beyond by simplifying lives and enhancing community access to our products and services. Behind the scenes, dedicated individuals focus on refining the experience for millions of customers across all of our brands and providing support to our field agents.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
As a Application Developer II on the Ticketing Administration team, you will support the Customer Experience Operations (CXO) organization in creating the architecture that allows us to serve our customers. You will build processes that ensure tickets submitted by customer service representatives on behalf of customers are provisioned, routed and managed effectively.

Key Responsibilities:
Application Management - Manage ticketing application and internal domains, including proper resolution of tickets, provisioning of users, automations/rules for tickets, routing logic, interface enhancements, and optimization of the existing tickets/processes
End-User Experience - Assist in managing and developing the current case management system and finding innovative solutions to optimize the platform and processes
Relationship Focused - Maintain strong relationships with various departments in the business
Data Driven - Leverage analytics and insights to inform decision-making and drive strategic initiatives
Detail Oriented - Responsible for documenting various ticketing flows and processes, database tables, and automation logic for the case management application
Skills, Experience and Requirements:
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

Skills and Qualifications:
Basic understanding of data and data analytics; database, table and server knowledge a plus (SQL)
Some knowledge of coding principles required to support application development such as Python, HTML, and JavaScript
Understanding of API management; designing, implementing, and maintaining APIs to facilitate seamless integration and communication between systems
Ability to comprehend application requirements for IT development
Ability to learn quickly, multi-task, prioritize, work under pressure, and adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Ability to prioritize own work and work on projects independently and within a team
Ability to think creatively and apply logic when working through complex problems
Strong commitment to seeing tasks through to completion
Benefits:
We offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location.

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check. Our company is committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace where every individual has the opportunity to succeed. We are dedicated to providing individuals with criminal or arrest records a fair chance of employment in accordance with local, state, and federal laws.

The posting will be active for a minimum of 3 days. The active posting will continue to extend by 3 days until the position is filled.
Salary Range: USD $63150.00 - $90000.00 / Year

The System Administrator II will have a full scope of understanding of server administration at the intermediate to advanced level for Windows and/or Red Hat Linux based servers to include planning, installation, documentation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and overall support. The System Administrator II will have the ability to install, configure, maintain, and document multi-system solutions that pertain to campus-wide systems, backup systems, server firewalls, security, etc., and the ability to troubleshoot all appropriate systems. In addition, this position will provide technical support and assist with troubleshooting on assigned work orders and projects for new and existing hardware and software systems. description:
Hiring Department

Division of Information Technology
Job Description

Research Support Solutions “X-Team” within the Division of IT at the University of Missouri provides advanced technical support for research computing needs across the campus. MU research is making ground-breaking contributions across diverse fields of study, requiring innovative and committed technologists with a variety of skillsets.

We seek highly qualified candidates to join our advanced team of experts. Our team members are enthusiastic about enabling greater discoveries at MU and take pride in providing the best customer support. Successful applicants will be involved in supporting research computing needs by building, installing, and managing computer systems, research instrumentation, scientific applications, and security solutions for research across the campus. They are expected to provide top-tier customer and technical support, both in-person and via remote management tools. Well-qualified applicants will have excellent professional written and verbal communication skills as well as strong interpersonal skills.

Researcher systems exist in the campus environment and are managed by industry best practices and technologies. Some of the technologies in use might include Active Directory (AD), Entra ID (Azure Active Directory), Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), system management tools (Microsoft Configuration Manager / SCCM and Intune), network and cloud file storage, configuration scripts (PowerShell and Windows batch), Veeam Backup and Replication, monitoring software, along with other enterprise and device-based tools.

Your responsibilities will include:
Frequently working one-on-one with faculty, staff, and students to aid in resolving issues.
Diagnosing and resolving end-user problems using a variety of methods including error messages, analysis of logs, searching documentation, collaboration, and communicating with vendors.
Responding to escalated issues from customers and other support teams; performing triage, providing remote problem resolution, and, when appropriate, referring problems to associated groups.
Coordinating with outside vendors for procurement and installation of hardware, software, and research instrumentation.
Researching, recommending, and implementing hardware and software purchases to meet customer needs and ensure compatibility with university systems and architecture.
Contributing to the development of customer support strategies.
Learning and understanding research workflows, investigating best practices, reducing obstacles, and guiding development of workflows for data collection and analysis.
Investigating and testing new tools, systems, techniques, and software products.
Providing technical guidance, documentation, and training to customers and IT professionals.
Documenting system configurations, modifications, and concerns.
Managing work orders, projects, and track efforts.
Working well with colleagues, customers, and external organizations in written and verbal communication, both in-person and virtually.
Advocating for the needs of researchers while promoting institutional policy.
Staying current with emerging IT trends related to research computing and research support.
Other duties as assigned.
This position is in-person and on-site in Columbia, MO, and has the potential for occasional travel to other campuses.
Shift

Monday – Friday 8am - 5pm
Evening, weekend, and call-in work may be required to meet deadlines and correct system failures.
Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience is required.
Experience installing, configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting Windows systems in Academic, Enterprise, or Research environments.
Experience securing and monitoring Windows systems and educating customers on proper security practices.
Ability to determine and initiate necessary actions to restore normal services with minimal down time.
Experience as a member of a highly technical and customer-service driven team.
Demonstrated experience with documentation, professional communication, and interpersonal relationships in IT and/or research focused groups.
Ability to provide and receive honest feedback on team and individual efforts and ideas.
Physical Expectations
Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.
Frequently sitting, using a telephone, grasp lightly/fine manipulation, bending, lifting, standing, and carrying equipment.
Occasionally lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 60 pounds.
Rarely kneel/crawl, climb (ladders, scaffolds, or other), writing by hand, sort/file paperwork or parts, grasp forcefully.
Preferred Qualifications
Direct customer support in an academic or research environment is highly desirable.
Demonstrated experience with developing device management or configuration scripts is highly desirable.
Experience with application packaging and development is highly desirable.
Experience with networking, security, and compliance is a plus.
Any experience with instrumentation, interfacing, or special technologies like DICOM, HL7, XML, API's, data transformation is a plus.
Experience with Python and R languages or development environments is a plus.
Anticipated Hiring Range

Salary Range: $60,000 - $85,000 annually, commensurate with experience.
University Title: System Administrator
Internal applicants can determine their University title by accessing the Talent profile tile in myHR.
Sponsorship Information

Visa Sponsorship Information:
Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States. The University will not sponsor applicants for this position for employment visas.
Community Information

Columbia offers small-town friendliness with big city features and a high quality of life for people of all ages and interests. Founded on education and known as an ideal college town, its location also makes it an attractive spot for businesses and travelers. Located on Interstate 70 and U.S. Highway 63, Columbia is right in the middle of the state and the nation. Just a couple hours’ drive from St. Louis and Kansas City, Columbia is Boone County’s largest population center offering big-city culture, activities, and resources with a low cost of living. Columbia is home to a variety of restaurants and entertainment venues and hosts more than a dozen cultural festivals each year. If you want to grow your career, continue your education, raise a family, and retire, Columbia is a good place to be!
Benefit Eligibility

This position is eligible for University benefits. As part of your total compensation, the University offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans, retirement, paid time off, short- and long-term disability, paid parental leave, paid caregiver leave, and educational fee discounts for all four UM System campuses. For additional information on University benefits, please visit the Faculty & Staff Benefits website at https://www.umsystem.edu/totalrewards/benefits.

Values Commitment

We value the uniqueness of every individual and strive to ensure each person’s success. Contributions from individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives promote intellectual pluralism and enable us to achieve the excellence that we seek in learning, research and engagement. This commitment makes our university a better place to work, learn and innovate.
In your application materials, please discuss your experiences and expertise that support these values and enrich our missions of teaching, research, and engagement.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of Missouri System is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal Opportunity is and shall be provided for all employees and applicants for employment on the basis of their demonstrated ability and competence without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable state or federal law. This policy applies to all employment decisions including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, pay practices, benefits, disciplinary actions and terminations. For more information, visit https://www.umsystem.edu/ums/hr/eeo or call the Director of Employee and Labor Relations at 573-882-2146.

To request ADA accommodations, please call the Director of Accessibility and ADA at 573-884-7278.
title: System Administrator

description:
Description
Leidos is hiring a Senior Systems Administrator to support the ESA V program in Lorton, VA. ESA V is an IT applications and infrastructure services program supporting several customers within the Department of Justice (DOJ). The program provides a range of IT services, including software application support, enterprise infrastructure support, service desk, ITSM, deskside support, workstation engineering and maintenance, telecommunications and mobility engineering services, managed print services, Active Directory services, and video conferencing.
This customer unit is responsible for providing field communications support to their field agents, officers and investigators worldwide. This position will provide expert level system administration services to manage and maintain the equipment, networks and web applications that support the field communications systems deployed by our customer.
Work hours are Monday through Friday, 9am – 5pm. This position is required to be onsite 3 days a week in Lorton, VA, at the primary customer location. The other 2 days are worked remotely from home.
The candidate will be subject matter expert skilled in Windows Server 2019 and later, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and later, BigFix patch management, Active Directory, Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS), Internet Information Services (IIS), OpenSSL, VMWare vSphere, VMWare vCenter Server, Windows 11 and later, Apache/PHP/MariaDB implementations, secure network architectures, hardware procurement/maintenance, system/network management tools, and backup solutions. The candidate must have experience in the NIST Authorization & Assessment (A&A) process and have experience with DoD DISA Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) implementation using the SCAP or OpenSCAP tool.
This position requires working independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will be personable and articulate and will focus on making sure that the customer’s needs are met quickly and effectively. He or she will be a self-starter who can work with limited supervision. Excellent communication skills are required to effectively interface with customers to understand requirements, issues and mission needs, and then to be able to translate them into actions.
Responsibilities include:
Apply STIGs using the DISA SCAP or OpenSCAP tools; harden servers using DISA STIG and other guidance as required; create Golden Images for future deployments
Independently and collaborate with senior system administrator to provide operations and maintenance (O&M) support for a mission-critical government system; support the system as the SME on the team, requiring broad and deep knowledge across the applicable technologies
Dell PowerEdge R940 servers & iDRAC for disaster recover/management
VMWare vSphere & VMWare vCenter Server
Windows Server 2019 & later
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 & later
BigFix Patch Management; deploy patches & fixlets from BigFix to endpoint servers & clients; ensure latest patches are being downloaded; develop maintenance windows to ensure minimal downtime when applying patches, ensure patches are tested prior to being deployed to operational servers & clients
Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS); ensure that domain controller certificates remain current, CRLs are updated, certificates are revoked as needed
Internet Information Services (IIS); ensure that web services are available for certificate authority information access (AIA) and other services as required
Quickly, effectively and independently resolve complex systems and software-related issues associated with a mission-critical government system
Develop solutions to technical issues on complex software and systems
Develop, configure Monitor & maintain Active Directory (AD) structure to ensure high availability and data consistency for AD objects, users, groups & organizational units; ensure AD is available for various authentication services used by users and/or equipment
Develop standard guideline on configuration management process to ensure consistent & secure modifications to equipment configurations
Develop and maintain technical documentation and diagrams related to the field communications systems equipment & networks
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with 8+ years of experience or a Masters degree with 6+ years experience. High school diploma with 12+ years experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Candidate selected will be subject to a Government Public Trust security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to the customer’s information. US Citizenship is required. Current clearance is not required, but selected individual cannot start the assignment until the required security clearance is granted by the customer.
Experience as a Subject Matter Expert on various operating systems (Windows Server, RHEL), patch management, and Active Directory
Experience as a SME on designing, implementing and configuring systems infrastructure
Experience providing O&M support to complex, mission-critical systems
Experience working independently and collaboratively to troubleshoot and correct operational issues
Experience working closely with customers and users to troubleshoot and resolve complex user issues
Ability to work and brief customers to include senior management
Extensive experience configuring, designing, implementing and troubleshooting with following technologies:
Dell PowerEdge R940 servers & iDRAC
VMWare vSphere & VMWare vCenter Server
Windows Server 2019 & later
RedHat Enterprise Linux & later
BigFix Patch Management
Active Directory (AD), AD Certificate Services
Internet Information Services (IIS)
Crowdstrike, Splunk, Qualys security tools
Configuration management process
Apache httpd, PHP 8 & MariaDB Enterprise implementations
Establish goals and project plan objectives
Excellent communication skills
Excellent teamwork skills
US Citizenship
Desired Qualifications:
RHEL experience with certification
Security Engineering Experience
Business Analysis/Requirements Development Experience
Technical Writing and Documentation Experience
Government contracting experience, particularly with the DOJ
DOJ Clearance
Original Posting Date:
2024-09-10
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

description:
Who We Are:
We are in the business of subrogation companies trust us to recover payments on damage claims so that the party responsible is the one paying for the damage that was caused. We strive to provide excellent customer service to both our customers and the other parties involved in a claim. In short, we help our customers focus on theirs.
Our business is driven by our Core Four principles: Process, Results, Culture, and Experience. Our dedication to practicing these has enabled our current and future success.
Were passionate about throwing company events that bring us together and celebrate each others achievements. Were also big on taking time out to give back to the community and host several volunteer events throughout the year. We believe in a healthy work-life balance.
Join our team and thrive in an environment that values efficiency and effective processes and a casual, comfortable atmosphere.
Who Were Looking For:
We are looking for someone who will beresponsible for supporting and managing the life cycle of all company business systems. You will identify any problems in the system, anticipate issues and repair systems and software when necessary.
The Day-to-Day:
Oversees the installation, configuration and maintenance of server systems, personal computers, wireless networking, server racks and other related equipment, devices and systems.
Troubleshoots systems and applications to identify and correct malfunctions and other operational difficulties.
Researches, recommends and designs infrastructure for servers and associated systems.
Implements policies, administers firewall, applies public key encryption to network applications, manage host security and file permissions.
Participates in the evaluation and makes recommendations regarding the purchase of computers, server hardware, peripheral equipment and software.
Works as a hands-on team member and supervisor with other technical staff, such as Helpdesk, security, development and reporting. support technicians to ensure connectivity and compatibility between systems.
Acts as the liaison between System Administration team and all internal and external customers
Ensures compliance with industry standards, methodologies, and expectations of work for System Administration and Helpdesk Teams.
Performs additional related tasks and projects as required and assigned.
Required Skills:
Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and urgent situations
Ability to effectively communicate in a professional and courteous manner Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as collaboratively with a team
Ability to communicate objectives and manage to completion of objectives
Ability to document processes, design patterns and procedures for the SA team Excellent analytical skills
Perform regular backups and ensure data integrity and availability
Develop and implement database strategies, including database design, capacity planning, and disaster recovery
Optimize database performance through indexing, query optimization, and performance tuning
Troubleshoot database-related issues and implement solutions
Perform database upgrades and migrations as necessary
Create and maintain documentation related to system and database configuration, procedures, and best practices
Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills
Steadfast commitment to exceptional customer service
Experience with twoor more of the following:
Servers
Storage
Network
Data Center Management
Helpdesk
Vmware
Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree with 2+ years experience, or
5+ years experience related specifically to System/Network Administration
The Perks:
Career growth and learningopportunities
Tiered bonus system based on team accomplishments
Full menu of benefits including a matched 401k
Paid time off as well as paid holidays
CMR is a 2023The Oklahoman Top Workplaces winner!

title: System Administrator

description:
ASRC Federal, Mission Solutions is a premier provider of systems engineering, software engineering, system integration, and project management services for real-time, mission-critical defense systems.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Sr System Administrator in Moorestown, New Jersey.

Responsibilities:
Provide technical leadership in projects, documenting outcomes and observations for continuous improvement.
Demonstrable track record of automating routine tasks with solutions such as Ansible and Terraform to decrease user wait times.
Experience with enterprise infrastructure solutions; evaluate current deployments, support expansions, and ensure that all solutions are highly scalable and vendor agnostic.
Identify and providing solutions that will increase the efficiencies of the overall infrastructure.
Contribute to and manage the entirety of the virtual infrastructure; must be able review the current designs, identify areas for improvement or future enhancements and work with the teams to implement changes according to CAB.
Experience with enterprise storage including designs, implementations, expansions, and migrations.
Proven technical abilities in deploying enterprise backup solutions across multiple programs that require various levels of RTO’s and RPO’s, implement the required design and routinely review and validate the solution.
Assist in vendor management and assist in building quotes and renewals.
Perform hands on technical leadership with multiple versions of Linux including various versions of RHEL, CentOS, Rocky, etc.
Provide support as required for addressing escalated trouble tickets for troubleshooting software, hardware, and networking issues.
Perform system maintenance and software installations in a Linux environment.
Install and maintain monthly security patches as required.
Develop and maintain thorough documentation of installation, configuration, and troubleshooting procedures.
Ability to multi-task and change direction as needed to meet customer needs.
Be proactive in supporting management on technology direction, process development and implementation
Perform daily system operations and maintenance (Linux environment)
Monitor health and performance of labs; Support users in using the labs including setup of test environments when requested; adhere to IT policies and procedures; coordinate support of customer environments with appropriate Subject Matter Experts (SMEs); support migration of projects from non-production to production
Generate operational processes for lab usage and support; identify opportunities for improvement including the areas of operational processes, tools (e.g., load testing) and automation (e.g., automated testing, scripting)
Contribute to the formulation of a vision and roadmap for the non-production environments and support implementation
Installation and configuration of AFMS products within the AFMS lab environments (both on-premises and cloud) and customer sites
Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering Management or related discipline, or equivalent related work experience and 5-7 years of related experience.
Must be a U.S. citizen in order to obtain and maintain a Secret Security clearance
Experience with various server types (web, file, license, application, etc.)
Experience with scripting (Bash,Python, PERL, etc)
Experience with RHEL-based Linux distributions
Experience with automation (Ansible preferred, Terraform a plus)
Experience with VMware vCenter and vSphere v6.5 or newer.
Experience with Containers (Docker, Kubernetes) a plus
Knowledge of networking and TCP/IP.
Knowledge of patch management.
Must have the ability to
Provide excellent customer service
Coordinate several concurrent tasks
Interface with users in a pleasant and tactful manner
Be self-motivated
Quickly learn new IT technologies
Occasionally work non-standard hours as required
Be a Team Player with the ability to work well independently with limited direction
Must have very strong analytical and problem solving skills
Must have excellent organizational skills

description:
Description


Apply early! This position is open until filled. Candidate evaluation will be ongoing, and the hiring authority reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any time following August 19, 2024.

AGRICULTURE - A Cornerstone of Washington's Economy

The Washington State Department of Agriculture has been serving the state for more than 100 years. Through service, regulation, and advocacy, we keep agriculture viable and vital in Washington State, while protecting consumers, public health, and the environment. We work extensively with farmers and ranchers, but our responsibilities – from ensuring food safety to environmental protection – touch the lives of millions of people locally, nationally, and abroad.

The agency includes 780 employees approximately and grows close to 1,000 employees at the peak of seasonal work. To learn more and view additional openings, please visit our Employment Page.

The Opportunity
Information Technology’s mission is to continually enhance our services to agency divisions, WSDA employees and ultimately the stakeholders of Washington while providing core IT services, network connectivity and software solutions in the most efficient and effective manner possible. We achieve our mission by identifying and resolving business challenges through the deployment of efficient software solutions, a secure and reliable network, and a Centralized Service Desk focusing on always delivering excellent customer service.

The M365 Administrator administers and troubleshoots current technology assets and processes for the entire agency throughout the state, which includes 20 remote sites. This position manages, configures, and deploys new or emerging technologies, with a focus on cloud services. In this role, this position manages virtual servers within the State Data Center, desktop applications, mobile and remote work platforms, automated processes, infrastructure capacity planning, assists with implementation of system metrics indicating the health and performance of infrastructure components and systems, advises IT leadership regarding technical infrastructure changes, and helps to ensure best IT practices align with business objectives.
Duties
Microsoft 365 Administration
Provide a professional, expert support and administration of the Microsoft 365 cloud environment with a secure, reliable infrastructure.
Independently research, design, develop, and deploy Microsoft 365 solutions for the agency
Administer the Microsoft 365 environment, ensuring availability, reliability, and performance
Monitor system health and regularly review, analyze, and test systems for performance
Provide regular backups, and restores as needed
Migrate users from current on-premises MS Office to O365
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to maximize functionality and user experience
Collaborate with security to ensure compliance with federal, state, and OCIO standards.
SharePoint Administration
Provide professional, expert SharePoint support and administration, ensuring availability and security compliance.
Lead the effort to move AGR users from the current on-premises environment to SharePoint Online
Create and administer site collections, including roles, content types, and workflows
Independently administer user accounts and implement and maintain access controls, ensuring a secure environment using the principle of least privilege (POLP)
Manage internal and external data connections
Provide expert-level data security at the server and site collection levels
Configure and support content deployment paths and jobs
Monitor system health and bandwidth usage, and regularly review and analyze system and security logs.
IT Architecture
Ensure professional, expert architecture that is scalable and that accommodates the agency and state government.
Designs, plans, and implements Microsoft Azure Cloud-based technical solutions for management of various agency-wide business procedures and processes. The solutions provided must increase efficiency and effectiveness of agency employees and be fiscally sustainable long-term.
Advises all IT Staff on architecture solutions utilizing cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure
Oversees cloud to end-user desktop services for day-to-day employee usage
Assists with coordinating and scheduling planned service interruptions and manages response notifications for unplanned outages.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field of study, or equivalent education/work experience may substitute for degree.
5+ years of experience with demonstrated skills and ability to identify, troubleshoot and resolve complicated systems and application issues.
5+ years' experience remotely installing and managing on-premises enterprise Microsoft server, and Linux operating systems.
5+ years of experience of demonstrated skills and abilities necessary to install and configure operating systems within a virtual environment.
5+ years of experience managing/maintaining Enterprise systems including use of Systems Center (such as SCCM, SCOM, Orchestrator, VMM or Scorch).
3+ year of experience managing/maintaining M365 products, such as Exchange Online, Teams, or SharePoint.
2+ years of experience with PowerShell scripting.
2+ years of Project Management experience.
Must be able to function as part of a team, build rapport, and provide excellent customer service.
Desired Qualifications
3+ years of managing an on-premises/cloud hybrid environment.
3+ years of mentoring systems administration technicians.
Systems Certifications – Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE), Citrix Certified Expert - Virtualization (CCE-V), Azure Administrator Associate.
Supplemental Information
Employee Benefits
A healthy work/life balance, which may include flexible work schedules, and teleworking.
WSDA provides an excellent benefits package beyond traditional benefits. State employment offers Dependent Care Assistance, Flexible Spending Accounts, Public Service Loan Forgiveness, Tuition Waiver, Deferred Compensation, Employee Recognition Leave; click here for more information.
12 paid Holidays & Vacation and Leave Accruals.
All Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required will be provided by the agency.

How to apply

You must complete your careers.wa.gov profile and answer the supplemental questions. In addition to completing the online application, and supplemental questions applicants must attach the following documents to their profile to be considered for this position:

A resume detailing experience and education
A cover letter describing how you meet the specific qualifications for this position
Three professional references

By submitting these materials, you are indicating that all information is true and correct. The state may verify information. Any untruthful or misleading information is cause for removal from the applicant pool or dismissal if employed.

If you are having technical difficulties creating, accessing, or completing your application, please call NEOGOV toll-free at (855) 524-5627 or email support@neogov.com.

The initial screening will be solely based on the contents and completeness of your application and the materials submitted. All information may be verified, and documentation may be required. Applications received via e-mail will not be accepted in lieu of applying through the state's on-line recruitment system.

WSDA uses a I-9 form (Download PDF reader) (Download PDF reader) to determine Employment Eligibility and Verification, once hired. This document is the authorization of an individual’s ability to be hired for employment within the United States. Applicants must be eligible to work in the United States.

Equity at WSDA
The Department of Agriculture recognizes, appreciates, supports, embraces, and respects all cultural identities and backgrounds while we collaborate in authentic ways. We hire amazing people that share in the commitment to our Pro-Equity Anti-Racist (PEAR) strategic plan, our Healthy Environment for All (HEAL) Act implementation plan, and our unique needs and desires for belonging, respect, and inclusion. We value the growth and development of our team members by providing equitable access to resources and opportunities for continuous learning, improvement, and advancement.

We strive to hire, cultivate, and retain a productive and dedicated workforce that reflects the communities we serve while we are committed to a workplace that celebrates our differences and supports equal opportunity employment and inclusion regardless of race, creed, color, national origin, citizenship or immigration status, marital status, families with children (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sex, sexual orientation, gender identity diversity, age, status as a protected veteran, honorably discharged veteran or military status, status as an individual with the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal by a person with disabilities or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local laws.


Contact Us
Should you have any questions regarding this position or the online application, contact the Human Resource Office at Recruitment@agr.wa.gov.

Prior to a new appointment into the Department of Agriculture, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position.

The Human Resources Division may use referrals from this recruitment to help fill future similar vacancies for up to six months.

Veteran's Preference: Applicants who meet the minimum qualifications and wish to claim Veteran's Preference MUST attach a copy of their DD214, or other verification of military service. Please blackout any personally identifiable data such as social security numbers. For additional information on Veteran's Preference and guidance on how to determine if you are eligible, click here.
Persons with a disability, who need assistance with their application or need this announcement in an alternative format, may call 664-1960 or toll free (877) 664-1960. TTY users should first call 711 to access the Washington Relay Service.
For more information about the Washington State Department of Agriculture, visit us at www.agr.wa.gov.
title: System Administrator

description:
Req ID: 32242
Summary
Sr. Microsoft System Administrator
Washington, DC
Chenega Agile Real-Time Solutions (CARS) was created with the purpose of providing integrated enterprise IT support to Federal customers both CONUS and OCONUS. CARS employs Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) with decades of experience working in the Federal marketplace.
Are you ready to enhance your skills and build your career in a rapidly evolving business climate? Are you looking for a career where professional development is embedded in your employer’s core culture? If so, Chenega Military, Intelligence & Operations Support (MIOS) could be the place for you! Join our team of professionals who support large-scale government operations by leveraging cutting-edge technology and take your career to the next level!
The Sr. Microsoft System Administrator position will provide Windows engineering support and will be responsible for building, patching, and troubleshooting Windows servers in support of current and future DOT systems and applications. This candidate will be working with a team of server engineers to troubleshoot issues for multiple systems in multiple data center locations. The Sr. Microsoft System Administrator will provide support, implementation, and design services for Windows-based systems across the enterprise. The candidate will be responsible for resolving and completing assigned tasks and change requests and will act as an escalation for support issues. The candidate will also be responsible for applying new solutions through research and collaboration with team members and will be advising on the course of action for new application initiatives.
Responsibilities
Manage Windows OS-based computer devices through Active Directory, Group Policy Objects, registry, and file system security as needed.
Administer systems infrastructure both on-premises and in the cloud.
Collaborate with other team members to perform server patching and maintenance.
Evaluate hardware and software purchases.
Manage 2000+ servers across multiple field site locations.
Strong knowledge of Active Directory (Windows 2016 through Windows 2022)
Manage and lead systems and infrastructure projects.
Follow existing incident, problem, release, and change management processes.
Support existing server infrastructure in a 24x7 on-call escalation capacity as part of a team rotation.
Provide high level technical support for Tier-3 issue escalations/tickets.
Design and implement Citrix solutions.
Managing and monitoring a Citrix platform
Troubleshooting Citrix-related issues
Remediating security vulnerabilities detected within the Citrix environment.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree and 10+ years of experience administrating and managing servers and systems, cloud infrastructure, file, and print environments, specializing in Windows operating systems.
Must possess a Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) - Server Infrastructure or equivalent experience.
Background check and the ability to obtain a Public Trust.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to work independently and yet be effective within a team setting.
Must be capable of managing multiple efforts with time-related constraints in a fast-paced contracting environment.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with diverse internal and external stakeholder groups and individuals.
Friendly presence, helpful attitude, good interpersonal skills, and ability to work well with others.
Excellent skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and other Office applications.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Applications, and experience working in a home office setting as well as the ability to train end users on frequently asked technical issues.
Ability to provide technical assistance and support over the phone; good phone skills, professional demeanor, and previous customer service experience strongly desired.
Good problem-solving skills; ability to visualize a problem/situation and think abstractly to solve it.
How you’ll grow
At Chenega MIOS, our professional development plan focuses on helping our team members at every level of their careers to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn.
We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their careers.
Benefits
At Chenega MIOS, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our team members and offer them a broad range of benefits.
Learn more about what working at Chenega MIOS can mean for you.
Chenega MIOS’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our team members to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and continuously look for new ways to maintain a culture where we excel and lead healthy, happy lives.
Corporate citizenship
Chenega MIOS is led by a purpose to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our team members, and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.
Learn more about Chenega’s impact on the world.
Chenega MIOS News- https://chenegamios.com/news/
Tips from your Talent Acquisition Team
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Chenega MIOS to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your research, we suggest you review the following links:
Chenega MIOS web site - www.chenegamios.com
Glassdoor - https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Chenega-MIOS-EI\_IE369514.11,23.htm
LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/1472684/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/chenegamios/
\#Chenega Agile Real Time Solutions, LLC
Chenega Corporation and family of companies is an EOE.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
Native preference under PL 93-638.
We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program
title: System Administrator

location: 201 S Avenue East, Johnson City, TX 78636
description:
PHYSICAL OFFICE LOCATION: 201 South Avenue F, Johnson City, TX 78636

Hybrid Work Options Available

$89,360 Minimum Starting Base Pay* + KPI Bonuses + Competitive Benefits
Qualifications may warrant greater starting base pay within the full pay range. Individual base pay is determined by experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training.
Position Summary
This position is responsible for the management and maintenance of PEC’s enterprise resource planning (ERP) application throughout its full life-cycle from install through end-of-life and transition to replacement solutions. Partners with IT Operations to ensure system hardware, operation systems, and procedures meet application specifications and standards.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Work directly with vendor and IT System Operations to upgrade and maintain the ERP system

.

Ensure the performance and reliability of the ERP system by monitoring these systems for high availability, and satisfactory response time

Communicate implemented enhancements to parties and conducts needed training
Monitor third party tools, such as Xymon for application and database performance, provides recommendations for enhancements and/or changes
Assist in writing technical and operation management documentation and specifications
Monitor enterprise application for user, and vendor adherence to change control procedures.
Complete support tickets in a timely fashion, based on service level agreements

Liaison between vendors, other IT groups, and end users
Complete higher level support tickets
..

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Knowledge of using computer systems, which may include setting up and using hardware and software programs, entering data, configuration or processing information
Skilled in principles and processes for providing customer service
Knowledge of system administration with ERP systems
Knowledge of security authorization design
Knowledge of various application/system monitoring architecture and development tools
Skilled in large ERP implementations in the areas of hosted and premise design tech, solution development and implementation.

Skilled in monitoring and managing application performance
Skilled in identifying, analyzing, and resolving technical application and architecture problems
Skilled in scripting to automate processes
Skilled in anticipating and resolving conflict
Skilled in time management
Skilled in prioritizing and managing changing priorities

...
....
Minimum Qualifications - (Education, Experience)

Directly related experience may substitute for education

Experience in virtual server software, specifically VMware preferred
Experience in cloud architecture preferred
Linux experience preferred.
Oracle, SQL, PL/SQL or similar scripting experience preferred

Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The employee may be required to stand; reach with hands and arms, stoop and kneel

The employee may be required to lift, carry, push, pull or move up to 25 pounds
The employee may be required to travel
Exempt employees receive a fixed bi-weekly salary to compensate them for all hours worked during each pay period
This position may be required to work more than 40 hours per week

This description is intended to indicate the kinds of tasks and levels of work difficulty required of the position given this title and shall not be construed as declaring what the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position shall be. It is not intended to limit or in any way modify the right of management to assign, direct and control the work of employees under supervision. Position Open Until Filled

title: System Administrator

description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Systems Administrator
Why This is an Exciting Role:
We're seeking a visionary candidate who will not just design, install, and operate Program Information Technology Infrastructure, but will architect a digital ecosystem that propels our products to new heights. We're in the business of delivering excellence to our customers, and this role is pivotal in ensuring that promise is kept.
Our landscape is a dynamic tapestry, woven with multiple sites and intricate networks, stretching across the expanse of the United States and ever-expanding. Within this digital expanse, Red Hat Linux forms the backbone, powering our High-Performance Computing Clusters. But that's just the beginning. The roadmap includes the integration of Wind River's VxWorks embedded Linux, promising a future of boundless possibilities. It's not just about servers; it's about the tools they host.
From engineering applications like Cadence and Atlassian to the indispensable Dynamic Object-Oriented Requirements System (DOORS) and the collaborative powerhouse that is GitHub, our environment is a canvas for innovation. And amidst it all, there's a place for Windows PCs and nimble thin clients. Join us in sculpting the future of Information Technology (IT) infrastructure, where every connection is a thread in the tapestry of progress.
Position Responsibilities:
Employ best practices when implementing security requirements within an information system including software engineering methodologies, system/security engineering principles, secure design, secure architecture, and secure coding techniques
Work directly with programs to ensure Information Technology (IT) infrastructure solutions meet the program requirements and schedules in a lab environment
Provide comprehensive end-to-end computing support in closed environments from desktops to servers
Provide broad range of systems and application support
Prepare release planning for software and hardware across the system, including patch management
Administer user system access and establishing safeguards to protect information to meet security requirements
Develop, design, integrate and maintain all computer applications
Evaluate complex system's production readiness and supportability
Perform the restoration of routine to complex computing service operations
Integrate security solutions into information systems
Protect classified and proprietary information
What Makes BI&A Different:
As a fully owned subsidiary of The Boeing Company, BI&A offers an optimal mix of a small company environment with exceptional opportunities supported by a large corporation.
Every day, Boeing Intelligence & Analytics supports global missions by building and delivering intelligence, analytics, and cyber solutions that enable users to advance national security. From hardware and software engineering solutions to analytics that keep this nation safe, we create value that meets users’ needs. With vibrant partnerships and innovative approaches, we serve the Intelligence Community through innovation and vision. We have provided our customers with the tools needed to counter evolve global and cyber threats, and to improve wartime decision-making.
Our talented employees bring software development, systems engineering, and advanced analytics expertise.
We offer numerous prime contract opportunities with customers headquartered in Maryland, Virginia, and the District of Columbia, as well as subcontract opportunities that align with our areas of focus and additional opportunities nationwide through our parent company.
We have current open positions on awarded programs across diverse customer sets and are anticipating upcoming contract awards with a 5-year life cycle and an additional 5 option years.
Our diverse portfolio allows our employees to move to other projects and teams as they gain further proficiency in their current skill set and learn new skill sets along the way.
We offer hands-on access to cutting-edge technologies and a culture of technical excellence.
Experience and Qualifications:
To be eligible for this demanding position, the ideal candidate should demonstrate the following experience and qualifications:
Required Education and Years of Experience:
Level 2: Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master's Degree or 6 years' related work experience).
Level 3: Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD, Master's Degree or 3 years' related work experience, 9 years' related work experience, etc.)
Required Qualifications:
Active TS/SCI clearance with polygraph
2+ years of experience working in a lab test, factory test, or similar test environment
2+ years of experience with operating system (Windows and/or Linux) installation, setup, and basic troubleshooting
2+ years of experience with hands on support with IT Hardware such as familiar with setting up, configuring, modifying and troubleshooting switches, routers, network equipment, high performance computing equipment, server racks
2+ years of experience working on classified networks
Active Security+ or the ability to obtain the certification within 6 months of your start date
Able to travel 10% of the time
Desired Qualifications:
Risk Management Framework (RMF) compliant with a Security+ certification or can obtain certification within first 6 months
2+ years of experience administering user system access and establishing safeguards to protect information to meet network security requirements
2+ years of experience with Linux Systems Administration
2+ years of experience with MS Windows server (2012, 2016, 2019, 2022) administration on physical and VMWare virtual servers
2+ years of experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and administering current Windows Server 2016 - 2019 and Desktop Operating Systems - Windows 10
2+ years of experience designing & implementing IT Security Systems
Experience with Windows Server and Desktop Operating Systems (Server 2016-2019, Windows 10, 20H2)
Experience troubleshooting Group Policy Objects (GPOs)
Experience with active directory (AD) to include applying domain group policies
Experience with a VMware virtual network environment.
Experience creating and maintaining multiple virtual servers based on VMware
Experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and administering support for Unix / Linux (Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)/Oracle) server/workstation
Develop PowerShell scripts to enable consistent, high-quality integration of hardware assets
Experience with scripts to automate deployment and configuration of operating systems
Experience in Agile Methodologies
Experience evaluating and effectively communicating complex system problems and resolution
Experience with System Backups, Network switch configuration,
Experience with upgrades and patches for operating systems and Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) software
Experience with information systems that comply with Joint Special Access Program Implementation Guide/Risk Management Framework (JSIG/ RMF) security requirements
Telework Availability: Telework/Remote work not authorized
Summary Pay Range:
Please note that the information shown below is a general guideline only. Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.
Level 2: $95,700 - $100,000
Level 3: $122,100 – $130,000

description:
We’re searching for System Administrator to provide support to mission critical applications and web service development.This program will maximize the effectiveness and efficiency of our country’s most important missions both at home and abroad. If you are ready to support a high-performing team that truly makes a difference, then come join us!
Job Description:
This position is for a System Administrator to support mission critical application and web service development in support of an Identity and Access Management (IdAM) solution known as MFAMs. The work also encompasses the Endpoint Services team to support systems implementing JBlocks capabilities associated with ZeroTrust. The selected candidate will serve in a SA backup role to keep the system operational and perform trouble shooting as needed.
The Level 0 System Administrator shall possess the following capabilities:
Possess an in depth understanding of RedHat Linux 8 and above
Some familiarity with AWS/eVo
Some familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes
Perform system startup & shutdown
Ability to write/test/run scripts written in Bash, Python, Perl
Perform vulnerability scans
Conduct patch management
Create/update wide of documentation and diagrams: System Security Plans, Security CONOPS, FAQ’s , How To’s
Maintain current documentation
Ability to work with little supervision
Excellent time management skills in order to multi-task and prioritize
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical disciplie from an accredited college or university
Three (3) years experience as a System Administrator performing tasks similar to what’s required for the position. Four (4) years of additional experience as an ISSO may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree.
Position requires active Security Clearance with appropriate Polygraph

RealmOne is a mid-sized science and technology company dedicated to solving our customers’ toughest mission challenges.

RealmOne has won numerous awards, to include Top Workplaces by the Baltimore Sun. Across more than 20 prime contracts, RealmOne is a premiere innovator for the Government and Department of Defense, and our team is located across the United States.

description:
System Administrator

Position Description
CGI Federal is seeking a motivated and customer-oriented professional to support a large federal client in a SharePoint Online implementation and maintenance project. The Systems Administrator (Senior) will manage and maintain the SharePoint Online environments for a Federal Government customer, ensuring compliance with security policies and providing ongoing support and maintenance.
This position is located in our Fairfax, VA office; however, a hybrid working model is acceptable.

Your future duties and responsibilities
Configure and maintain SharePoint Online environments.
Implement security measures in accordance with NIST guidelines.
Perform regular system administration tasks, including backups and restores.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to SharePoint Online.
Develop and maintain system documentation and operational procedures.
Assist in migrating existing SharePoint sites to SharePoint Online.
Provide technical support and training to staff within the agency.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Proficiency in Microsoft 365 technologies.
Technical background in administration of Microsoft 365 and specifically SharePoint Online.
Technical background and understanding of Microsoft Active Directory.
Strong understanding of NIST security requirements.
Experience with backup and disaster recovery solutions.
Bachelor's degree in an IT-related field. Equivalent years of IT work experience may be substituted.
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust.
Desired qualifications/non-essential skills required:
Desired qualifications:
Knowledge of Drupal is a plus.
Knowledge of Azure is a plus.
Azure or SharePoint certifications preferred.

description:
Tyto Athene is looking for a Systems Administrator to join our CA team.
Responsibilities:
Provide system administration of Windows-based computers, networks, and server administration, Linux system and server administration.
Work with secure networks and RMF processes.
Provide system administration of Linux systems.
Manage Hyper-V and virtual machines.
Interface with customer IT staff
Cybersecurity baseline management and change reporting as needed.
Resolve issues and develop strategies to make ongoing improvements that support system performance.
Document system requirements, write IT security plans, validate system, and network parameters to conform with business and customer requirements.
Support system evolution to keep up with new technologies and requirements.
Support system users.
Provide onsite support.
Qualifications
3 or more years of hands-on Systems Administration experience including Windows based computers, network, system, server administration; Linux system and server administration
Experience working with government secure networks and RMF Processes
Experience working with and supporting a diverse team of system users.
ISSM experience, ability to develop solutions to complex IS compliance and security problems is highly desired.
Excellent communication skills
Onsite and onsite support

Active DoD Top Secret or Top Secret/SCI clearance. Maintain active clearance at the required clearance level.

CompTIA Security+

$90k-$150k depending on skills and experience levels.
About Tyto Athene
Tyto is an IT services and solutions company that provides mission-focused digital transformation to enhance the client experience and enable them to achieve desired outcomes. Tyto's services and solutions embody its domain expertise in four major Technology domains: Network Modernization, Hybrid Cloud, Cyber Security, and Enterprise IT. Tyto offers a broad range of service delivery models including design/install projects, Managed Services, and 'As-a-Service'. With over fifty years of experience, Tyto supports Defense, Intelligence, Space, National Security, Civilian, Health and Public Safety clients across the United States and around the globe.
Requirements:
After several strategic acquisitions in 2021, Tyto Athene has experienced enormous opportunity and growth. Aside from being the leading provider of mission-focused IT and Cyber services and solutions to critical U.S. government agencies, Tyto is well-positioned to meet the growing demand for network modernization requirements across the federal enterprise.
Our employees are the key to the innovation that has made Tyto a success. We provide an environment that is geared to reward potential, innovation, and teamwork. If you would like to unleash your creativity and your career - it's time to join Team Tyto!

description:
Cloud System Administrator
The Opportunity:
Everyone is trying to “harness the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a cloud operations engineer, you know how to take advantage of cloud capabilities. On our team of experienced professionals, you’ll use cutting-edge enterprise cloud platforms to support your clients as they modernize their IT infrastructure and meet their most challenging missions. We’re looking for someone like you to help maintain and improve enterprise cloud solutions and ensure security and mission success.
You’ll closely collaborate with fellow engineers and administrators specializing in cloud solution components. Whether modernizing legacy computing platforms and applications or creating new ones from scratch, you’ll have the latest tech and brightest teammates at your fingertips.
Grow your skills at the leading edge of innovation.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
5+ years of experience in system administration, system engineering, network engineering, or cloud engineering
Experience with technical support, assistance, and training for data management, analysis, interoperability, data standardization and maintenance
Experience with cloud services, end-user access, site development, and SharePoint troubleshooting or problem resolution
Experience with Azure cloud-based provisioning, deployment, monitoring, and troubleshooting
Ability to design, build, and deliver dashboards and reports to monitor applications and underlying cloud infrastructure to identify bottlenecks causing degradation of service quality and availability
Secret clearance
Bachelor's degree
CompTIA Security+ and Microsoft Certification, including Azure Fundamentals, AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, or Operating System Certification

TS/SCI clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $67,600.00 to $154,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

description:
Responsibilities:
One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. During the year, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; and listed in Forbes ranking of America’s Largest Public Companies. Operating acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities, outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located all over the U.S. States, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom. www.uhs.com

The Corporate Information Services Department is seeking a dynamic and talented Associate System Administrator – Messaging.

As part of the Corp Messaging & Collaboration services team, the Associate System Administrator – Messaging provides support for a Microsoft Exchange messaging environment consisting of more than 200 locations and 80,000+ mailboxes. Support includes all aspects of messaging environment including Exchange, Teams, Office 365, User Provisioning services and Workspace One Mobile Device Management (MDM). Performs day-to-day operational tasks to ensure the availability and performance of the system along with diagnosing and troubleshooting issues. Working as part of a team, has visible direct interaction with home office users and over the phone interface with remote users at varying levels of the company.

Key Responsibilities include:
Performs day to day operation and management of Office 365, including Exchange Online, Teams.
Supports the UHS messaging environment by maintaining the solution and resolving incidents and requests from facility technicians and customers.
Monitors the availability and functionality of messaging environment for optimal performance.
Monitors capacity and performance to identify future system upgrades.
Provides project related support by working tasks and activities associated with various projects and initiatives.
Provides support for the Mobile Device Management infrastructure of the messaging environment.
Performs system upgrades and updates.
Tests changes and updates in a lab environment to draw up an implementation plan.
Troubleshoots system issues and performs problem analysis to resolution.
Installs and maintains messaging servers – Exchange Servers, Workspace One, SMTP configurations, Encryption and Email gateways / security appliances.
Plans, coordinates, and performs maintenance activities on messaging related servers.
Documents procedures and standards to company policy.
Creates and maintains all messaging systems documentation.
Creates scripts to reduce the amount of manual processes/intervention on the system
Qualifications:
Position Requirements:
Must have a working knowledge and understanding of IT and messaging related systems, including Microsoft Office 365 and Exchange Online, to quickly address issues. Must have experience using Windows server 2016, 2019 or 2022 as well as be knowledgeable in Active Directory. Should have a working knowledge of networks, servers, routers, switches, firewalls, PCs, and Messaging related applications. Technical expertise in the areas of messaging systems, administration, design, implementation, configuration, and security is desired along with system administration experience of Windows based servers hosting applications.

Required Experience and Skills

Associate’s degree or 2 years of college coursework towards a Bachelor’s degree is required.
Minimum 1 to 3 years of working experience in planning, designing, deploying, managing/ troubleshooting Microsoft Exchange Server (2019 or Exchange Online) systems as well as the following areas: DNS, Windows Server 2016 / Server 2019, and Windows PowerShell
Minimum 1 to 3 years of working experience with Office 365 to include Exchange and Teams. Additionally, experience with one or more of the following is preferred – InTune, Azure AD, OneDrive for Business and Azure AD Conditional Access.
Working with and troubleshooting the following technologies – SMTP, DNS, Outlook, Outlook Web App (OWA), Exchange ActiveSync, archiving and Message Transport / Mail routing
Administration and configuration of Office 365 services/applications and Exchange Online in a hybrid setup with on-premise Exchange
Experience performing migrations from on-premise Exchange to Exchange and Teams
Experience deploying and configuring Microsoft Teams, to include, setting up Teams, configuring meeting, messaging policies and managing apps
Experience using the Security & Compliance capabilities in O365 to perform security audits and mailbox e-discovery searches
Experience using Microsoft Defender to configure email policies.
Configuring and managing e-mail security devices (e.g. Symantec, Proofpoint, Barracuda)
Experience using PowerShell to script tasks for automation and to administer Exchange
Experience managing the health of Office 365 services
Experience in the backup/recovery of user data in Office 365
Configuring and managing mobile devices using InTune or Workspace One mobile device management (MDM)
Microsoft Office 365 certification preferred but not required.
Excellent teamwork abilities as well as written and verbal communication skills.
Detail oriented, organized and possesses self-management and prioritization skills to handle multiple tasks and projects.
Participation in the on-call rotation process as part of the team.
Technically knowledgeable and customer service oriented with the ability to interact with all levels of an organization in a professional manner.
Strong end-user support experience needed to resolve customer problems remotely using RDP type tools. Good communication skills (both written and verbal) required as most support is conducted over the phone.

This opportunity provides the following:
Challenging and rewarding work environment
Growth and development opportunities within UHS and its subsidiaries
Competitive Compensation
Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plan
401k plan with company match
Generous Paid Time Off

UHS is a registered trademark of UHS of Delaware, Inc., the management company for Universal Health Services, Inc. and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Universal Health Services, Inc. Universal Health Services, Inc. is a holding company and operates through its subsidiaries including its management company, UHS of Delaware, Inc. All healthcare and management operations are conducted by subsidiaries of Universal Health Services, Inc. To the extent any reference to "UHS or UHS facilities" on this website including any statements, articles or other publications contained herein relates to our healthcare or management operations it is referring to Universal Health Services' subsidiaries including UHS of Delaware.
