description:
Are you a tech-savvy problem solver with a passion for optimizing business processes? Spheros Environmental is seeking a skilled and proactive Deltek/Vantagepoint System Administrator to join our dynamic IT Team. The Deltek System Administrator will maintain the effective use of our Deltek Vantagepoint ERP System. The successful candidate will be responsible for system maintenance which includes but is not limited to troubleshooting issues and applying fixes, upgrading versions, system configuration and testing, new feature implementation, and ensuring system performance expectations are met. This position will reside in IT and work closely with Accounting and Operations.
About Spheros Environmental Group:
Today’s world is changing rapidly. Environmental challenges continue to grow in scope, number, and complexity while environmental events increase in severity around the globe. To keep up with the ever changing conditions, rules, and regulations in the environmental space, clients increasingly require external scientific expertise to navigate the regulatory landscape and maintain their right to operate. Spheros aims to be a leader in comprehensive environmental consulting services, setting the standard for excellence, innovation and sustainability practices worldwide.
Responsibilities
Lead administration, maintenance, and optimization of Deltek Vantagepoint (user management, security configuration, system updates, workflow, etc.)
Track Vantagepoint updates and implement internally with appropriate timing.
Support additional application implementations, key processes, application integrations, and change management initiatives.
Continuously monitor system performance and develop/maintain internal processes.
Perform system process testing and QA duties for implementation and enhancements.
Serve as a key leveraged support role for the Accounting Team, bridging the knowledge gap between the technical resources of Vantagepoint (internal and external) and the accounting and reporting functions.
Serve as the company’s liaison with Deltek and related consultants.
Collaborate regularly with leadership for the firm’s functional areas and explore how to best leverage the system, provide recommendations on system improvements, new release items, and user defined enhancements.
Support end-users in the day-to-day applications of the system by discussing and resolving problems (troubleshooting) in a timely manner.
Create workflows to facilitate required functionality in the system.
Develop tools for KPI monitoring and tracking, including dashboards and reports.
Assume special projects and duties as assigned or requested.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Accounting.
Minimum of 4 years experience working with Deltek Vantagepoint or Vision.
Previously worked in accounting roles, or possess a strong understanding of basic accounting concepts.
Experience making the transition from Deltek Vision to Deltek Vantagepoint.
Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills
Detail-oriented and self-motivated
Experience manipulating data for import and report building
Microsoft Office 365: Excel, SharePoint, PowerPoint, Teams
Power BI or Tableau experience
Experience working within an architecture, engineering or construction setting.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Is aware of, responds to, and considers the needs, feelings, and capabilities of others; deals effectively with others in both favorable and unfavorable situations regardless of their status or position.
Presents and expresses ideas and information effectively and concisely in an oral and/or written mode; listens and comprehends what others are saying; shares information with others and facilitates the open exchange of ideas and information; and presents information and material in a manner which gains the agreement of others.
Identifies requirements, allocates, and effectively uses information, personnel, time, and other resources necessary for mission accomplishment; establishes appropriate courses of action for self and/or others to accomplish specific goals.
Makes decisions, renders judgments, and takes action on difficult or unpleasant tasks in a timely fashion, to include the appropriate communication of both negative and positive information and decisions.
Demonstrates knowledge of the company's organizational components, the mission(s) of each relevant organizational unit, and the principal programs in the organization.
Makes well reasoned and timely decisions based on careful, objective review and informed analysis of available considerations and factors.
Total Compensation:
The starting salary range for this position is $90,000 - $120,000/annually depending upon years of experience and education. Pay is negotiable for a higher level of experience. LRE Water reserves the right to pay more or less than the posted salary range depending on experience. LRE Water also distributes bonuses and 401(k) contributions based on annual company profitability. Employer paid benefits increase total compensation by approximately 20%. Additionally, LRE Water supports training and professional development activities for all staff and offers discretionary bonus opportunities as recognition for performance, earning a professional credential, speaking engagements or publication.
Flexible/Hybrid Work Options:
While this position offers remote flexibility, our preference is for candidates who are based in the Denver area to facilitate occasional in-person collaboration and meetings.
Travel Requirements
Although rare, some travel opportunities may be available to visit satellite offices across the United States.
Equal Employment Opportunity
LRE Water is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity and promotes a work environment that does not discriminate against employees or job applicants. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, genetics, ancestry, or status as a protected veteran. LRE Water validates the right to work using E-Verify.
Disability Accommodations
If you need assistance or reasonable accommodation to complete an application on our website, please contact employment@lrewater.com. As a reminder, we do not accept applications by email.
Professional Development
LRE Water values professional development and continuous improvement, such as:
Unlimited advancement into project and client management roles
Working towards and obtaining professional registrations
External technical training courses
Internal training sessions (Lunch & learns, spring seminar, etc.)
“On the job” field and/or project training
Professional registration continuing education activities
Conferences
Mentoring
Project management
Business & client development
Professional societies & organizations leadership activities (e.g., committee & board activities)
Internal committees/leadership activities
Communication skills (e.g., public speaking, presentations, technical writing)
There is no deadline to apply.

description:
Position Summary
In this role you will be responsible for monitoring, maintaining and testing of Physical Access Control, CCTV, PSIM and Integrated Electronic Systems. This position is maintained at a single on-site work location. Candidates must be flexibility in schedule, neat in appearance, able to communicate professionally with customers and coworkers. Punctuality, attendance, a willingness to learn, and an ability to work well with others are key to success in this role.
Essential responsibilities and activities include but are not limited to:
Manage physical security system support to meet service level agreements.
Analyze physical security system performance and recommend improvements.
Resolve complex system issues for physical security systems and networks.
Triage customer support calls, providing Tier 1 help desk support and Tier 2 escalation.
Communicate with customers, manufacturers, vendors, and technical specialists.
Train system users and other system support personnel.
Analyze and modify preventive maintenance checklists for system changes.
Troubleshoot system performance issues and implement corrective actions.
Perform preventive maintenance actions including system back-ups, error log reviews, database size, and integrity checks.
Organize and prepare detailed documentation of system performance, including service request records and analysis.
Perform desktop hardware and operating system set-up, imaging software loading, and antivirus updates.
Perform all duties with minimal direct supervision.
Work Schedule
Tuesday - Sunday from 6:00am to 2:00pm
Sunday - Thursday from 6:00am to 2:00pm
Position / Candidate Requirements
Please note that in pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U.S. Citizenship and an active Secret Clearance or above.
Education: Computer Science, Engineering Degree or a Related Technical Discipline
0+ Years of Experience with a Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Risk Management, Cybersecurity
4+ Years of Experience with an Associate's Degree in Information Technology, Risk Management, Cybersecurity
6+ Years of Experience with a High School Diploma
Required Progressive Experience:
Requires system administrator experience in performing triage on system problems, resolving the system. problems, analyzing system data to prevent problems, implementing new workstations, and system extensions.
Requires reliable attendance at customer site during work hours required by customer.
Requires the ability to work flexible shifts that may include occasional nights, weekends and holidays
Requires a Security + Certification
Have reliable transportation for purposes of getting to and from work.
Desired / Advantageous Qualifications
Certification\Experience in CCure 9000 Access Control System desired.
CASP certification
Certification\Experience in AMAG Access Control System desired.
Certification\Experience in BOSCH BVMS desired.
Experience Building/Executing/Managing Ad-Hoc reports to SSRS Which Leverages Microsoft SQL
Experience programming/administrating Access Control Systems of any type desired.
Experience with installation, troubleshooting, and testing of security electronics equipment desired.
Requires an understanding of Windows patching and vulnerability remediation.
Requires a basic knowledge of Windows active directory hierarchy and implementation.
Abilities
Exposure to computer screens for an extended period of time.
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Reach by extending hands or arms in any direction.
Have finger dexterity in order to manipulate objects with fingers rather than whole hands or arms, for example, using a keyboard.
Listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
Communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
Read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
Apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
Identify and understand the speech of another person.

description:
Local candidates only, this position requires candidates to be in the Santa Monica office M-F.

XYZ is more than just a place to work. It’s an organization that values creativity, innovative thinking, and diversity. We offer a great opportunity to work alongside highly intelligent and motivated people in a dynamic environment. XYZ is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V.
JOB SCOPE: Systems Administrators are IT professionals with experience in provisioning, maintaining, and securing company assets in an office environment. This includes phones, phone systems, printers, TVs, networking hardware, firewalls, servers, storage, and backups.

MAJOR JOB DUTIES:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Provide assistance to employees experiencing technical issues
Setup computers and workspaces for new employees

Secure networking equipment inside the office
Maintain an inventory of technological assets
Order software and items required to maintain company hardware (ram, toner, monitors)

2+ years’ experience in system administration
Extensive experience with virtualization systems
Advanced knowledge of system vulnerabilities and security issues
Ability to respond to requests after hours on a limited basis
Excellent communication and people skills

Rapid problem-solving skills

50,000 - 80,000 USD per year (Santa Monica Office)

description:
POSITION GOALS
Demonstrate and promote a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
The System Administrator is responsible for the installation, maintenance, configuration and repair for servers, networks, applications, and other technology services consumed by the employees, students, clients, and partners. The System Administrator works alongside Network Engineer and Administrator and executes plans established by the Director of Network Services.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Ability to work directly with people from diverse racial, ethnic and socio economic backgrounds
Installs, configure and deploy server hardware and software, including operating systems, applications, and patches to support and maintain effective network service operations throughout the College.
Perform routine and/or preventative maintenance, upgrades, and patching of various hardware, software, and operating systems.
Manage security of hardware, software, & operating systems using role based access control and principles of least privilege.
Configures systems for high availability including strategies for back-up and recovery, failover, load balancing, and full redundancy.
Evaluates systems and alternate solutions; develops functional specifications, standards, and requirements for hardware and software purchase and design to ensure optimum system and end-user performance; makes recommendations for changes and additional services
Creates, and maintains written and verbal procedures; prepares written technical documentation, training material, standards, reports, and other documents as assigned.
Diagnoses and resolves complex software, server, and networking issues.
Attends and participates in meetings, conferences and in-service trainings; maintains current knowledge of technological advances and industry trends Test
Define, plan and implement a stable and reliable backup plan that provides data recovery.
Take a proactive approach to monitoring platforms and services, identifying and predicting problems prior to them developing into emergencies and reporting recommendations to management.
Occasional Travel will be required
Occasional after hours work as needed including weekends
Other Duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Associate’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or Information Technology.
5+ years as system administration duties in IT may be substituted for degree
At least five years’ experience in providing technology support operations and management of network systems over multiple geographic locations
Commitment to creating and working in a collaborative and team-building environment
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence
Strong written and communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Network Certifications such as Cisco, CWNA, Microsoft, Juniper, Novell, Security+, etc. are recommended. Juniper and Cisco experience preferred.
Demonstrable experience in designing, building, managing, and migrating networks, servers, and software applications.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating, and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagram form.
Strong Analytical skills
Experience deploying enterprise switches including Cisco and Juniper is preferred
Experience deploying enterprise grade centrally managed wireless solutions is preferred
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving network issues including root cause analysis is preferred
Layer 3 vlans vrf dynamic routing protocols experience is preferred
Experience with both VMware Vsphere and Microsoft Hyper-V is preferred
Experience with Virtual Desktop Infrastructure is preferred
Identify and automate routine/tedious tasks using Powershell is preferred
Experience with scripting to read and write to hardware and software APIs is preferred
Experience in monitoring networks, servers, & applications using snmp, syslog, wmi, ssh and other protocols is preferred
Experience with using monitoring metrics for capacity management of resources needed to meet business requirements is preferred
Experience in evaluating and configuring firewall policies is preferred
Experience with applying principals of least privilege to satisfy business requirements is preferred
Active Directory experience required including configuring various server roles is preferred
Ability to perform periodic security assessments and remediation of deficiencies is preferred
Experience with working with spam filtering products/services is preferred
Working knowledge of installing SQL Server and performing basic SQL queries is preferred
Experience working with on-premise Exchange Server is preferred
Experience administering Microsoft Office365/Azure is preferred
Experience in managing security surveillance systems is preferred
Experience with performing lifecycle upgrades including migrating configuration information from vendor to same vendor or from one vendor to another vendor is preferred
Experience in creating of best practices applicable to environment is preferred
Experience developing, building, implementing & testing disaster recovery and business continuity plans is preferred

Benefits
Camden County College offers a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time employees that includes medical, prescription, dental plans, life insurance, short & long- term disability, retirement plans, and a flexible spending account. The College also offers a generous paid time off policy, as well as paid holiday time. Additional benefits include an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), tuition reimbursement, tuition waiver programs and professional development opportunities.
Special Instructions for Applicants
This position requires constant mobility throughout the campus. Dexterity in working with computers, servers, and network equipment is mandatory.

description:
Job Title: System Administrator
Department/Program: Information Technology
Reports to: Director of IT
Work location: Sandy, Portland
FLSA status: Exempt/salaried
Salary : $34.38/hr. - $36.70/hr.
Morrison Child and Family Services: We are a Joint Commission and Sanctuary accredited non-profit
organization that provides a comprehensive array of services to children, adolescents, and their families. As an agency, Morrison, its team members, and clients commit to the following values of trauma-informed care:
Nonviolence - being safe and doing the right thing
Emotional Intelligence - managing our feelings so we don’t hurt ourselves or others
Social Learning - respecting and sharing ideas of our teams
Democracy - shared decision making whenever possible
Open Communication - saying what we mean and not being mean when we say it
Social Responsibility - everyone makes a contribution to the organizational culture
Growth and Change - creating hope for our clients and ourselves
Equity - Assuring all can survive and thrive
Position/Job Summary:
The System Administrator plays a key role in supporting and maintaining the agency’s existing infrastructure, in solving IT challenges and moving forward the automation of processes to improve efficiency. The System Administrator is responsible for provisioning, installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. Also, ensures that system hardware, operating systems, software systems, application systems, and related procedures adhere to organizational procedures, methods. A successful candidate must be able to perform server deployments, troubleshoot network or firewall issues, support our staff to solve technical issues and manage IT related projects seeing them through to completion. Must have the ability to learn and maintain knowledge of multiple application areas
Position/Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Field incoming help requests from end users via web-based helpdesk, email, telephone and walk in visits in a courteous and professional manner.
Perform regular file archival and purge as necessary.
Perform daily backup operations, ensuring all required file systems and system data are successfully backed up to the appropriate media, recovery tapes or disks are created, and media is recycled and sent off site.
Create, change, and delete user accounts per request.
Apply OS patches and upgrades on a regular basis and upgrade administrative tools and utilities.
Build rapport and elicit problem details from end users.
Prioritize and schedule incidents. Escalate incidents (when required) to the appropriate technician or staff.
Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and frequently asked question resources on the Internet and internal knowledge base to aid in problem resolution.
Perform hands-on fixes at the desktop level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications.
Perform preventive maintenance, including checking and cleaning of servers.
Develop help sheets and frequently asked questions/answers for employees and team members.
Develop an understanding of the unique technology requirements that exist within the organization.
Suggest and advocate technology solutions and enhancements that meet the need of the business.
Monitor and Maintain Software Compliance and Maintenance Agreements.
Manage domain certificates for server compliance.
Ensure security through access controls, backups, and firewalls.
Manage Identity management service through Okta.
Manage IP Security cameras and camera server.
Maintain and manage Microsoft Office365/Microsoft Security & Compliance.
MDM management of cell phones and Macbooks (Cisco Meraki).
May be responsible for supervising staff as part of their role.
Participate in the practice and continuing implementation of the Sanctuary Model.
Other duties as assigned to ensure successful operation of department.
Competencies:
Demonstrated ability to learn and maintain knowledge of multiple application areas.
Ability to perform server deployments, troubleshoot network or firewall issues, support our staff to solve technical issues and manage IT related projects seeing them through to completion.
Self-motivated and able to work alone with minimal supervision.
Ability to work collaboratively with teams and individuals from various parts of the agency.
Ability to work effectively within a diverse culture.
Possess excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to adjust communication style to meet the level of technical understanding of each end-user.
Ability to maintain professional relationships with co-workers, staff, management, and vendors.
Ability to maintain appropriate professional boundaries and confidentiality.
Ability to hold each other and yourself accountable to the diversity and uniqueness of all individuals within Morrison, our clients and our community stakeholders.
Required Position Qualifications: (Minimum qualifications required by the contract/program to be considered for hire into this position)
Bachelor (4-year) degree, with a technical major, such as Computer Science or Engineering. Four years of directly related work experience may be considered in place of a degree.
5 years’ experience hands-on Desktop Support Analyst/Technician.
Experience providing IT services to multi-location, standardized environment.
System Administration or Systems Engineering certification with Microsoft, Cisco or Linux
Experience with VMWARE technology and deployment
Experience with Microsoft Office365/Exchange Server administration (Cloud and On-Prem)
Preferred Position Qualifications:
Bilingual language skills (Spanish) helpful
Other Requirements:
Able to work shift hours and days, as assigned and to meet internal client needs. Position may require work outside of usual work hours on occasion.
Able to pass a comprehensive criminal history background investigation
Due to the hands-on nature of maintaining systems at multiple sites, must hold a valid drivers’ license and maintain minimum auto insurance policy. Position requires the ability to get to different work locations efficiently throughout the workday and sometimes without prior notice.
We are an Affirmative Action Plan Employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic.
In compliance with our Affirmative Action Plan, Morrison uses E-Verify to determine employment eligibility after an offer is accepted.
Applications will be reviewed as received. Morrison reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any point during the posting period.
Morrison employees are offered a variety of benefits including Medical, Vision, Dental, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employer-Paid Life, Accidental Death and Dismemberment and Long-Term Disability, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
If your personal values align with our agency's vision and dedication to serving youth and families, please submit your résumé, application, and cover letter to
www.morrisonkids.org/careers
.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $34.38 - $36.70 per hour
title: System Administrator

description:
PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income with deep expertise across public and private markets. We invest our clients’ capital across a range of fixed income and credit opportunities, leveraging our decades of experience navigating complex debt markets. Our flexible capital base and deep relationships with issuers have helped us become one of the world’s largest providers of traditional and nontraditional solutions for companies that need financing and investors who seek strong risk-adjusted returns.
Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.
Position Description
As a key member of PIMCO’s Financial Planning & Analysis team, the Oracle EPM System Administrator will take ownership of our Oracle Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) system administration. You will be responsible for ensuring the technical health, efficiency, and effectiveness of the applications used for developing financial and operational forecasts, budgets, and delivering operational financial reporting. Beyond day-to-day system maintenance and end-user support, you will collaborate with stakeholders to elevate our Oracle system by driving improvements and transformational changes in our planning, forecasting, and reporting capabilities.
As a global firm, our projects and tasks require close coordination with diverse teams and colleagues worldwide. Therefore, strong teamwork, effective communication skills, and collaboration with stakeholders across finance and other functions (both internal and external) are crucial. As our industry and business continue to evolve and grow more complex, a solutions-oriented mindset, flexibility, and the ability to adapt and think critically are also essential skills for this role.
Location
Newport Beach, CA.
About You
If the following qualities resonate with you, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. At PIMCO, we offer a dynamic work environment where you will have the chance to make a meaningful impact:
Experience working both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Apply critical thinking skills to approach problem-solving from a comprehensive perspective.
Curious and initiative-taking mentality, adaptive learner and adaptable to acquiring new processes, concepts, and skills.
Exhibit flexibility in adapting to shifting priorities, managing deadlines, and supporting multifaceted initiatives in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail, effectively multitasking and managing priorities while utilizing strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
Embrace change and modern technology, being proactive in finding opportunities for process improvement.
Embody PIMCO's values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility, and Excellence, which drive our dedication to delivering the best to our clients and each other.
Responsibilities
The key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Own all administration activities for Oracle EPM which encompass: Supporting multiple planning and reporting applications and cross function management of system administration team within the technology organization.
Develop deep understanding of company hierarchies and how they work within FP&A reporting (i.e., income statement, balance sheet, and KPI’s)
Maintain the overall EPM production environment of Hybrid Planning (BSO) & Reporting (ASO).
Manage data load process and forms.
Support month-end reporting cycles including off business hours and weekends, as required.
Provide innovative reporting solutions using Narrative Reporting tool by leveraging built in functionalities, such as, books, batches, and notes.
Manage security and user administration.
Conduct testing, including system integration, performance, and user acceptance testing.
Coordinate between technical teams, business functions, and system integrators to drive progress as new functionality is implemented.
Prepare and maintain necessary documentation including design documents, test documentation, training materials, and administration/procedural guides.
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, IT, or related field required.
Minimum four years’ experience in Oracle EPM Hyperion Planning design.
Development and administration with 2+ years on EPM Cloud including EPBCS (Freeform, Hybrid BSO, ASO), Narrative and Management Reporting, Data Management (EDM), EPM Automate, and EPM Cloud experience.
Advanced Excel skills.
Experience in providing system support and direct contact with users to solve issues with Oracle Enterprise Planning & Budgeting Cloud Service (EPBCS) & Enterprise Data Management (EDM) business applications.
Proficient knowledge of all components of EPBCS including metadata administration, outlines, dimensions, complex calculations, business rules, calculation scripts, Groovy, creating snapshots, backups, data and artifact migrations, security setup and configuration, data forms, charts & graphs, menus, task lists, as part of application development and configuration.
Proficient knowledge of creating financial reports (PDF), charts, pivots, dashboards, books, batches, snapshot reports, comments etc., using Narrative Reporting.
Proficient in managing incidents, managing changes, troubleshooting and root cause analysis, performance tuning activities.
Ability to support month-end reporting cycles, including occasional off-business hours.
Familiarity with Finance and Accounting principles.
Professional Skills Requirements
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills for effective and autonomous problem-solving.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to engage professionally with individuals at all levels.
Strong commitment to delivering high-quality work accurately and on time.
Effective in responding to inquiries from management and maintaining positive relationships with internal and external contacts.
Keen sense of urgency and the ability to prioritize and balance multiple tasks with strict deadlines.
Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment while also being self-sufficient in achieving business objectives.
Desired Qualifications
Certification in Planning Implementation, Narrative Reporting, Enterprise Data Management.
Exposure to the Financial Services industry.
PIMCO follows a total compensation approach when rewarding employees which includes a base salary and a discretionary bonus. Base salary is the fixed component of compensation that is determined by core job responsibilities, relevant experience, internal level, and market factors. The discretionary bonus is used to award performance and therefore is determined by company, business, team, and individual performance.
Salary Range: $ 110,000.00 - $ 130,000.00
Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Statement
PIMCO recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), age, military or veteran status, disability (physical or mental), any factor prohibited by law, and as such affirms in policy and practice to support and promote the concept of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action, in accordance with all applicable federal, state, provincial and municipal laws. The company also prohibits discrimination on other basis such as medical condition, or marital status under applicable laws.
Applicants with Disabilities
PIMCO is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, including veterans, in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system due to a disability and you would like to request an accommodation, you may contact us at 949-720-7744 and leave a message. This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers with disabilities to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be considered. A response to your request may take up to two business days.
title: System Administrator

description:
Terms of Employment: 12-Month
Exemption Status: Non-Exempt
AFSCME Salary Scale UB 19
EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS AND WORK EXPERIENCE
Required:
High School Diploma or GED.
Maryland Class C license.
Minimum of five years related experience, which must include:
o Installation, management, and maintenance of Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) and associated components.
o Installation, operation, and maintenance of computer systems involved with security systems (intrusion detection, surveillance cameras, access control), fleet fuel card management, and building automation systems.
Ability to drive commercial type service vehicles trucks and vans.
Strong skills in working with confidential information, exercising good judgment, and performing with high levels of professionalism.
Proven analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting abilities.
Self-motivated with strong independence and collaboration skills.
Excellent customer service and communication skills, both written and verbal, and cross group collaboration skills.
Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment in performance of work.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities.
Willingness to take on further training as required and to work overtime when necessary.
Preferred:
Associate degree from an accredited college/university in electronics, computer science or related field.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Oversees the development, maintenance, and functionality of CMMS applications.
Develop and implement training presentations to departments affected by the implementation of CMMS software.
Ensures accuracy and consistency of CMMS utilization by all departments.
Generate reports to aid department personnel in implementing KPIs and quality control.
Monitor, evaluate, and maintain fleet fuel management system.
Assist with the operation, maintenance, repairs, and upgrades to CCBOE security systems, including IP and analog surveillance cameras, digital and analog video recorders, intrusion detection, and access control systems.
Handles configuration management for hardware and software, particularly for system moves, additions, and changes.
Analyzes, troubleshoots, and resolves problems with assigned systems.
Present information through multiple communication methods and respond to inquiries from managers, CCBOE staff, and the public.
Interpret technical documents, blueprints, schematics drawings, operations and maintenance manuals and procedures.
Assist in managing stockroom personnel and mechanics in collaboration with the Supervisor of Maintenance.
Oversees and manages bus and fleet mechanics with the assistance of the Supervisor of Maintenance.
Assists the Supervisor of Maintenance in scheduling, preparation and submitting of information pertinent to the CMP (Comprehensive Maintenance Plan) and the IAC (Interagency Commission on School construction) Facility Maintenance assessment inspections.
Coordinate the planning and implementation of snow and ice removal, prior, during and after such weather events.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Supervisor of Maintenance.
ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The environmental factors and/or physical requirements of this position include the following: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is regularly required to reach with hands and arms and operate machinery. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee frequently must squat, stoop, or kneel, reach above the head, and reach forward. Requires good hand-eye coordination, arm, hand, and finger dexterity, including ability to grasp, and visual acuity to use a keyboard. The employee continuously uses hand strength to grasp tools and climbs on to ladders. The employee will frequently bend or twist at the neck and trunk more than the average person while performing the duties of this job. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 75 pounds such as a toolbox. Occasionally the employee will lift and/or move up to 90 lbs. such as furniture or equipment. The employee will sometimes push/pull items such as tables, scaffolds, and cabinets. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, depth perception, peripheral vision, and the ability to focus. The employee will regularly work indoors and outdoors. The employee will work near or with moving mechanical equipment. The employee may work with toxic or caustic chemicals such as petroleum products, degreasers, sprays, cleaners, fertilizers, seed, and non-household dust. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate and occasionally will work in a loud area.

Responsible for monitoring IT hardware operations to ensure proper configurations

description:
DESCRIPTION:
This is a contract role through Magnit for an American energy company based in Jackson, Michigan
Location: Jackson MI
Role Overview: 33712830 System Administrator II
We are seeking a Sr. RHEL Linux Systems Engineer. This role involves managing and maintaining RHEL systems, ensuring operational continuity, and conducting vulnerability assessments. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with RHEL, VMware ESX, and Satellite for patch management. Additionally, the role includes some support of Windows servers and workstations and participating in an on-call rotation.
Duties:
Operational Continuity: Ensure daily operations run smoothly, prioritize tasks to meet customer requirements.
Communication: Provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive updates to management, on-site counterparts, and customers.
SLA Adherence: Strictly adhere to SLAs, ensure the team is aware of deadlines and targets.
Documentation: Ensure timely and proper knowledge documentation.
Vulnerability Assessments: Conduct regular vulnerability assessments for Linux systems.
Patch Management: Manage patch deployment and ensure timely updates.
Mitigation Strategies: Analyze vulnerabilities and develop effective mitigation strategies with the team.
Reporting: Maintain detailed records and prepare vulnerability reports.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to identify, assess, and mitigate vulnerabilities in RHEL-based systems and applications.
Regulatory Compliance: Manage critical systems in a heavily regulated environment.
Teamwork: Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Windows Support: Provide support for Windows servers and workstations.
On-Call Rotation: Participate in an on-call rotation to ensure 24/7 support.
Upcoming Deliverables:
Server Deployments: Physical and virtual RHEL server deployments and support.
Patch Management: Patch management via Satellite.
Multi-Factor Authentication: Implementation of Multi-Factor Authentication using RSA.
SMTP Relay: Implementation of SMTP Relay.
Additional Tasks: Handle other tasks and projects as they arise to support the team and organizational goals.
Skills:
RHEL Administration: Proficient in RHEL 6/7/8/9 with strong skills in administering VMs using VMware ESX.
Patching Expertise: Well-versed in patching processes, techniques, and mechanisms, including the use of Satellite for patch management.
Network Configuration: Experienced in configuring LDAP, DNS, NTP, DHCP, NFS, static routes, and Samba.
User and Security Management: Skilled in managing user accounts, security, rights, disk space, and process monitoring in Red Hat Linux.
Storage Management: Proficient in implementing and administering Linux-based storage managers such as LVM.
File Systems: Knowledgeable in file systems like EXT2, EXT3, XFS, UFS, OCFS, OCFS2, and other journaling file systems.
Windows and Active Directory Support: Experience in supporting Windows servers, workstations, and Active Directory.
Location:
HYBRID – Jackson, MI
Education
Associates degree or equivalent experience is preferred
Hourly Pay Rate Range (dependent on location, experience, expectation)
The pay range that Magnit reasonably expects to pay for this position is: $38-$51/ per hour
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K (provided minimum eligibility hours are met)
All qualified applicants will not be discriminated against and will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected veteran status, disability, race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Work Authorization : Green Card, US Citizen

Link Solutions Inc. is seeking a Windows System Administrator (Associate-Level) to join our team in Tucson, AZ.
Must be a US Citizen
Must have DoD Top Secret Clearance
Non-remote (relocation incentive available)
24hr Operation. Multiple shifts available
The Windows System Administrator will support the Air National Guard’s Unmanned Aerial Vehicle operations as part of a diverse team managing a globally distributed information system. This role includes analyzing, administering, and maintaining data communication networks.
Join a professionally diverse team at an industry-leading organization that prioritizes work/life balance and values its employees. At Link Solutions, you’ll contribute to national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for growth and advancement. We seek technologically savvy, detail-oriented, and self-motivated individuals who can deliver exceptional service to our clients.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide Tier I & II support to a global information system.
Manage the functionality and efficiency of a group of computers running on one or more operating systems.
Configure, manage, and maintain servers within a VMWare virtualized environment.
Maintains the integrity and security of servers and systems.
Set up administrator and service accounts.
Maintain system documentation.
Interact with users and evaluate vendor products.
Recommend hardware and software purchases, coordinate installations, and manage backup recovery processes.
Develop and monitor policies and standards for allocation related to the use of computing resources.
Develop and implement testing strategies and document results.
Provide advice and training to end-users.
Provide guidance and work leadership to less-experienced staff members.
Provide local on-call/call-back touch labor support.
Participates in special projects as required.
Maintain/apply STIGs and patches/firmware updates.
Maintain email and database server.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
Qualifications:
US Citizen
Must have DoD Top Secret Clearance
Minimum one (1+) year of directly related experience in systems administration and analysis.
IAT Level II Certification (CompTIA Security+ CE, CCNA Security Training, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC) equivalent or higher.
Computing Environment certification in either Windows Server, ACAS, HBSS or similar technology within 6 months of hire.
Preferred:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field with a comprehensive understanding of computer science concepts.
Knowledgeable and experienced in VMWare NSX or CISCO VXLAN.
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) servers experience.
Experience working in a Department of Defense (DoD) environment.
Problem solver and troubleshooter who thrives in resolving complex problems.
Team leader seeking growth into supervisory responsibility/experience.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.
Additional Information:
Link Solutions Inc. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package to include paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, company-paid long and short-term disability, life insurance, referral bonuses, relocation incentive program, certification reimbursement program, retirement, and more.
Link Solutions, Inc. is an EOE. AA/M/F/D/V. We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
About Peraton
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.
Responsibilities

Peraton is seeking a Linux System Administrator to join our team in the Fort Meade, MD / Annapolis Junction, MD area. Our dynamic team delivers information security solutions that facilitate secure data flows and the detection/prevention of unauthorized behaviors, performs system security vulnerability assessments and solution development, provide enterprise-level network, server, desktop, and application security services.

As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets.

The ideal candidate will possess Linux system administration experience in a Linux environment (Linux, Redhat Linux, CentOS).

The Linux System Administrator duties may include but are not limited to:

Provide support for implementation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of IT systems.
Manages IT system infrastructure and any processes related to these systems.
Provide support to IT systems including:
Provide Tier 1 (Help Desk) and Tier 2 (Escalation) problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems.
Day-to-day operations, monitoring, and problem resolution for all the client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc
Provide support for the dispatch system and hardware problems and remain involved in the resolution process.
Provide detailed analysis and feedback to agency management and internal customers for escalated tickets
Provide support for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and internal customers.
Optimize system operations and resource utilization and perform system capacity analysis and planning.
Configure and manage UNIX and Windows (or other applicable) operating systems and installs/loads operating system software, troubleshoot, maintain integrity of and configure network components, along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability and performance.
Installs and configures Linux systems including back-end databases and scripts.
**This role requires 100% on-site support M-F**

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Active/current TS/SCI security clearance with a current polygraph is required.
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Five (5) years of relevant Systems Administrator experience may be substituted in lieu of a bachelor's degree.
Current/valid DoD 8570 compliance with IAT Level II is required.
Familiarity with Linux system administration experience in a Linux environment (Linux, Redhat Linux, CentOS).
Familiar with patching and updating Linux operating systems.
Ability to perform back-end IT support, installation, configuration, and maintenance of Linux operating systems.
Desired Qualifications:

Makes recommendations to purchase hardware and software, coordinates installation and provides backup recovery.
A current/valid Linux Certification in one or more of the following: CompTIA Linux+, GIAC Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), Linux Foundation Certified Engineer (LFCE), Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator, Oracle Certified Professional (OCP), Oracle Certified Specialist (OCS), or Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA).
Experience in Linux automation using Ansible.
Experience in Creating and using Containers in a Linux Environment.
Experience with scripting in Python, Linux shell.
Experience with Network Scripting: Python, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Unix, BASH, C#, C++, SQL.
Salary Range Estimates:

The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Peraton's total compensation package for employees.

Benefits:

Peraton offers enhanced benefits to employees working on this critical National Security program, which include heavily subsidized employee benefits coverage for you and your dependents, 25 days of PTO accrued annually up to a generous PTO cap and eligible to participate in an attractive bonus plan.

#AJCM

Target Salary Range

$80,000 - $128,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

EEO
An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Our Values

Benefits
At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

Paid Time-Off and Holidays
Retirement
Life & Disability Insurance
Career Development
Tuition Assistance and Student Loan Financing
Paid Parental Leave
Additional Benefits
Medical, Dental, & Vision Care

The Learning Management System Administrator is an essential member of the Instructional Innovation Team and is responsible for operational oversight of the College Learning Management System (LMS) and in supporting outstanding online education at Western Nevada College. The LMS Administrator brings innovation and creativity combined with technical expertise and a strong awareness of user experience to the role. The scope of work includes operations management, performance monitoring, service integrations, upgrades, migrations, communication, planning and evaluation of emerging technologies.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and two years of related professional experience. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted for the Bachelor's degree (i.e., AA+3 or 4 yrs related professional experience
Preferred Qualifications:
2 years of experience in learning management systems, Canvas preferred.
Experience in IT application programming or data systems integration.
Experienced training others in technical applications.
Strong communication, analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills.
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to changing operating systems and technological environments.
Experience analyzing and troubleshooting software and hardware user problems.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Provides the main point of contact for all issues relevant to the LMS.
Manages the LMS, including installing, maintaining, and supporting all integrations in accordance with WNC policies.
Ensures proper configuration, monitoring and documentation are in place to ensure outstanding service to online learners and faculty.
Consults regularly with stakeholders to ensure needs are being met effectively.
Collaborates with academic faculty in making course content fully functional in the LMS.
Communicates effectively with vendors as needed.
Provides training to users as needed.
Adheres to FERPA guidelines related to sensitive data.
Troubleshoots and resolves Tier 2 issues relating to system functionality and integrated services.
Responds to help requests in a timely and positive manner.
Reviews user access privileges in accordance with WNC policies.
Effectively organizes and manages several projects with concurrent, time-sensitive deadlines.
Provides leadership in the planning and delivery of projects in the LMS.
Writes timely and relevant reports to support data informed decisions at all College management levels.
Is available outside of working hours to resolve emergency issue promptly.
Provides leadership and supervision to part-time and student workers as needed.

description:
High Performance Computing System Administrator, Lemont, Il
This role has been designated as ‘Remote/Teleworker’, which means you will primarily work from home.
Who We Are:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Maintain the HPC systems availability to the customer, but also create and document site procedures, system diagrams, and other configuration or support documents

Provide solutions and implement repair or workarounds when possible, fully documenting steps taken when required

Ability to lead and work effectively in a team environment

description:
TEAM UP WITH US!
The Workday System Administrator is critical role in the corporate shared services group, responsible for administrating the company’s financial reporting software, Workday Adaptive. The Workday System Administrator is expected to take ownership of all system administration tasks and drive ongoing enhancements within the Workday Adaptive software environment. Ownership means ensuring processes are facilitated timely and accurately, operate within established guidelines, and are regularly reviewed against business, industry, and legal requirements.
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Administrate the company’s budgeting and financial reporting software, Workday Adaptive, through:
Working with Management across the company to assist with requests; providing configuration guidance, demonstrations, considerations, tips & tricks
Performing functional testing and troubleshooting product configurations and/or enhancements; resolve issues or provide optimal product configuration to meet business needs
Clearly and effectively communicating responses and value to end-users
Creating and delivering presentations on how to use Workday features to achieve business goals
Providing one-on-one guidance to accelerate user acceptance and familiarity with Workday
Keeping up to date with industry practices and the ability to engage with Management and the end-user base on those topics
Managing user access and system setup
Maintain, optimize and enhance processes and/or system; identify, recommend and implement changes to enhance system performance and effectiveness
Maintain awareness of system functionality, updates and enhancements; understand and anticipate impact on the organization’s Workday functionality
Support the annual budgeting process and provide reporting and analysis on the company’s financial performance
Assist with the preparation and analysis of quarterly, annual, and 5-year operating plans
Engage in ad-hoc financial analysis, including special projects at the request of leadership
Collaborate with leadership and provide input regarding strategic planning and future implementations of Workday system

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
Bachelors’ Degree in Accounting or Finance; or 2-4 years in a Workday Consultant, Financial Analyst or Accounting role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Prior experience with Workday Adaptive strongly preferred.
Basic knowledge of general accounting and budgeting processes.
Strong computer skills.
Exceptional verbal/written communication, collaboration, inter-personal, project management, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Detail oriented.
Ability to work and interact with departments throughout the organization.
Willingness to learn.

WHY WORK WITH US?
We like to take care of business and have fun doing it!
We offer health, dental, vision, life, and more as a comprehensive benefits package.
Don’t you want to work with awesome people?

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.
Required travel up to 10%.
This position is not considered a safety sensitive position.
The Job description is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.

title: System Administrator

description:
Job ID: 2411622
Location: HUNTSVILLE, AL, US
Date Posted: 2024-09-08
Category: Information Technology
Subcategory: Sys Administrator
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time
Minimum Clearance Required: Interim Secret
Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret
Potential for Remote Work: No

Description
SAIC is seeking a System Administrator to join our team in Huntsville, Alabama.
The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining the virtualized server environment, ensuring high availability, performance, and security of the infrastructure. This role requires a combination of technical expertise, strategic planning, and a service-oriented mindset to support our organization’s IT objectives.
Responsibilities:
Install, configure, and manage virtualization environments using VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V.
Perform routine maintenance, upgrades, and troubleshooting of the virtual infrastructure.
Migrate physical servers to virtual machines and manage virtual-to-virtual migrations.
Monitor system performance, resource usage, and plan for necessary infrastructure adjustments in anticipation of load changes or growth.
Ensure data redundancy and system backup procedures are in place and regularly tested.
Collaborate with the IT security team to implement and enforce security policies and to maintain best practices for virtual environments.
Provide technical support and guidance to end-users and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Document system configurations, standard operating procedures, and system changes or updates.
Stay current with the latest virtualization trends and technologies and suggest improvements to the existing infrastructure.
Work with vendors and external support teams to resolve technical challenges and maintain hardware/software life cycles.
Qualifications
Required Education:
Bachelors and five (5) years or more experience; Masters and three (3) years or more experience; PhD and zero (0) years related experience; four (4) years of experience considered in lieu of degree.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience administering virtual environments, specifically with VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V.
VMware Certified Professional (VCP) and/or Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) certification preferred.
Strong understanding of server hardware, storage solutions, networking, and disaster recovery strategies.
Experience with scripting and automation tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively with different levels of management and staff.
Strong documentation skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage projects and multitask in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to be on-call and available to respond during off-hours for critical support issues
Clearance:
Candidate must have the ability to obtain and maintain a full Secret clearance; Minimum of an Interim Secret clearance required to start.

SAIC accepts applications on an ongoing basis and there is no deadline.

Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

description:
System Administrator Lead
Job Category: Information Technology
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: TS/SCI
Employee Type: Regular
Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
Type of Travel: Local
* * *
CACI is looking for a Senior Systems Administration Lead to support our customer, U.S. Southern Command (USSOUTHCOM), in Doral, Florida. This position is contingent upon award of the USSOUTHCOM Cyber Information Technology Enterprise Services (SCITES).
System Administrator Lead has broad responsibility for systems administration of platforms installed throughout the USSOUTHCOM AOR.
Ensure the operation of the enterprise meets defined service levels and serves as the contractor’s service owner for infrastructure service solutions.
Responsible for applying security principles, practices, and procedures under the RMF to maintain compliance with applicable security regulations.
Experienced systems administration lead that will provide senior level technical expertise of computer software, hardware, and networks.
Responsible for designing, organizing, modifying, and supporting enterprise multi-security computer and network systems.
Oversee local area networks, wide area networks, and network segments. Daily tasks may include installing, upgrading and monitoring software and hardware.
Maintain the essentials such as operating systems, business applications, security tools, web-servers, email, laptop, and desktop PCs. Audit logs and provide reports as required.
Research the latest technological advances and recommend enhancements to improve existing security systems. Other duties as assigned.
Manages experienced professionals who exercise latitude and independence in assignments, Leads, directs and reviews the work of a team who exercise latitude and independence in their assignments. Typically, has hiring, firing, promotion and reward authority or ability to recommend and influence decisions within own area, in accordance with manager review and approval.
Manages a team with a focus on policy, implementation of strategic initiatives and execution of day to day deliverables. Establishes or works to achieve, team objectives, operational plans with measurable contribution towards the achievement of results of the job function or completion of a project.
Responsible for systems administration, operations maintenance, and associated activities of platforms installed throughout the USSOUTHCOM enterprise.
Ensure the operation of the enterprise meets defined service levels and serves as the contractor’s service owner for service solutions.
Responsible for applying security principles, practices, and procedures under the RMF to maintain compliance with applicable security regulations.
Responsible for synchronization of operational activities to Operations Lead for enabling command and control for AO Uniform constructed networks.
Required Skills:
Masters degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field and 7 years recent specialized experience (Bachelor’s degree can be substituted, with two additional years experience for 9 total)
Possess a TS security clearance with SCI eligible.
DoD 8570 certification (minimum IAM Level III).
Experience designing, implementing, and operating on-Premise, off-premise and hybrid data centers with both legacy and cloud based technologies.
Current TS/SCI
Desired Skills:
Minimum of 8 years of experience managing data operations in a medium to large, geographically dispersed, multi-domain network architecture within the Department of Defense.
Minimum of five years as a Senior Systems Administrator
Minimum of five years of experience with managing enterprise IT teams in geographically separated locations supporting O&M of servers (e.g., physical and virtual), operating systems (e.g., Windows and UNIX/LINUX), databases, collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint), VMWare, ESXi, software applications, scripting, SANs, and computer security in an enterprise.
Minimum of five years of experience with cloud-based solutions.
Minimum of five years of experience in a virtual desktop enterprise environment.
Possess a current MCSE Certification.
______________________________________________________________________________
What You Can Expect:

A culture of integrity.
At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.
CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

A focus on continuous growth.
Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.
Learn more about CACI here.
______________________________________________________________________________
Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.
The proposed salary range for this position is:
$89,500-$188,000
CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

description:
Make your mark at Comcast - a Fortune 30 global media and technology company. From the connectivity and platforms we provide, to the content and experiences we create, we reach hundreds of millions of customers, viewers, and guests worldwide. Become part of our award-winning technology team that turns big ideas into cutting-edge products, platforms, and solutions that our customers love. We create space to innovate, and we recognize, reward, and invest in your ideas, while ensuring you can proudly bring your authentic self to the workplace. Join us. You’ll do the best work of your career right here at Comcast. (In most cases, Comcast prefers to have employees on-site collaborating unless the team has been designated as virtual due to the nature of their work. If a position is listed with both office locations and virtual offerings, Comcast may be willing to consider candidates who live greater than 100 miles from the office for the remote option.)

Job Summary
Responsible for contributing in one or more areas of expertise in collaboration with various cross-functional project teams. Exercises solid knowledge of engineering skills and methodology. Applies long-term objectives and plans related to the company's technical vision to daily activity. Applies innovative solutions for engineering developmental problems that are competitive with industry and company standards with little direction. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.
Job Description
*This position is unable to provide work authorization sponsorship or immigration support now or in the future.*
The Technology, Product, Experience (TPX) organization works at the intersection of media and technology and our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience.
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled engineer to join our team. You will play a critical role in managing and maintaining our Linux infrastructure, primarily based on Rocky Linux 8+. This position requires a strong foundation in system administration to ensure the optimal performance, security, and reliability of our servers. You will be responsible for upholding Comcast cybersecurity standards while supporting efficient system operations.
What You’ll Do:
Maintain and update the video delivery Server (VDE) build process documentation to ensure operations can consistently build and deploy VDEs in the field.
Provide ongoing support for VDEs in the field, ensuring optimal performance and addressing any technical issues.
Install, configure, and maintain Linux systems (Rocky 8+ or Redhat).
Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls.
Monitor system performance and troubleshoot any issues.
Install, configure, and maintain essential system services like web servers, databases (postgres), and applications.
Automate routine tasks using scripting languages and tools.
Implement and maintain system security measures to protect against unauthorized access and vulnerabilities, ensuring compliant with Comcast cybersecurity standards.
Stay up to date with the latest security updates and patch management procedures.
Document system configurations and procedures.
Collaborate with other IT professionals to ensure seamless system integration and support.
Skills & Experience We’re Looking For:
Minimum 2+ years of experience as a Linux System Administrator or similar role.
Proven experience managing and maintaining Linux systems
Strong understanding of system administration principles and best practices.
In-depth knowledge of network protocols and architectures (TCP/IP, DNS, etc.).
Experience with network security principles and best practices (firewalls, VPNs, etc.).
Expertise in network troubleshooting and performance optimization.
Proficient in working with the command line.
Strong understanding of Linux security concepts and best practices.
Understanding of network monitoring tools and techniques.
Excellent knowledge of shell scripting and familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Python, etc.).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Additional “Nice to Have” Skills:
Experience with Ansible.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Experience using version control systems (e.g., Git, GitHub).
Windows platform knowledge.
Experience with virtualization technologies.
Experience with network administration.
About Our Perks & Benefits:
We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated.
Here's a look at just some of the perks and benefits we make available to our US-based employees:
Medical & Dental
401(k) Savings Plan
Generous paid time off
Life Milestones - from adoption assistance, childcare resources, pet insurance, and more, Comcast supports you at all life stages.
Courtesy Services - We offer all of our full-time employees in serviceable areas free digital TV and internet.
Discount tickets for Universal Resorts, including theme park tickets and onsite hotel rooms.
Learn more at jobs.comcast.com/benefits
Reasonable Accommodation
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Disclaimer:
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.
Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.
Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Salary:
Primary Location Pay Range: $68,836.63 - $103,254.94
Comcast intends to offer the selected candidate base pay within this range, dependent on job-related, non-discriminatory factors such as experience. The application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later.

Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits to eligible employees. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Relevant Work Experience
2-5 Years
