description:
Responsibilities:
One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. During the year, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; and listed in Forbes ranking of America’s Largest Public Companies. Operating acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities, outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located all over the U.S. States, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom. www.uhs.com

The Corporate Supply Chain Department is seeking a dynamic and talented Associate System Administrator – Culinary and Nutrition.

With some guidance from experienced staff, the Associate System Administrator – Culinary and Nutrition supports various specialized Culinary and Foodservice digital platforms, specifically but not limited to MealSuite Blueprint 360, Master List Management (locked order guide platform), and Foodservice Direct Order. Provides support for contracting and sourcing initiatives across multiple food service and culinary categories through software driven processes, compliance, and purchased services. Performs all data collection tasks and analysis related to initiatives. Assists with vendor management, term compliance, new product or systems implementations ensuring compliance with UHS Legal and Business specifications, department operating procedures and sound systems administration practices.

Key Responsibilities include:
Implements and maintains Master List Management, including builds based on regions training of facility level users, and processing item requests.
Implements and maintains foodservice management systems such as Blueprint 360, including ingredient analysis, distribution confirmation, and recipe entry. Partners with vendor support teams in facility level implementations.
Creates menu cycles based on maximizing purchasing programs, availability, clinical parameters, and regional preferences. Educates facilities on and assist in implementing such cycles.
Obtains necessary data points and performs analytics in support of contract and compliance initiatives. Reports on financial progress of systems implemented.
Partners with vendors and software system designers to maximize and support corporate based enterprise systems.
Qualifications:
Position Requirements:
Bachelor's degree required.
Demonstrated experience in the administration of Microsoft applications such as Excel, Word, and Outlook.
Ability to completely document systems as built.
Demonstrate problem analysis and troubleshooting skills.
Demonstrate verbal and written communication skills required for problem definition and resolution.

Challenging and rewarding work environment
Growth and development opportunities within UHS and its subsidiaries
Competitive Compensation
Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plan
401k plan with company match
Generous Paid Time Off

Any employment referenced in this website is not with Universal Health Services, Inc. but solely with one of its subsidiaries including but not limited to UHS of Delaware, Inc.

UHS is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at UHS via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of UHS. title: System Administrator

description:
Overview:
DNI is seeking a qualified System Administrator candidate to support the U.S.
Air Force (USAF) at Langley AFB (Ryan Center) in Hampton, VA.
Responsibilities:
Install, configure, maintain, and administer servers including, but not limited to, TBMCS, MAAP-TK, GCCS-J, JADOCS, VMware, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL, SCCM, ACAS, HBSS and Citrix. Tasks include, but are not limited to, auditing system logs, password changes, authoring/deploying group policies and user account maintenance.
Install, maintain, and administer software based on commercial operating systems, including but not limited to Windows7/10, Solaris, Linux, UNIX, and Windows Server 2016/2019.
Load system application software and patches.
Install, configure, and maintain rack mounted and stand workstations/servers.
Manage local system backups.
Perform daily, weekly, monthly and annual system maintenance tasks.
Coordinate with local and remote users, workgroup managers, and communications focal point personnel to resolve computer software and hardware problems.
Coordinate changes to the systems network, computers, servers, or LAN systems with communications focal point and configuration management personnel.
Support Development Test and Evaluation (DT&E) and Operational Test and Evaluation (OT&E) of systems and new technologies as directed by the Government.
Provide system administration subject matter expertise during the design, procurement, and fielding of hardware/software systems.
Provide mentorship and training to newly assigned systems administrators and other users as required. Create new training tasks as required.
Collaborate with AOC Training Managers as necessary to ensure mission qualification training (MQT) requirements and instruction are accurate and are representative of current local configurations, technologies, and support responsibilities.
Provide trouble ticket management, coordination, and resolution as a member of the AOC enterprise help desk.

Qualifications:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Demonstrated proficiency using unclassified (NIPRNet) and classified (SIPRNet) network enterprise environments, office automation software to include Microsoft operating systems and Microsoft Office suite of applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), and hardware virtualization environments.
Demonstrated systems administration proficiency with Microsoft Windows operating system software for servers and workstations.
Demonstrated systems administration proficiency with Sun Microsystems Solaris operating systems software for servers and workstations.
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a field applicable to this position with a minimum of three (3) years of experience in a USAF AOC in lieu of a bachelor’s degree, or joint partner equivalent, and demonstrated proficiency administering operational-level C2 and associated systems including, but not limited to, TBMCS, MAAP-TK, GCCS-J, JADOCS, VMware, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL, SCCM, ACAS, HBSS and Citrix. Experience within an USAF AOC is preferred over joint experience.
Highly desired: Completion of the Air Operations Center Initial Qualification Systems Administrator course (AOCIQTSYS)

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENT:

This position requires US citizenship and current TOP SECRET Security Clearance with SCI eligibility. We can work candidates who do not have a TS but must have a SECRET at start of work and be eligible for TS.
Travel, at the Government’s request, to support installations, conferences, testing, troubleshooting, or training. Travel may be OCONUS or CONUS.
Experience supporting AOC operations within classified environments to include SIPRNet and/or JWICS
EQUIPMENT and MACHINES:
Standard office equipment (PC, telephone, fax, etc.), and/or other industry-specific equipment.
Server/client hardware platforms

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Work may involve sitting for extended periods. May require lifting and carrying up to 25 lbs. Must have sufficient mobility to enter areas of manufacturing and military sites or facilities where necessary.

AAP/EEO Statement:
DNI complies with all federal, state, and local laws designed to protect employees and job applicants from discrimination based on race, religion, color, sex, parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, or other non-merit-based factors.

title: System Administrator

description:
Description:
Company Overview: Join our dynamic team at REJIS Commission, a leading technology solutions provider committed to delivering innovative IT solutions to our clients. Serving law enforcement, criminal justice, governmental, and quasi-governmental entities, REJIS provides innovative, affordable data solutions that keep our agencies working and our citizens secure. As we continue to expand, we are seeking an energetic self-starter, to fill a Junior System Administrator position (Associate Network Analyst) to contribute to our ongoing success.
Position Overview: As a Junior System Administrator, you will ensure the stability, security, and optimal performance of our client's desktop, and server environments. You will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, documentation, and monitoring of desktop, and server systems to meet our clients' needs. The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background and some experience in Microsoft desktop, and server technologies and a passion for delivering exceptional customer support.
Key Responsibilities:
Desktop administration, including hardware (workstations, printers and laptops), and desktop operating systems support, (Windows 10 and 11).
Server Administration (Windows and Linux) - includes server installation, upgrades, and configuration; server roles, storage, Active Directory, domain configurations, and Group Policy; file, print, and web services; remote access, virtualization, application servers; troubleshooting, performance; and reliability.
Enterprise Storage Support: Daily administration, provisioning, and alert responses.
Enterprise Backup administration: job monitoring, and resolutions to alerts.
Enterprise Security: administration, deployments, monitoring and responses.
VMware administration: system performance monitoring, and alert responses.
Network Administration: Responsible for installing, monitoring, troubleshooting, integrating, and upgrading network infrastructure, including hardware and software components. Monitors and troubleshoots network activity.
Perform routine system maintenance tasks such as enterprise patch management, software updates, and system backups.
Troubleshoot server hardware and software issues and implement appropriate solutions.
Ensure compliance and participation with security policies and procedures, including user access controls, data encryption, Multifunction Authentication, Security Incident Response, and vulnerability management.
Provide technical support and assistance to clients regarding desktop and server-related issues.
Document system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps for knowledge-sharing and reference purposes.
Requirements:
Qualifications:
An associate's degree (AA) or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school and two (2) years related experience and training; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proven experience as an Administrator of desktop, server, networking, or similar.
Some knowledge of Microsoft server operating systems, including Windows Server 2016, 2019, and 2022.
Some experience with Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, and other Microsoft server technologies.
Some experience with server hardware, virtualization technologies, and storage systems.
Familiarity with networking concepts and protocols, including TCP/IP, VLANs, and routing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Relevant certifications such as Microsoft, VMware, A+, Network+, or CompTIA Server+ are a plus.
Benefits:
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on public safety and emergency response
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Access to professional development and training opportunities

title: System Administrator

description:
We’re seeking Systems Administrators to manage, troubleshoot, and maintain IT systems, including client/server, network devices and mobile platforms. This program will maximize the effectiveness and efficiency of our country’s most important missions both at home and abroad. If you are ready to support a high-performing team that truly makes a difference, then come join us!
Job Description:
Provides support for implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of information Technology (IT) systems. Manages IT system infrastructure and any processes related to these systems.
Provides support to IT systems including day-to-day operations, monitoring, and problem resolution for all of the client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc. Provides Tier 1 (Help Desk) and Tier 2 (Escalation) problem identification, diagnosis, and resolution of problems. Provides support for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and internal customers. Provides support for the dispatch system and hardware problems and remains involved in the resolution process. Configures and manages UNIX, Linux and Windows operating systems and installs/loads operating system software, troubleshoots, maintains integrity, and configures network components along with implementing operating systems enhancements to improve reliability and performance.
The Level 1 System Administrator shall possess the following capabilities:
Provide support for implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of IT systems
Manage the daily activities of configuration and operation of IT systems
Provide Tier 1 (Help Desk) problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems
Provide assistance to users in accessing and using IT systems
Provide Tier 1 (Help Desk) and Tier 2 (Escalation) problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems
Perform account management, e.g. establishing, activating, modifying, disabling, and removing accounts.
Provide configuration management, implementation, and sustainment of compliance with applicable system security controls.
Perform periodic vulnerability scans of systems
Provide support to IT systems including day-to-day operations, monitoring and problem resolution for all of the client/server/storage/network devices, mobile devices, etc.
Implement IAVA security patches and insure patch status is recorded in appropriate systems of record.
Provide support for the escalation and communication of status to agency management and internal customers.
Optimize system operations and resource utilization, and perform system capacity analysis and planning.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Four (4) years of additional SA experience may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree.
Five (5) years experience as a SA in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required. Two (2) years of experience with Service Management (ITSM) is required.
One (1) years of experience with ServiceNow platform is required. (An additional two (2) years of experience may be substituted for the ServiceNow platform experience.)
Certifications Required:
Requires DoD 8570 compliance Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II certification.
Position requires active Security Clearance with appropriate Polygraph
About Us
RealmOne is a mid-sized science and technology company dedicated to solving our customers’ toughest mission challenges.
Headquartered in Columbia, MD., RealmOne supplies advanced cybersecurity, data science and software engineering services and products to customers in the Government and commercial sectors.
RealmOne has won numerous awards, to include Top Workplaces by the Baltimore Sun. Across more than 20 prime contracts, RealmOne is a premiere innovator for the Government and Department of Defense, and our team is located across the United States.
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

description:
Title:
System Administrator
Belong, Connect, Grow with KBR!
KBR is seeking an experienced Systems Administrator (Secret Clearance) to support Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) efforts related to Aviation Product Lifecycle Management (AvPLM) who will provide System Administration support for the AvPLM IPT and its customers. You will maintain IT infrastructure through installing and configuring software, monitoring and troubleshooting issues within the environments, and ensuring IT security utilizing DoD policies, in addition to other tasks. As a SA, setting up and maintaining the infrastructure will be your primary focus but you may regularly interact with other Infrastructure Administration sub-teams to support the AvPLM Cloud environments as well as a litany of supporting applications (to include Siemens Teamcenter PLM suite and eQube MI). To support this, you will work alongside other sub-team SAs as well as members from the Applications Administration team to perform a variety of infrastructure and integration activities. This will include collaboration with the AWS GovCloud hosted system boundary for the AvPLM environments as well as use of AWS Cloud Native Services to perform normal daily duties.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform daily checks of IT systems. Triage, monitor, and work NAVAIR National Help Desk support tickets. Complete Configuration Change Control Board (CCB) requests. Perform general IT requirements, installation, configuration, maintenance, and security in an unclassified network environment for applications, databases, integrations, or infrastructure as assigned. Support Windows Server builds and have the ability to harden systems to be in compliance with DoD RMF policies.
Perform security monitoring and maintaining security patches and updates on Windows servers, using ACAS/Nessus vulnerability management to maintain compliance. Support Windows Server performance monitoring including monitoring disk space; and resource utilization, capacity and availability . Provide troubleshooting support using application/server logs and Windows logs. Coordinate outsourced help requests. Assist with coordination of Maintenance Scheduling. Assist with license and subscription management. Possess the ability to work well independently and as part of a team. Attend and contribute to Teams collaboration meetings for new requirements, troubleshooting/diagnosis, monitoring, and server side application support. Assist with documenting processes and procedures and keeping documentation updated. Provide weekend and after hours support as required.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Education & Experience: A bachelor’s degree in an IT related field (Computer Science, Computer Engineering) plus 4 years experience OR 12 years of experience in a related field in lieu of a degree.
Clearance & Citizenship: U.S. Citizenship required. Active Secret clearance or clearance eligibility, Single Scope Background Investigation.
Certification: Security+ CE and an OS (Operating System) Certification
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience supporting the DoD community.
This position offers a flexible remote working environment.
Compensation: $80,000-112,000. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.
KBR Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.
Inclusion and Diversity at KBR: At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient. #LI-ML2
KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
This position is responsible for the maintenance and efficient running of OCCC’s LMS and is a liaison between the Center for Learning and Teaching and several other departments. As part of the CLT team, this person will lead a support system for students, faculty, and staff as they use the College’s LMS and other technologies. The LMS Administrator will work to diagnose and correct issues with and improve the functionality of the LMS by providing all levels of support within the CLT team and will function as the primary point of contact for LMS and technical support. When required, this position will communicate with internal and external entities to identify potential issues and work with them to find solutions. This person will also develop and lead faculty trainings, create various resources regarding the LMS as well as other learning technologies, and work on various CLT and Academic Affairs projects and initiatives.
Reports To Director of the Center for Learning and Teaching What position(s) reports to this position?
N/A
Minimum Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree

Minimum (3) years’ full time work experience in an educational setting that includes a combination of technical support, LMS experience, technology training creation and facilitation, and/or creating accessible content.

Equivalency/substitution: An Associate’s degree will be considered if combined with minimum (5) years’ full-time work experience in lieu of Bachelor’s degree.

Less experience will be considered if combined with technical certifications (ex. CSS, JavaScript, HTML, etc.) and/or a higher degree.
Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Knowledge:
Exceptional proficiency with computers, the Internet, and technology

Positive attitude

Significant experience using Office 365 (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)

Knowledge of WCAG, 508, and ADA web accessibility standards and ability to create accessible videos and documents

Skills:
Strong interpersonal, customer service, and active listening skills

Exceptional problem-solving and organizational skills

Basic writing and researching skills

Effective public speaking skills

Knowledge of IT best practices regarding computer system maintenance

Experience researching and using new technologies in an educational environment

Abilities:
Ability to communicate effectively by phone, email, and in-person

Ability to work in a busy and diverse team environment

Ability to work effectively as part of a project team

Ability to troubleshoot a wide variety of basic PC and browser issues

Ability to give presentations

Ability to diagnose complex technological issues and identify appropriate solutions

Ability to easily learn and teach new skills and technologies as well as create and present trainings

Ability to use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to resolve LMS issues, increase site accessibility, and enhance site functionality
Physical Demands/Working Conditions
PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:
The work is light work which requires the person in this position to occasionally exert up to 20-25 pounds of force to grasp, lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Additionally, the following physical abilities are required:
This position requires the person to frequently move about the office and OCCC campus.
This position requires the person to frequently communicate with and listen to administration, faculty, staff, students, and others to perform the essential functions of the position; must be able to exchange accurate information in various situations.
This position requires the person to frequently remain in a standing and stationary position.
This position requires the person to frequently operate a computer, other office machinery, and mobile devices to perform the essential functions of the position.
This position requires the person to frequently operate equipment that involves repetitive motions of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.
This position requires the person to occasionally ascend/descend stairs, a ladder, scaffolding, ramp, etc. to perform the essential functions of the position.
This position requires the person to frequently position self to access materials that may be above head or at ground level.
This position requires the person to frequently position self to work with computer equipment and/or to instruct or assist faculty and staff.
This position requires the person to use upper and lower body to exert force up to 20 pounds to push, pull or lift materials or equipment.
This position requires the person to judge, observe, and assess the accuracy, neatness, thoroughness of work assigned or to make general observations.

Work is performed in a relatively safe, secure, and indoor office or classroom setting.
Work is performed in a dynamic environment that requires sensitivity to change and responsiveness to changing goals, priorities, and needs.
Work is performed during normal office hours; other days and times may be needed to support the mission and vision of the College or the CLT.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree

(2) years of experience in education with experience in LMS administration, teaching in an LMS, and creating and running SQL queries
Required Training
Quarterly compliance training as assigned by institution.
Work Hours
Working hours may include the typical Monday-Friday 8:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. CLT operating hours along with some regular and/or occasional evening and weekend hours in response to any technical issues and/or changes to the CLT’s operating hours to continue to meet the growing online support needs of faculty, staff, and students.

Applicants are to thoroughly complete the online application and attach the following required documents: cover letter, resume, and transcript conferring highest degree. Use “Other Document” if attaching a copy of technical certification
Applicants who do not attach the required documents will not be considered for the position.
For application assistance, please contact Human Resources at (405) 682-7542, Monday through Friday between the hours of 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM.
title: System Administrator

description:
Description
Our Leidos team in San Diego is seeking a seasoned Top Secret cleared Systems Administrator to join our team to support various classified environments. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining, securing, and supporting complex classified information systems, as well as ensuring compliance with security protocols and regulations.
Primary Responsibilities
This role includes a combination of duties to protect information, and maintain security controls, for an entire system, site, or program to reduce risk.
Act as a primary point of contact and support channel for user requests and issues.
Ensure compliance with government regulations such NIST Special Publication 800-53.
Regularly perform security patching, vulnerability remediation, system hardening, and generation of compliance artifacts for Windows and Linux-based operating systems.
Work independently, and with others, to effectively communicate and document issues, standards, or procedures.
Other duties as assigned.
Basic Qualifications
Must be a U.S. Citizen with an Active Top Secret security clearance to be considered.
DoD 8570 IAT level II or higher certification such as CompTIA Security+.
Experience troubleshooting, patching, and maintaining operating systems and third-party environments.
Knowledge of change management procedures, roles, and responsibilities.
Must have experience as a system administrator of Windows-based domain environments to include DNS, Group Policy, File Shares, NTFS Permissions, and Active Directory.
Experience with patch management, firewall configurations, Windows Services, disk management, encryption, and networking.
Knowledge of the DoD implementation of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) and governing directives (NIST, CNSS, DCSA, etc.).
Bachelor’s degree with 2-4 years of experience or relevant industry-standard certifications and experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with the RedHat operating system or willing to learn.
Experience conducting and remediation of vulnerability scans.
Experience analyzing and implementing DISA STIG’s.
Experience creating customized scripts using bash or PowerShell to automate tasks.

2024-09-19

The successful candidate will have extensive experience in Azure Single Sign-On integrations, Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, and other O365 workloads. Exceptional understanding of scripting and source code programming languages, such as Python, PHP, and/or PowerShell

description:
Department:
Human Resources
Start Here. Grow Here. Stay Here.
We are looking for a Systems Administrator who enjoys working independently and thrives in a project-led environment. In this role, you will manage our Workday System which includes security roles, business processes, system integrations, and implementation of new modules. If technology is your passion and want to use your skills to support Sarasota County and the members of its community, apply today and join our Human Resources team!
Workday System Administrator:
Serve as the primary administrator for the Workday, responsible for configuration, maintenance, data loads, integrations and optimization.
Manage Workday security configuration, business processes, and security administration. Manages security roles and domains for the BCC and Elected Officials.
Responsible for being knowledgeable regarding the Workday roadmap and upcoming product releases, reviewing release notes, assessing new features, understanding the impacts on business processes and basic changes in functionality.
Monitor system performance, troubleshoots issues, and resolves problems related to Workday functionality, data integrity, and system integrations.
Maintain documentation related to system configurations, processes, and user guides.
Monitor and track progress on Workday support tickets and collaborate and support functional leads with escalated issues.
Trouble shoot complex issues or problems related to security and business process function regularly.
Project Management/Workday Planning:
Participate in strategy planning with manager to implement new Workday modules as needed based on road map.
Collaborate as a team member with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and translate them into Workday system configurations and workflows. May develop new solutions within existing functionality to address emerging needs. Collaborates other team members to identify opportunities for process improvements and automation within Workday.
Lead the configuration and maintenance of core Workday components, including but not limited to organizations, hierarchies, security roles, business processes, reports, and integrations. Consults with all divisions of HR adjusting business processes to meet changing needs; adjust complex integrations.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of Workday business processes, custom reports, and analytics to support functional areas.
Provide end-user support and training, ensuring employees and managers are equipped to effectively use Workday and its features.
Lead system testing, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing for Workday updates, enhancements, and integrations.
Assist in the design and implementation of new functionality.
Recommend, implement, and plan for improvements, enhancements, and new applications to the Workday system.
Review the work of primary report writer (Business Professional II) as well as the work of others utilizing the reporting tool. Acts as a consultant to all report writers in all units of HR creating complex calculated fields as needed.
About You
To thrive in this role, you will need:
Minimum of 4-year degree and four (4) years of related experience
OR- Master’s degree and two (2) or more years of related experience.
Experience may substitute for or related field, or strong equivalent work experience administering Workday including system-level security, business processes and configurations
Thorough and highly technical understanding of Workday Administration particularly regarding functional configuration, reporting, security and integration
Discipline to work with highly confidential information and ability to critically analyze data input/output for accuracy and effectiveness
Excellent communication and collaboration skills both oral and written
Ability to work independently and/or in a collaborative environment
Demonstrated and proven skill in completing assignments accurately and with attention to detail
Ability to organize and prioritize work under pressure while meeting deadlines
About Everything Else
Starting Pay Range: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 annually, based on your experience
Our interview process could include phone interview(s), Microsoft Teams video interview(s), and/or in-person interview(s).
If you are selected to join our team, you will need to present the following items on your first day:
1. I-9 Acceptable Documents to show your identity and authorization to work. Use this link to learn more and review the different document options:
https://www.uscis.gov/i-9-central/form-i-9-acceptable-documents
If your position requires a Florida Driver’s License, this must be one of your documents. (Your Florida Driver’s License can serve as one of your documents listed in link above – List B Documents.)
2. U.S. Social Security Card (signed, physical card). This is a requirement of our Payroll Department and failure to provide this document could jeopardize timely compensation. (Your U.S. Social Security Card can serve as one of your documents listed in link above – List C Documents.)
Benefits:
Enjoy great benefits including Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Florida Retirement System (FRS) and many, many more! Choose one of three great medical plans, including one with a $0 premium option, with completed preventative visits!
Utilize our award-winning wellness program including free gyms at multiple Sarasota County Government locations.
Enjoy 11 paid holidays, 3 personal days and 16 paid vacation days in the first year of full-time employment with increasing accrual rates with years of service. (That adds up to a possible 30 days off in your 1st year!)
A different blend of voices prompt better conversations, choices and results for everyone. Sarasota County – Many Voices, One Team.
We celebrate and value the experiences, backgrounds, perspectives, talents and strengths that make us different.
Our vision is to attract, develop, retain and engage a talented workforce broadly representative of the citizens and communities we serve. To further value creativity, innovation, collaboration and great customer service – internally and externally.

We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today’s mission and stay ahead of tomorrow’s threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world.

What is YOUR Mission?
Empowering a global business. Providing affordable solutions. Delivering competitive discriminators by unleashing deep expertise. These are just some of the many ways the Digital Technology team at Raytheon Technologies creates success for our customers. Joining our team will allow you to collaborate with Raytheon organizations to enable business growth, speed, and agility through business innovation, technical proficiency, and operational excellence.

Our Digital Technology (DT) organization ensures that Raytheon teammates across the globe are able to communicate, collaborate and innovate for customer success. We create leading-edge technology solutions to prevent security threats, secure the integrity of our systems and support IT infrastructures around the world.

Principal System Administrators, internally known as Principal Analyst, infrastructure Workplace Services, collaborate with a diverse team to support exciting, critical programs with classified information system capabilities. Success in this role means you are able to develop, implement and maintain secure, cost-efficient environments across various classified programs. Program teams rely on your collaboration and guidance to define computing requirements and create end-to-end solutions to solve complex IT infrastructure problems.

Responsibilities to Anticipate:
Provide IT systems administration in a heterogeneous Microsoft Windows and Redhat Enterprise Linux environment.
Understanding and knowledge of Windows Server internals or Linux fundamentals to include DNS, DHCP, AD, and server replication methods.
Working as a team member in a fast-paced technological environment. Use troubleshooting techniques to resolve technical problems of a moderate to high scope and complexity to include the integration of hardware and operating systems (OS).
Understanding of data RAID, data backup uses and technologies. Install and configure software applications requested by end users.
Work with Cybersecurity professionals to maintain security requirements and provide documentation and training on advanced IT processes and procedures and other tasks as assigned.
Must be able to obtain Department of Defense Directive (DoDD) 8140 / 8570 Certification requirements (CompTIA Security+ CE or equivalent certification) within 6 months of start date.
Must be able to develop solutions and documentation to a variety of technical problems.
Systems are operational 24x7 and occasionally require work effort beyond standard work hours.
Travel required to other US Domestic locations as business needs dictate up to 10% travel.
Full time 100% Onsite position
Basic Qualifications:
Typically requires bachelor’s degree and minimum of 5 years of prior relevant experience or a master’s degree and minimum of 3 years of prior relevant experience.
Must be able to obtain a transferable U.S. government issued secret security clearance prior to start date. U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.
Must Window experience.
Experience in one of the following: Active Directory, VMware, MySQL, networking administration experience.
Preferred Qualifications:
Linux experience highly desired
VMware highly desired
An active DoD TS/SCI with Polygraph clearance or prior SCI/program eligibility
Department of Defense Directive (DoDD) 8140 / 8570 Certification requirements (CompTIA Security+ CE or equivalent certification and an Operating System Certification)
Experience with NISPOM, JAFAN, JSIG, DFARS and/or DoD/RMF
In-depth working experience in Windows Server
Experience with data storage, NAS, and SAN technologies and solutions
Experience with using Information Technology project lifecycle management processes.
Experience using VMWare vCenter, vSphere, and ESX and/or other virtual computing methods.
Experience supporting engineers in software, simulations, and hardware development.
Experience with Microsoft WSUS, SMECP, and/or Exchange
High Performance Computing (HPC) experience in a Linux environment
Scripting Experience
What We Offer:
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer an extensive total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement, and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the outstanding benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance, and children/adult backup care.
Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role.
Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products.
The salary range for this role is 77,000 USD - 163,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills.
Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.
Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.
This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.
RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.
RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: System Administrator

location: 1640 South Ryan Road, New Haven, IN 46774
description:
Overview:
**This position is not remote and will be required to be on-site at our New Haven, IN location**
Provide essential support for the organization's technology infrastructure. This includes troubleshooting computer issues, managing software installations and updates, and assisting with hardware setup and configuration. May also contribute to ongoing IT projects, performing data entry, documentation, and testing while also playing a crucial role in the design, implementation, and maintenance of the organization's network infrastructure. This involves tasks such as configuring switches/cameras, monitoring network performance, and identifying/resolving network issues.
Responsibilities:
Help Desk: often the first point of contact for troubleshooting computer issues, resetting passwords, and answering basic tech questions.
Software Support: may assist with software installations, updates, and configuration.
Hardware Support: may help with setting up new computers, printers, and other equipment.
Project Assistance: can be involved in ongoing IT projects, assisting with data entry, documentation, and testing.
Network Design & Implementation: may help with designing, installing, and configuring network infrastructure, including switches, cameras, and other various equipment.
Network Monitoring & Troubleshooting: can assist with monitoring network performance, identifying and resolving network issues.
Documentation & Reporting: can help with documenting network configurations and generating reports.
Qualifications:
Required:
Completed/Enrolled in a relevant degree program: could be computer science, information technology, network engineering, or a related field.
Technical skills: basic understanding of computer hardware and software, networking concepts, and operating systems.
Problem-solving skills: ability to identify and troubleshoot technical issues.
Communication skills: ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with common operating systems: Windows, macOS, Linux
Experience with troubleshooting software and hardware issues
Knowledge of basic networking concepts
Resides or planning to re-locate within driving distance of New Haven, IN
Preferred:
Previous relevent job experience
Personal projects demonstrating technical skills
Understanding of networking protocols
Familiarity with network devices
Steel Dynamics Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
title: System Administrator

description:
F006249 Position Status Full Time Assignment Length This field only applies to Faculty Grant Funded No Category APT Class Code 15 - 13 Starting Pay $61,484 Special Note Commensurate with education and experience Location District Department DT Technology Infrastructure Job Summary
This position is responsible for supporting and maintaining the TCC Azure, Microsoft 365 (M365), Cloud-based environments, and virtualization technologies by providing administration, implementation, process development, and technology integration in a collaborative manner. This position also provides technical expertise for deploying and supporting applications in Azure/M365 and works closely across all of IT to ensure positive customer outcomes.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Essential Performance Requirements*
Designs, configures, manages, and maintains Azure, M365, and VMware applications, services, systems, and resources
Adjusts Virtual Desktop and Virtual Server Infrastructure to improve system performance
Works closely with Operations, Application Development and Administration, Infrastructure Technology, Endpoint Support Staff, Business Leads, and other teams to implement and incorporate application and service processes in Azure, M365, and VMware
Monitors, reviews, and maintains security and service alerts and the overall health of the Azure, M365, and VMware environments including applications, services, and systems
Identifies and analyzes problems associated with the Cloud environment and develops problem-resolution strategies
Works with Identity and Access Management staff to support account management processes
Provides Level 2 and 3 Help Desk support for Azure, M365, and VMware applications, services, and systems
Develops instructions and support/configuration documentation for Azure, M365, and VMware applications and services for IT staff and end-users
Responsible for creating, editing, and maintaining technical reference documentation for Azure, M365, and VMware
Maintains system backups while also creating and updating system scripts
Exhibits fiscal responsibility by optimizing Azure resources for cost and performance optimization
Supports virtual servers and workstations in both the Cloud and on-premises environments

General Supervision
System Administrator IV – V
Provides direction and support to team members by assisting with advanced or complex technical situations and by providing guidance regarding best practices
Acts as a mentor by providing support to team members as they expand their knowledge and build higher-level skills

Service Excellence
Participates on behalf of the College in external community organizations and associations as assigned to support the essential performance requirements
Attends the workplace regularly, reports to work punctually, and follows a work schedule to keep up with the demands of the worksite
Completes all required training and professional development sessions sponsored through the Tarrant County College (TCC) Institute
Supports the mission, values, goals, and principles of the College

Performs Other Related Tasks as Required
The duties listed are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position. The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.
Required Minimum Qualifications
System Administrator I
High school diploma or GED and two (2) years’ working experience related to the Essential Performance Requirements; or any equivalent combination of education, training, certification, and work-related experience

System Administrator II
High school diploma or GED and four (4) years’ working experience related to the Essential Performance Requirements; or any equivalent combination of education, training, certification, and work-related experience

System Administrator III
High school diploma or GED and five (5) years’ working experience related to the Essential Performance Requirements; or any equivalent combination of education, training, certification, and work-related experience

System Administrator IV
High school diploma or GED and seven (7) years’ working experience related to the Essential Performance Requirements; or any equivalent combination of education, training, certification, and work-related experience
ITIL v4 Foundations certification

System Administrator V
High school diploma or GED and nine (9) years’ working experience related to the Essential Performance Requirements; or any equivalent combination of education, training, certification, and work-related experience
Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-103 or AZ-104) certification
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with virtualization technologies (Hyper-V)
Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-103 or AZ-104) Certification
Microsoft Identity and Access Administrator (SC-300) Certification
Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals (MS-900) Certification
Major security certifications (Security+, CEH, or GIAC GCIH)
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of networking principles and concepts
Knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10+ and/or Microsoft Server 2016+
Knowledge of Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, or PowerShell
Skilled in excellent customer service and interpersonal relationships, including strong listening, verbal, and written communication with technical and non-technical customers
Skilled using applications and enterprise systems, including the Microsoft Office suite
Skilled in working with formal Change Control Systems based on the ITIL model
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment
Ability to think critically to effectively solve and communicate problems in a fast-paced environment where the demands for work are varied, and unpredictable in scope and volume
Ability to analyze data and provide sound recommendations based on policy, procedure, practice, and existing regulations
Ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly while exhibiting strong attention to detail and organization
Ability to delegate work appropriately to faculty and staff to meet College and campus deliverables

System Administrator II and III (in addition to the Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities listed above)
Knowledge of system monitoring tools

System Administrator IV (in addition to the Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities listed above)
Skilled working with SAML-based authentication and identity providers

System Administrator V (in addition to the Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities listed above)
Skilled working with JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)
Physical Demands and Work Environment
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representatives of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and climb or balance. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representatives of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.
Accommodations
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities.

title: System Administrator

benefits: 401(k) matching,Cell phone reimbursement,Dental insurance,Disability insurance,Employee discount,Gym membership,Health insurance
description:
URM Stores, Inc. is currently looking for a motivated System Administrator to join our growing team! Our System Administrator will provide enterprise server support and troubleshoot issues related to the OS and platforms in use at URM to include, but not limited to: VMware, Nutanix, Windows Server, Citrix, Vocollect, Exchange/Exchange Online, iVanti and others.
This position is a 100% on-site position at our Corporate office in Spokane, WA. If selected for this position, URM will not provide any relocation assistance.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Facilitate rapid and effective resolution of infrastructure incidents by troubleshooting with both URM IT team members and our 3rd party vendors.
Manage system performance and troubleshoot issues related to physical iSeries servers.
Maintain the operations of various servers, IBM iSeries systems and network components to insure proper function and availability to end-users.
Utilizes various monitoring tools as provided such as directly reviewing system console messages, event logs, emails alerts, audible alarms from the data center environmental.
Patch, upgrade, and maintain server operating systems and related firmware to remain compliant with IT standards and policies.
Provide enterprise server support and troubleshoot issues related to the OS and platforms in use at URM to include, but not limited to: VMware, Nutanix, Windows Server, Citrix, Vocollect, Exchange/Exchange Online, iVanti and others.
Assist with Active Directory architectural changes/configuration, and file/share permissions as needed.
Work with application owners and IT peers to guide major system upgrades and new platform deployments.
Provision and document virtual machines according to OS manufacturer recommendations and business requirements.
Assist with capacity-planning efforts with the URM IT team.
Support service requests, incident resolution and change management processes.
Maintain continuing education to stay current with industry trends and new technologies.
Participate in on-call rotation.
Support team members in resolving other issues as necessary.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
CompTIA, A+ certifications required.
Net +, Security + preferred, if certification is not held, candidate MUST successfully obtain certification within one year of start date.
2-year technical degree or combination of applicable experience and education.
Excellent customer service in both face-to-face and phone communications with non-technical people.
3+ years of experience supporting user-facing enterprise applications.
Well-versed in common desktop productivity software
Well-versed in computer hardware architecture.
Solid troubleshooting and critical-thinking skills.
Well-versed in Office Online (Office 365) in addition to the above.
Well-versed in Windows Powershell scripting.
Basic level of network troubleshooting skills.
You Belong Here!
We are proud to be a part of the number one food distributor in the Inland Northwest. Since 1921 URM has been a retailer-owned business. URM’s core business is the purchasing, warehousing, and delivery of merchandise inventory to its Member-Owners. The shareholders of URM are all retail grocers who provide groceries to their local communities. URM operates on a cooperative basis, which means that all its net earnings on business done with or for its member-owners through its Patronage Departments are allocated and paid to its Member-Owners in the form of patronage dividends. Over the years, sales volume has grown to over $1 billion and employment to over 2,900 employees at URM and its subsidiaries—Rosauers Supermarkets and Peirone Produce.
We work in a supportive team environment and in addition to our amazing culture, our employees enjoy many perks, and below are a few of the highlights of our complete compensation package:
Starting at $24.75/hour DOE. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, the prevailing minimum wage for the location, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs.
Insurance Benefits – So that our non-union employees have more to take home from their paycheck, URM pays 100% of the Medical/Dental/Vision/RX Insurance premiums for the employee and over 93% for the employee’s dependents!
401k Retirement Plan with an amazing Company match up to 9% of your annual salary!
Subsidized Life Insurance for employees and great rates for the employee’s family.
Company paid Long-Term Disability insurance.
Short-Term Disability and Cancer Insurance available.
Life Flight Insurance at Special Rate.
Great vacation plan!
Six Paid Holidays and three Paid Personal Holidays.
Paid Sick Days.
Cell phone stipend provided.
Paid Volunteer Service Day! Get paid to volunteer at your favorite non-profit!
Experience enjoyable Company sponsored activities through events like URM March Madness Brackets, Family Hockey Night with the Chiefs, Holiday Mingle & Jingle with great raffle giveaways, Summer Evening Wine & Music Event, and Winter Break Movie Night, which are just a glimpse of the fun we have to offer for employees and their families!
Plus, enjoy a variety of Corporate discounts, from gym memberships, cell phone plans, to computer discounts!
We also offer an Amazing Employee Discount Program at our Company-owned Grocery Stores!!!!
URM Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of Race, Religion, Color, National Origin, Citizenship, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Age, Disability, Ancestry, Veteran Status, Genetic Information, or any other classification protected by state or federal law. We are also committed to providing a work environment that is free of all forms of discrimination, regarding recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, compensation, and all other conditions of employment. The selected candidate must be able to successfully complete a pre-employment background check, and drug test, as URM is a drug free workplace.

description:
Cloudera System Administrator
Job Category: Information Technology
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None
Employee Type: Regular
Percentage of Travel Required: None
Type of Travel: None
* * *

The Opportunity:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Cloudera CDP Private Cloud Systems Administrator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the installation, configuration, and maintenance of our on-premises Cloudera CDP Private Cloud Base clusters. This role requires a strong understanding of Linux systems and prior experience with Cloudera Manager. The administrator will ensure optimal performance, reliability, and security of the clusters, supporting our organization's data management and cloud infrastructure needs.

Responsibilities:
Install and configure Cloudera Manager to deploy and manage CDP Private Cloud Base clusters.
Monitor cluster health and performance, making adjustments as necessary to optimize operations.
Manage data storage solutions, understanding and implementing the best practices for HDFS, HBase, and Kudu.
Conduct routine maintenance and updates to ensure high availability and fault tolerance of the system.
Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to the cluster, including misconfigurations and hardware or software failures.
Implement security measures, including Hadoop security using Kerberos, Apache Ranger, and Apache Atlas to safeguard data integrity and access.
Collaborate with other IT team members to enhance data access, discovery, and compute capabilities using tools such as Apache Hive, Impala, and Spark.
Stay current with industry trends and advancements in big data technologies and cloud solutions.

Qualifications:

Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years experience as a systems administrator, with at least 1 year in a Cloudera environment.
Strong foundational knowledge in Linux systems administration.
Proficiency with Cloudera Manager and CDP Private Cloud Base installation and configuration.
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must be willing to work on site in Norco, California
Must be able to obtain a SECRET clearance
Desired:
Certifications in Cloudera or other cloud and big data technologies.
Prior experience in managing large-scale data environments.
Advanced troubleshooting and analytical skills.
______________________________________________________________________________
What You Can Expect:

A culture of integrity.
At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.
CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

A focus on continuous growth.
Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.
Learn more about CACI here.
______________________________________________________________________________
Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.
The proposed salary range for this position is:
$63,300 - 129,700 USD
CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.
title: System Administrator

description:
Description
The Digital Modernization Sector within Leidos is seeking a Senior System Administrator-Subject Matter Expert to support the DoD Mobility Classified Capability (DMCC) program as part of GSM-O II in San Antonio, TX. We’re seeking a candidate experienced and proficient with Windows server or Linux server operations, sustainment, and management activities to help ensure secure, reliable, and uninterrupted availability of the DoD's secure mobile device capability service. As a Senior System Administrator subject matter expert (SME), the candidate must be technically strong in both Network Engineering and Windows Operating Systems. You’ll work as part of a 24x7 Network Operations team responsible for managing an infrastructure comprised of a variety of servers, network appliances, and applications supporting voice and data services.
If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading!
Primary Responsibilities:
Provide expert technical knowledge to monitor and maintain an enterprise services environment consisting of Windows servers, Red Hat Enterprise Linux servers, and network appliances.
Assist mission partners with mobile device VPN connectivity debugging, user account and device management, and troubleshooting system/service access issues.
Implement and deploy scripting or automation tools to optimize processes and improve the efficiency of the environment - PowerShell, Python, Bash, Ansible, Puppet.
Be a point of escalation for lower-level technicians and higher difficulty issues.
Lead configuration updates and maintenance activities to patch, secure, and maintain systems.
Respond to, analyze, and resolve issues that degrade system or network performance to minimize downtime.
Use advanced systems and networking knowledge to develop solutions for complex technical issues.
Create and update documentation for common issues and processes, technical drawings, and related artifacts to contribute to the team’s knowledge base.
Collaborate with other technical experts and external stakeholders to provide engineering solutions for design changes and upgrades.
Mentor, lead, and train junior level team members.
Work non-standard hours (night, weekends, holidays) in support of 24x7x365 operations and sustainment environment.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 8 years of related experience or Master’s degree and 6 years of related experience. Additional experience, education and training may be considered in lieu of degree.
Active DoD SECRET clearance.
DoD-8570 IAT Level 2 certification (Security+ CE) within 6 months of hire date.
Extensive experience troubleshooting Windows OS or Linux OS, network, and domain related issue.
Minimum of 5 years experience working as a System Administrator; extensive experience performing system administration tasks - installing, maintaining, monitoring, recovering, rebuilding, upgrading, patching.
Minimum of 2 years experience working with Microsoft System Administration including lodging scripting ,Group Policy objects (GPO's) and Windows servers roles including DHCP, DNS and active directory.
Minimum of 2 years experience with SAN storage.
Extensive experience researching complex technical solutions beyond internal SOPs.
Experience working with multiple technologies and open to learning new technologies.
Fluent understanding of networking concepts such as OSI Model, LAN/WAN, IPv4/IPv6, subnetting and VLANs.
Experience maintaining systems and services in an air-gapped environment.
Ability to demonstrate good judgement, professionalism, and communicate clearly (verbal and written).
Highly proficient problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with VMWare - ESX/ESXi, vCenter, vSphere.
Experience with AD, SCCM, SQL, MySQL, SELinux, DNS, Group Policy management.
Experience configuring and maintaining network devices - switches, routers, firewalls, VPNs.
Knowledge of security policies such as DISA STIGS and general vulnerabilities management.
Certifications with major system vendors such as Microsoft, Red Hat, VMware, Cisco, Juniper, or Aruba.
GSMO
Original Posting Date:
2024-08-27
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

description:
System Administrator

Employee Type: Regular

* * *
CACI is seeking a Senior level System Administrator that will be part of an Agile team building a cloud native user interface to integrate a collaborative tool, accessing multiple databases across multiple agencies. If you thrive in a challenging, fast-paced work environment with a variety of job duties, we invite you to consider this as your next career move.

In this role you will:
Be responsible for design, maintenance and accreditation of the cloud-based solutions.
Assist with the team’s development efforts building on previous Sponsor’s work to develop accredit and deploy the next phase of this collaborative tool.
Work with the team to facilitate the projects development, providing integration support to multiple legacy database systems.
Function as the focal point for collaborative support issues.
Provide Tier 1 & 2 problem identification, diagnosis and resolution of problems.
Required Qualifications:
Active TS/SCI w/ Poly clearance
Bachelor’s degree preferably in an IT related field 8 years of related experience; or a Masters with 6 years of experience; an Associates with 10 years of experience.
DoD 8570 IAT Level II certification, Network+, or Security+
Microsoft MCSE, MCSA or VMware Certified Professional or Red Hat Linux Administration/Configuration
3+ years of directly relevant systems administration experience including hands-on experience with Windows and AWS
3+ years of advanced experience with Microsoft Windows Server 2008/2012 in a multi-domain virtual environment.
Microsoft Windows server and client administration (Windows 2008 and Windows 2012), Microsoft Exchange Server, SQL Server, Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), SharePoint Server, Backups/Restore.
Demonstrated experience with the development and maintenance automated tasks and deployments using scripting languages (e.g. Bash, Shell, Python, & Kickstart technologies)
2+ years of experience with cloud migration solutions and hybrid cloud management solutions.
2+ years of in-depth experience on system disaster recovery/COOP and backup solution engineering, implementation, and operation management.
2+ years of in-depth experience in VMWare or other virtualization technologies.
Successful track record in providing technical leadership in delivering architecture, engineering, and operation services.
Demonstrated on-the-job experience supporting System Life Cycle Maintenance
Demonstrated on-the-job experience developing and integrating multiple data sources to provide customized Dashboards for senior management and government clients.
Demonstrated integration experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL in a cloud native environment
Demonstrated experience designing, configuring, and maintaining the Information Technology Infrastructure associated with an IT system hosted in the C2S environment.
Demonstrated experience reviewing and assessing impact of proposed scope changes to future architectures. Experience accrediting IT systems under the ICD 503 Certification and Accreditation Process.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing. Strong public speaking skills and professional demeanor required.
Ability to create original documentation; experienced in creating Architectural Diagrams.
Experience producing database-related documentation such as administration policies, procedures, standards and guidelines
Ability to work independently with limited supervision.
These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
ITIL Foundation Certification
AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials
Microsoft MCSE, MCSA
VMware Certified Professional
Oracle Certified Associate (OCA)
Professional Scrum Developer
Red Hat Linux Administration/Configuration
CCNA/CCNP
DoD 8570 IAT Level III certification
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP)
Demonstrated experience supporting a ticketing system based on Remedy.
What we can offer you:
At CACI, our philosophy of employee development and advancement rests on a cultural foundation of providing unlimited and equal opportunity for growth, recognition, and rewards. We provide the environment, support and responsive, available management to nurture and stretch your abilities. We also offer a career mobility program to make it easy to build a dynamic career at CACI and offer flexible work schedule arrangements to support work/life balance.
CACI’s Flexible Time Off (FTO) plan allows employees to take vacation as needed, without a set number of minimum or maximum days, and is available day one of employment.
CACI has been named one of Fortune magazine’s World’s Most Admired Companies for 2024!

With over 25,000 employees worldwide, CACI has been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.
For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

A culture of integrity.
At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.
CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. A focus on continuous growth.
Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.

description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
The MITRE Naval Aviation Systems Department’s (N233) mission is to advance Naval Aviation solutions with urgency, ensuring warfighter dominance against current and future adversaries in defense of our nation. This is accomplished by delivering timely, effective, and sustainable capabilities to ensure the warfighter’s mission success and safe return home.
Job Description:
Apply full range of knowledge to maintain technical security of information systems processing classified information.
Work in a classified environment where there are government compliance audits.
Configure, maintain, troubleshoot, and secure systems and network devices to comply with DISA Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs).
Maintain records on workstations, servers, routers, firewalls, network switches, etc. to include system upgrades.
Update servers, clients, applications, antivirus updates, maintain Active Directory, DNS, Continuous Monitoring logging, SCAP, etc.
Possess working knowledge of Window 10/Sever 2012/2016 and experience with troubleshooting applicable systems.
Assist ISSM/ISSO with coordination between sponsors, MITRE project leaders, and MITRE’s accreditation officials to obtain formal accreditation to operate classified information systems.
Research new hardware / software products to acquire life cycle replacements and maintain software licenses.
Apply security patches and update Anti-Virus.
Work in a classified environment where there are government compliance audits.
Have a familiarity with network concepts, Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems, client-server architectures, virtualization technologies, and basic troubleshooting concepts.
Independently identify relevant technologies/topics and learn new technical skills.
Basic Qualifications:
Typically requires 7 years of experience and an Associate degree in relevant discipline or a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent combination of related education and work experience.
Active Secret Clearance with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI
In accordance with DoD 8570.01M, the selected individual must meet the requirements of an IAT Level II as a condition of employment and computing environment training/certification.
Security+ certification
3-5 years relevant system administration experience
This position requires a minimum of 50% hybrid on-site presence.
Preferred Qualifications:
BS Degree in relevant discipline
5-8 years relevant experience
TS/SCI Clearance

This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):
Secret
This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):
Top Secret/SCI
Work Location Type:
Hybrid
